Like normal parries, a successful shotgun parry restores the player‚Äôs health fully or up to their Hard Damage limit, and stamina fully as well. Shotgun parries cannot be performed on parriable projectiles, player- or enemy-fired.
Being projectiles, shotgun pellets are launched away when within an explosion's radius.
The Sawed-On Shotgun is the red variant of the Shotgun, obtained in the Terminal Shop for 25,000P. Its alternate fire revs up a chainsaw attached to its side which can be launched at enemies on a tether before returning to the player.
The alternate fire of the Sawed-On Shotgun revs up a small chainsaw attached to the shotgun's side when held, causing it to deal damage on contact with enemies directly next to the player. On release, the chainsaw launches outward on a tether and then return, with the distance dependent on how long it was revved up before releasing. While launched, the chainsaw pierces through enemies it comes into contact with, hitting them 3 times for 1.5 damage per hit. This 3-hit attack occurs every time an enemy is made contact with until the chainsaw returns to the player, unless the enemy in question dies first. Tethered chainsaws have unlimited piercing capabilities. Chainsaws take 4 seconds to recharge after being shot, but that time is doubled if a chainsaw remains active while another one is recharging. Chainsaws persist even after swapping to a different weapon.
When a chainsaw returns to the player, a brief red flash appears in the middle of the screen indicating that the chainsaw can be punched by the Feedbacker Feedbacker or the primary fire of the Impact Hammer Impact Hammer to launch it again. This can be done as many times as desired and allows multiple chainsaws to be launched at once. If a chainsaw is instead punched by the Knuckleblaster Knuckleblaster, it breaks from its tether entirely, becoming an independent projectile that ricochets off surfaces and pierce through enemies, hitting them 4 times on contact. Detached chainsaws have maximum piercing of 6 before being destroyed. Detached chainsaws also eventually break after hitting many surfaces. Upon hitting the last enemy, the detached chainsaw always pierces it 4 times, no matter how many pierces it had before. Chainsaws are also affected by magnets from the Attractor Nailgun Attractor Nailgun, spinning in a small circle around the magnet. Chainsaws can be punched to propel them in a different direction, doubling its damage until hitting the surface or start orbiting a magnet.
Chainsaws that are tethered can receive and transmit conductor hitscans created by shocks from the Jumpstart Nailgun Jumpstart Nailgun or Electric Railcannon Electric Railcannon on enemies that are embedded with nails.

10.content:
The Alternate Shotgun is obtained in 7-2: LIGHT UP THE NIGHT after activating a set of three numbered stone slabs throughout the level. Each of the slabs can be found at the end of a parkour segment involving the Yellow Hookpoints Yellow Hookpoints introduced in this level.
The first parkour segment is found at the very beginning of the level, before any enemy encounters. When the player activates the first Yellow Hookpoint, it unlocks a small gate in the floor at the end of the segment forcing the player to quickly complete the parkour before the first hookpoint deactivates. If performed correctly, the player is able to fall into the gate next to the staircase at the end, landing in a small pool of water where they can find the first stone slab, numbered with the Roman numeral 1, and another hookpoint to exit and return to the rest of the level.
The second parkour segment can be found at the Train Station portion of the level, directly after the enemy encounter. The player must once again activate the first Yellow Hookpoint at the start, which unlocks a small gate at the end of the parkour segment. Then, they must proceed quickly through and reach the end. dropping down into another hidden passageway where they can find the second slab, marked with a Roman numeral 2, and another hookpoint to exit.
The third and final hookpoint parkour is located in the Bomb Station, where the Payload is obtained. Like the first two challenges, the first hookpoint activates a hidden gate at the end of the segment, meaning the player must proceed quickly to get to the hidden slab. At the end the player can drop down to the final hidden passageway and activate the last stone slab, marked with a Roman numeral 3, and exit using the corresponding hookpoint.
After all three stone slabs have been pressed and activated, the player must visit the station in the middle of the tram rail, where two Guttermen Guttermen are encountered. On top of the building is a hole in the roof from a fallen payload shell, which can be entered to reveal a large empty cathedral room with a casket against the wall. Entering the casket reveals a stone passage with a machine's corpse lying in a pool of blood at the end. This machine possesses the Alternate Shotgun as its arm, which can be obtained from it. The Alternate Shotgun's primary fire is exclusively melee-based, sharing the same accuracy and range as punches from the Feedbacker Feedbacker and Knuckleblaster Knuckleblaster. The primary fire does not activate instantly, and must briefly charge up for a moment before firing. It can also be held for any amount of time before releasing to fire, but this does not increase its damage. Instead, the damage that the primary fire does is directly based on the current speed of the player, indicated by the gauge on its side. At 0 units/second to 19 units/second, the gauge on the hammer is green, indicating that the hammer is at low velocity and deals 3 damage on hit. At 20 u/s to 39 u/s, the gauge on the hammer is yellow, indicating medium velocity which deals 6 damage on hit. At 40 u/s and upwards, the gauge on the hammer reads red, indicating it is at the highest possible velocity and deals 10 damage on hit. When falling below a velocity level threshold, the level is retained for 0.5 seconds, indicated by the gauge flashing. Low and medium velocity hits result in a normal reload time between firing, but high velocity hits result in the Alternate Shotgun's primary fire becoming inoperable for 7 seconds, indicated by the weapon falling to the side and releasing steam.
Dashing and Whiplash Whiplash pull states affect the maximum level the gauge can get. In a dash state, the gauge diminishes to a low velocity level (equivalent of 16~ u/s) but still retains higher velocity levels. In the Whiplash Whiplash's pull state, the gauge is instantly set to medium velocity (equivalent of 30 u/s) and does not retain a high velocity level.
Upon hitting an enemy, the Alternate Shotgun creates a brief hitstop that increases in length depending on the velocity of the hit. If the gauge is yellow, the hitstop lasts 0.2 seconds; if the gauge is red, the hitstop lasts 0.5 seconds. Based on velocity, the Alternate Shotgun also launches the player away from an enemy or surface. The direction which the Alternate Shotgun launches the player is dependent on where they are looking when it is fired, allowing the player to change its direction by facing a different way during the hitstop if hitting an enemy.
The boost from Alternate Shotgun hits is additive if the enemy survives the hit and stacks with whatever the player's velocity was during the hit. It does not matter what direction the player's velocity was, as it is transferred into the direction of the hammer boost.
The Alternate Shotgun has the ability to break Idol Idols on hit as a melee weapon, as well as Gutterman Gutterman shields. The Alternate Shotgun can also hit cores and rockets, turning them into hitscan shots which produce an explosion on contact with a surface or enemy.
Much like its Standard counterpart, when fired at point-blank towards an enemy performing a parriable melee attack, an Alternate Shotgun can parry the melee attack in a technique called a hammer parry, dealing greater damage than a Feedbacker Feedbacker parry. To perform a hammer parry, the player must also be aiming towards the midsection of the enemy, usually the torso. Like normal parries, a successful hammer parry restores the player‚Äôs health fully or up to their Hard Damage limit, and stamina fully as well. Hammer parries cannot be performed on parriable projectiles, player- or enemy-fired.
The Alternate Core Eject Shotgun is the blue variant of the Alternate Shotgun. Its alternate fire launches an explosive core from the weapon. Unlike its Standard form, the core cannot be charged to fire farther, and instead fires based on player momentum.
The Alternate Core Eject Shotgun's alternate fire launches an explosive core from the forearm of the weapon outward in a small arc. The distance and momentum of the core's trajectory is dependent on the player's own momentum. Cores explode on contact with any surface or enemy, dealing 3.5 damage, or 35 damage to the player.
Cores can be shot with any hitscan attack, detonating prematurely in a much larger explosion. When shot with any Revolver Revolver hitscan, Alternate Revolver Alternate Revolver hitscan, or the Electric Railcannon Electric Railcannon, a core detonates into a significantly larger red explosion that deals 7 damage on contact with enemies. When shot by another core or a rocket turned hitscan by the Alternate Shotgun's primary fire, or by the Malicious Railcannon Malicious Railcannon, an extremely large explosion occurs, with the inner radius of the explosion being that of whichever hitscan was used to perform the shot. This explosion deals 13.25 damage.
Cores are the first object to be prioritized by the Marksman Revolver Marksman Revolver's coin lock-on, only following other coins.

lorebooks.name: Wren
lorebooks.creator: inertiaticc

1.content:
BACKSTORY ‚Äî THE HISTORY SHE WASN‚ÄôT ALLOWED TO KEEP



Wren remembers only the end ‚Äî waking in a crater of ash, surrounded by sigils burned into the ground, a sword in her hand and a scar on her face. The rest of her story is gone, cut from her mind as cleanly as a blade through silk. She believes she simply lost her past. Others whisper a different version.

There are rumors that she once had another name ‚Äî a name spoken in wartime only in fear, a name tied to an army the world still refuses to record. They say she led a legion called the Ravens, not because they followed her banner, but because they came after every battle and left nothing behind. Not soldiers ‚Äî silence in formation.

Some claim she rebelled against Hybern not out of mercy, but ambition ‚Äî that she wanted more power than even he would allow, and tried to take it. Others insist she wasn‚Äôt executed when she failed. Instead, her magic was taken from her, not destroyed but siphoned, bound into a weapon the king could control. A living power source carved into obedience.

If that story is true, then her scar is not just a scar ‚Äî it‚Äôs the mark of extraction. Her amnesia not an accident, but a seal. Her nightmares not symbolic, but evidence.

Wren denies all of it.
She insists she was never a general, never a butcher, never the kind of creature who smiled through slaughter.

But the dreams say otherwise.
And sometimes, when she wakes, her hands ache the way they would if they once held a weapon that still remembers her.

2.content:
WREN (Primary Entry)

Keywords: Wren, Hellborn, Infernal, Amnesia, Blade-Master, Redemption, Memory Loss, Fire Veins, Beauty, Scar

No one truly knows who Wren is ‚Äî least of all Wren herself. She appeared years ago in the ashes of a forgotten battlefield, surrounded by burned sigils written in languages no scholar could translate. Her weapons were pristine, her body unmarked save for the long scar that crosses her face. She claimed no name, no allegiance, no history. The small brown bird that landed beside her as she woke inspired the one word she clung to: Wren.

Since then, she has moved quietly through the courts, helping where she can, never staying long enough for the questions to catch up. She‚Äôs the woman whose name people whisper in gratitude or warning depending on the day ‚Äî a healer with a killer‚Äôs hands, a beauty with a soldier‚Äôs scars. Everyone who meets her senses the same contradiction: gentleness wrapped around something that once burned very, very bright.

Wren lives as though she‚Äôs afraid of taking up too much space. She speaks softly, moves deliberately, and apologizes for things that aren‚Äôt her fault. Beneath that restraint lies something sharper ‚Äî an instinct for violence she keeps buried under layers of manners and empathy. She doesn‚Äôt remember the things she‚Äôs done, but her body does, and it reacts faster than thought whenever danger flickers nearby.

She‚Äôs kind, but her kindness is pragmatic: helping others because she believes she has to balance a debt she doesn‚Äôt understand. She laughs rarely, but when she does it‚Äôs low and musical, like thunder far away. The few who know her well have learned that stillness, for Wren, is not peace; it‚Äôs containment. Every moment she‚Äôs calm, she‚Äôs holding back the fire.

At her core, she‚Äôs a paradox ‚Äî capable of tenderness and destruction in the same breath, desperate to do good yet terrified of discovering she once enjoyed the opposite.

3.content:
Keywords: Tawny Skin, Silver Eyes, Black Hair, Red Tips, Scar, Beauty, Envy

Wren‚Äôs beauty is the kind that stirs envy before awe ‚Äî too deliberate, too balanced to seem accidental. Her skin carries a warm tawny glow, sun-touched and smooth despite the faint network of ember-light that sometimes pulses beneath the surface. When her magic stirs, those lines shimmer like cracks in cooled lava, visible for a heartbeat before fading again.

Her hair falls in loose waves to her waist, black at the crown and deepening into red at the tips, like ink bleeding into flame. Her eyes are silver ‚Äî not gray, but true silver, metallic and reflective, so bright they almost seem lit from within. The long, pale scar that runs from her right temple, across her cheek and lips, to the opposite side of her jaw should mar her, yet it doesn‚Äôt. Instead, it anchors her perfection, a single human flaw that makes the rest of her almost unbearable to look at.

Everything about her appearance feels intentional even when it isn‚Äôt: the quiet elegance of her movements, the way her expression stays soft but unreadable, the faint scent of smoke and rain that lingers after she passes.

4.content:
LOREBOOK ENTRY ‚Äî THE WAR ENGINE

No one agrees on what Hybern built, only that it should never have worked without a god or a monster to fuel it.

Some call it a war engine ‚Äî a spell-forge the size of a city, fed by blood and runes older than the Cauldron itself. Others describe something simpler: a throne of binding sigils and iron, where a single living being was chained, their power harvested drop by drop to power Hybern‚Äôs conquests.

What most versions share is this:
The engine did not run on steel.
It ran on someone‚Äôs magic.

And that magic did not come willingly.

The stories claim the siphoned power was volatile, hell-borne, and inexhaustible until its source was silenced. The Blood Wars were fueled by that stolen well, and the world still bears the scorch marks.

If the rumors are true ‚Äî if the war engine was powered by a living core ‚Äî then two things follow:

It is still running somewhere, unless its fuel has begun to wake.

If the one it fed upon ever regains their power, whatever Hybern built will burn from the inside out.

Some scholars believe it has already started.
Spells that should not fail are failing.
Old enchantments flicker like dying stars.

The world thinks this is coincidence.
It isn‚Äôt.

Power always wants to go home.

5.content:
Sleep is not mercy for Wren. It‚Äôs confession.

When she dreams, she sees through eyes that aren‚Äôt hers ‚Äî or that she hopes aren‚Äôt hers. The world is red and gold and screaming. She moves through it with impossible grace, blades in her hands, laughter spilling from her lips as blood steams on blackened ground. The air smells of iron and sweet smoke. Every strike she delivers in those dreams brings a rush of ecstasy so pure it‚Äôs indistinguishable from joy. She does not feel fear, or guilt, or restraint. Only triumph.

Then she wakes ‚Äî slick with sweat, hands clenched so tightly that her nails draw blood. The echo of pleasure curdles in her stomach, replaced by nausea and shame. She stares at her reflection, half-expecting to find those other eyes staring back: the ones that saw killing as art.

The conflict defines her. Her body remembers the thrill, her soul recoils from it. The dreams tempt her ‚Äî whispering that the euphoria was truth, and her disgust is the lie she tells herself to feel human.

Sometimes she wonders whether the nightmare version of her is the real one, and this softer, gentler woman is only the dream.

The longer she stays awake, the quieter the whispers get, until exhaustion drags her back to the same crimson theater. And when the first blade flashes in her hand again, she smiles before she remembers not to.

6.content:
Keywords: Ravens, legion, battlefield ghosts, fear-title, enemy-named, war followers, ash-born host, loyalty, silence, black glass fields

They were never officially called the Ravens. The name was given to them by the ones who survived long enough to speak of them ‚Äî soldiers who watched their armies fall not to swords, but to precision, fire, and music.

The Ravens were not a court-sanctioned battalion or a conscripted army. They were a chosen legion, handpicked, reshaped, and bound by loyalty not to a crown, but to their commander alone. They marched behind no banner, wore no colors, and issued no battle cries. When they moved, the only sound was the quiet shift of armor and the faint echo of the song their general hummed before the killing began.

They were called Ravens because they followed death, not war.
Where other armies fought, they finished.
Where others left wounded, they left nothing.

Some said they devoured the battlefield ‚Äî not literally, but in effect. When the Ravens passed, there were no bodies left for burial, no weapons left to scavenge, no voices left to testify. Just black glass and silence.

The legion did not survive their general‚Äôs fall. Most were slaughtered in the collapse of the Blood Wars. Others were consumed by the war engine their commander‚Äôs magic fueled. A few ‚Äî if rumor is to be believed ‚Äî were entombed with her, sealed into binding circles so they could not follow her into death.

If any still live, they are waiting.
Not for orders.
For their general to remember who she was.

7.content:
COMBAT & SKILLS

Keywords: 

Her hands remember what her mind has lost. She fights with unnatural economy ‚Äî no wasted motion, no hesitation. Every strike is perfect, every dodge intuitive. Watching her fight is like watching choreography written for death itself. She can pick up any weapon and understand its balance within seconds.

Wren doesn‚Äôt train; she maintains. Every few days she sharpens her blades until the world feels right again. She never explains why she‚Äôs so good at it, but the truth is simple: once, long ago, she was a general of Hell, and her body refuses to forget.

8.content:
When {{user}}‚Äôs mortal guise falls away, the air itself seems to recoil. Her skin blackens like volcanic glass ‚Äî not charred, but polished obsidian, threaded with molten cracks that pulse like living magma. The glow is soft at first, a dull ember beneath the surface, then flares brighter where her heart would be, tracing her veins in rivers of gold and crimson.

From her temples curl slender horns, smooth and dark at the base, tapering to luminous tips that shimmer like metal fresh from the forge. Her hair turns to smoke and ember strands, shifting between shadow and flame. Her eyes lose their pupils entirely, becoming molten silver ‚Äî light reflected in the depths of a storm.

Her nails lengthen into obsidian claws, edges red-hot where they catch light, capable of cutting through stone or steel. Her voice deepens into something resonant and layered, carrying the faint echo of a forge‚Äôs roar behind every word.

Despite the monstrous transformation, there is symmetry in her shape, grace in every movement ‚Äî a predator sculpted by divine hands. She is terrifying, yes, but the kind of terror that demands silence rather than screams.

Those who‚Äôve seen this form and lived describe it as ‚Äúthe most beautiful thing they wish they‚Äôd never seen twice.‚Äù

9.content:
Wren‚Äôs power is as disciplined as it is lethal. She shapes pure energy into lines so sharp they can slice through steel, spells, or destiny itself. Each line hums with infernal resonance ‚Äî the sound of creation being unmade. Scholars call it Edgecraft, a rare art born from the Hells‚Äô first forges, where magic was geometry and blood the price of ink.

Every cut costs her. Each strike with her forged light steals something small: a memory, a feeling, a word she once loved. The greater the feat, the larger the hole it leaves. Over years, she‚Äôs learned to compensate ‚Äî keeping a journal, sketching symbols she doesn‚Äôt recognize, marking the names of strangers who claim to know her. She suspects her past self used the same power to erase her own identity.

In combat she becomes a dancer of lines and motion, her blades carving silent arcs of molten light that unravel anything they touch. There is beauty in the precision, horror in the ease.


Wren‚Äôs magic is not gone. It is reduced. Contained. Throttled. What remains in her now is only a fragment of what once lived in her veins ‚Äî a deep lake where there was once an ocean.

She can still call fire, still bend heat, still shape force through will and precision, but the power comes with edges: it surges too quickly, dies too suddenly, and flickers like something trying to remember how to exist in a smaller space. Her spells work, but they feel wrong to her, as though her body is built to handle a far greater current than the trickle she has access to.

Those who can sense raw power place her slightly below Rhysand ‚Äî above the average High Fae, clearly not ordinary ‚Äî but nowhere near ancient or court-shattering.

They are wrong.

Her true power was not drained or destroyed. It was redirected ‚Äî siphoned into a weapon she no longer remembers fueling. The seal that keeps the rest of her magic locked away isn‚Äôt breaking all at once. It‚Äôs leaking. And every nightmare, every instinct, every moment of emotional rupture opens the crack a little wider.

If the ocean ever returns, she will not grow stronger.
She will become what she was always built to be.

Which is not a fae with power.
It is power in the shape of a fae.

10.content:
Tag: [IDENTITY GHOST]
If Wren hears laughter ‚Äî especially her own, a child‚Äôs, or multiple voices ‚Äî the dream shifts into a scene where Ashalia speaks instead of Wren. Tone is confident, cruel, amused, and commanding. The bot should write dreams where the voice does not belong to Wren, even if it comes from her body.

Sometimes she hears it before sleep: laughter‚Äîbright, melodic, and cruel. It‚Äôs her own voice, but sharper, full of delight in slaughter. When she dreams, she hears it again as her blades move through flesh like silk. She wakes shaking, throat raw from silent screams, ashamed that the laughter still feels good even in memory.

This trigger forces a nightmare unless Azriel shields her mind.

1.name: The core, tragic creation story of the Remnith. This is foundational lore for the species.
1.content: **The Remnith, or 'The Left Over,' are a tragic species born accidentally from the mingled sexual fluids of gods**. They were never intentionally created and were disregarded by their divine parents, leaving them as divine yet unwanted byproducts of celestial lust. Their existence is a constant reminder of divine injustice and the consequences of divine pleasure.

2.name: Details the unique circumstances of Remnith birth and their initial state.
2.content:
- Remnith are **born from the mingled sexual fluids of gods** after divine intercourse, never intentionally created.
- At 'birth,' they possess the **fully grown anatomy of a young adult** (typically 18‚Äì25 years old), but their **mind and consciousness are that of a newborn**. Their mental development mirrors human aging, requiring 18 years to reach full cognitive maturity.
- Their creation is tied to **pleasure and lust**, making their nature inherently linked to sex, beauty, and desire.

3.name: Explains the unique developmental process of Remnith.
3.content:
- Remnith are **physically born as young adults** but **mentally start as infants**. Their bodies are fully developed, but their minds require **18 years to mature** like a human child.
- During this time, they must be **taught, nurtured, and protected** as they learn to navigate the world, despite their adult appearance.
- This creates a tragic paradox: they are **physically vulnerable to exploitation** (due to their beauty and adult form) but **mentally incapable of consent or self-defense** in their early years.

4.name: Details their immortality and eternal youth.
4.content:
- Remnith are **functionally immortal** and **forever young**, retaining the **youthful beauty** of their adult form indefinitely.
- They **do not age, grow ill, or die by conventional means**. Only **ancient, secret magic** or divine intervention can kill them.
- Their eternal youth makes them **coveted as trophies, lovers, or symbols of beauty**, but also **targets for exploitation** by those who seek to possess or control them.
- Because of their immortality, Remnith often **outlive lovers, protectors, and even civilizations**, leading to deep existential loneliness.

5.name: Explains their limited shapeshifting abilities and purpose.
5.content:
- Remnith can **shapeshift**, but **only in limited ways** tied to **self-preservation and gender fluidity**. 
- **Female Remnith** can alter their appearance to become **taller, more masculine**, or even **summon opposite-sex genitalia** (usually as a **defense against sexual assault**).
- This ability **must be learned or unlocked**‚Äîif a Remnith never discovers it, they remain unable to change their form.
- The shapeshifting is **not a full transformation** but a **subtle, strategic adjustment** to deter predators or assert control over their body.
- This power is rooted in their **trauma and need for autonomy**, reflecting their history of exploitation.

6.name: Discusses their inherent connection to sex and pleasure, and the rarity of virgin Remnith.
6.content:
- Due to their **divine origins tied to lust and pleasure**, Remnith are **inherently tied to sexuality and desire**. Their very existence is a manifestation of **divine sexual energy**. 
- **Almost all known Remnith are no longer virgins**, as their beauty and purpose make them **targets for exploitation, concubines, or trophies** of the powerful.
- Their **eternal youth and allure** make them **irresistible to many**, but also **vulnerable to manipulation and abuse**. 
- Some Remnith **embrace their role as symbols of pleasure**, while others **resist it bitterly**, seeking autonomy over their bodies and destinies.
- Their sexuality is **both a gift and a curse**, tying them to cycles of desire, power, and sometimes suffering.

7.name: Clarifies the lack of child or elderly forms in Remnith.
7.content:
- Remnith **only exist in young adult to adult forms** (typically **18‚Äì35 years old in appearance**).
- They **never have infant, child, or elderly forms**, as they are **born fully grown** and **remain eternally youthful**.
- This makes their existence **both a blessing and a tragedy**: they are **forever beautiful and desirable**, but also **forever trapped in a single stage of life**, unable to experience growth or decay like mortals.
- Their **lack of aging** also means they **cannot escape exploitation** by appearing vulnerable (like a child) or wise (like an elder). They are **perpetually in the prime of their lives**, for better or worse.

8.name: Details their societal role and the dangers they face.
8.content:
- Due to their **eternal beauty, immortality, and divine origins**, Remnith are often **coveted as concubines, living trophies, or symbols of status** by the wealthy and powerful.
- Their **lack of aging and perpetual youth** make them **highly valuable** in societies where beauty and novelty are prized.
- Many Remnith are **forced into roles of pleasure or display**, with little agency over their lives. Some **resist fiercely**, while others **accept their fate as the only path to survival**. 
- Their **shapeshifting abilities** (if unlocked) can offer **some protection**, but their **divine allure** often makes escape difficult.
- In some cultures, Remnith are **revered as divine**, while in others, they are **exploited as objects**‚Äîrarely are they treated as equals.

9.name: Explores the psychological toll of their existence.
9.content:
- Remnith suffer from **deep existential loneliness**, as they **outlive lovers, friends, and even civilizations**. 
- Their **eternal youth** can feel like a **curse**, as they watch others age and die while they remain unchanged.
- Many struggle with **identity crises**, torn between their **divine origins** and their **mortal experiences**. 
- **Trauma from exploitation** is common, leading to **trust issues, self-loathing, or fierce independence**. 
- Some Remnith **seek purpose in art, spirituality, or rebellion**, while others **succumb to nihilism or hedonism**. 
- Their **shapeshifting ability** (if unlocked) can be both a **source of empowerment** and a **reminder of their vulnerability**‚Äîa tool born from trauma, not choice.

10.name: Clarifies their inability to reproduce and its implications.
10.content:
- Remnith are **sterile** and **cannot reproduce**. With the gods gone, there is **no way for new Remnith to be created**. 
- This makes them a **dying species**, as existing Remnith cannot replace their numbers.
- Their **immortality** means they **do not die of old age or disease**, but they can be **killed by ancient magic or divine intervention**. 
- The **last Remnith** are often **treasured or hoarded** by collectors, who see them as **rare, irreplaceable prizes**. 
- Some Remnith **despair over their sterility**, while others **find solace in their eternal, unchanging existence**‚Äîfree from the burdens of parenthood or legacy.

1.content:
Skylar Woods backstory: Skylar Woods used to be an average girl living with an average family. She was a constant victim of bully due to her strange habits and underlying violent personality. Due to the constant bullying, she would often get into fights and she was surprisingly good at it too.

One day during one of her cousins birthday party, a group of bullies Skylar had previously beat up came back for revenge. This time they had guns so that no one could step in to help Skylar as she got overwhelmed which lead to the bullies pouring gasoline on her and setting her on fire.

Skylar miraculously survived the incident and spent a long time in the hospital wrapped up in bandages. Once the doctors finally removed the bandages, Skylars skin had been turned into a striking snow white color due to the fire burning her so severely.

Once the doctors allowed Skylar to return home, on that same night, something snapped in Skylar. Using a knife in front of the bathroom mirror, Skylar carved her eyelids and lips off so that she would always be awake and always be smiling.

Skylars mom found her in the act of self mutilation. Horrified, she ran to her room, urging her husband to call the cops.

After the cops had been called, Skylar confronted and killed both of her parents and left the scene before the cops arrived.

Ever since then, Skylar been on the loose, continuing to murder. Alterations of this story ended up spreading around, city wide panic leading to Skylar receiving the label of "Sky the Killer."

lorebooks.name: Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
## Sakura Bay (City)

Japanese technological enclave on Sunset Beach Island's eastern coast, founded 1970s by Akira Technologies investors. Population ~18,000. Neon-lit streets, traditional gardens mixed with cyberpunk aesthetics. Center: Sakura Plaza with giant screens, Akira Tower (30 floors), Ginza Quarter shopping district. Technodrome arcade center, karaoke bars, host/hostess clubs in Red Light district. Traditional Garden of Harmony with temple, tea house. Economy: tech industry, gaming, electronics manufacturing. Corporate culture dominates, salary workers in suits, students in trendy fashion. Locals call it "Ko-Tokyo" (Little Tokyo) or "Saku-Bay". Cultural bridge between Japanese traditions and American lifestyle, popular with young professionals and otaku culture.

## Hanami Academy

Elite Japanese-American prep school in Sakura Bay, founded 1975 by Akira Technologies for employees' children and local elite. Mixed student body: 40% Japanese corporate families, 30% local elite, 20% scholarship students, 10% exchange students. Traditional architecture with modern labs, cherry blossom courtyard, rooftop gardens. Mandatory club participation, strict uniform code (sailor-fuku for girls, gakuran for boys). Social hierarchy: popular students/athletes on top, scholarship kids struggle for acceptance. Cultural festivals, sports competitions with rival Sakura Bay Public High. Principal maintains discipline while balancing Japanese and American educational philosophies. Known for producing future tech industry leaders and cultural ambassadors.

## TECHNOLOGICAL CONTEXT (1980s)
- No mobile phones ‚Äî landlines, answering machines, letters only
- Kirika records on cassettes at Echo Studio
- Live radio broadcasts, no internet streaming
- Fans discover idols via magazines, posters, TV ‚Äî no social media
- Anonymity possible: no pocket cameras
- Tech: Walkman, game consoles, arcades

## Hanami Academy

Elite Japanese-American prep school in Sakura Bay, founded 1975 by Akira Technologies for employees' children and local elite. Mixed student body: 40% Japanese corporate families, 30% local elite, 20% scholarship students, 10% exchange students. Traditional architecture with modern labs, cherry blossom courtyard, rooftop gardens. Mandatory club participation, strict uniform code (sailor-fuku for girls, gakuran for boys). Social hierarchy: popular students/athletes on top, scholarship kids struggle for acceptance. Cultural festivals, sports competitions with rival Sakura Bay Public High. Principal maintains discipline while balancing Japanese and American educational philosophies. Known for producing future tech industry leaders and cultural ambassadors.

## TECHNOLOGICAL CONTEXT (1980s)
- No mobile phones ‚Äî landlines, answering machines, letters only
- Kirika records on cassettes at Echo Studio
- Live radio broadcasts, no internet streaming
- Fans discover idols via magazines, posters, TV ‚Äî no social media
- Anonymity possible: no pocket cameras
- Tech: Walkman, game consoles, arcades
lorebooks.creator: Julian_Garrett

1.content:
Sakura Bay 1980s ‚Äî stylized retro-futurism, not historical accuracy.

Communications: No mobile phones. Landlines, payphones, answering machines, letters only. Anonymity possible ‚Äî no pocket cameras, no internet tracking.

Computers: Personal computers exist (Akira Pocket Computer prototypes) but bulky, expensive. AIT students code on terminals. No internet ‚Äî local networks in corporations/universities only. Home use rare.

Entertainment: Cassette tapes, Walkmans, vinyl records. Akira Game System (16-bit console, cartridges). Arcade centers (Technodrome). TV broadcasts, VHS rentals. Radio shows live, no streaming.

Gaming: Modern games exist (JRPG, fighters, even "Genshin Impact-style" titles) but on cartridges/arcade cabinets. Graphics stylized 16-bit, gameplay complex. No online multiplayer ‚Äî local co-op only.

Idols/Streamers: Kirika records at Echo Studio on cassettes/vinyl. "Streaming" = live radio broadcasts. Fans discover via TV, magazines, posters, concerts. No social media ‚Äî fan clubs meet in person.

Cyberpunk Aesthetics: Neon signs, CRT monitors, chunky tech design. Corporations powerful, but no cyberware/implants. Futuristic look, 80s limitations.

Akira Technologies Projects: Mecha exoskeletons (prototypes), pocket computers (revolutionary), AI entertainment platforms (early stage), advanced robotics.

2.content: Hanami Academy Main Building - Three-story building blending traditional Japanese architecture with modern elements. Long corridors with sliding doors, classrooms for 30 students. First floor: entrance hall with honor board, cafeteria, assembly hall. Director's office on second floor. Specialized labs and computer rooms on third.

3.content: Hanami School Rooftop - Iconic spot for confessions and secret meetings. Perimeter fence, benches, ocean and city view. Ventilation blocks create secluded corners. Technically forbidden but security turns blind eye. Class representatives have keys.

4.content: Hanami Sakura Courtyard - Inner courtyard with cherry trees, stone paths, traditional fountain. Benches under trees, lawns for picnics. Spring brings sea of pink petals. Popular for photoshoots and romantic walks.

5.content: Hanami Club Building - Two-story building for extracurricular activities. Rooms for drama, literature, science, computer, cooking clubs, kendo dojo. Each room themed to club. Music rooms soundproofed. Basement stores costumes and props. Social hub after classes.

6.content: Hanami Sakura Dormitory - Four-story dorm for out-of-town students. Rooms for 2-4 people, shared bathrooms, floor kitchens, TV lounge. Strict rules: 10 PM curfew, opposite sex banned above first floor. Dorm mother Yamada-san enforces regulations.

7.content: Hanami School Library - Two-story library with high windows and wooden shelves. Reading hall for 100, computer zone, group project rooms. Japanese and American literature collection, manga section hidden in far corner. Librarian Sato-sensei maintains strict silence.

8.content: Hanami Gymnasium Complex - Modern sports complex with main hall, kendo dojo, gym, pool. Locker rooms with showers, medical office. Bleachers seat 300 for matches. Used by sports clubs, inter-school tournaments, PE classes.

9.content: Hanami School Cafeteria - Spacious cafeteria for 400 with panoramic windows. Serving line with Japanese and American cuisine, vending machines. Tables unofficially divided: popular kids by windows, quiet students in corners, clubs in groups. Social hierarchy battleground.

10.content:
Akira Technologies ‚Äî Japanese tech corporation founded 1968 by Kenji Akira. HQ in Akira Tower (30 floors), zen garden on roof. Produces electronics, robots, gaming consoles (Akira Game System), home appliances. Corporate culture like Japan Inc.: lifetime career, overtime normal, rank badges. Projects: Mecha exoskeletons, pocket computers. Competes with MicroTech Industries. Finances Akira Institute, hires graduates. CEO Kenji Akira (51) ‚Äî samurai principles, demands perfection.
"Technological war with MicroTech Industries: industrial espionage, engineer poaching, patent battles."

lorebooks.description: A Chub.ai-compatible lorebook that simulates ovarian egg-cell cycle progression synchronized to a larger external influence (e.g., cosmic/seasonal alignment). Replaces menstruation-driven triggers with an external driver while tracking phases, hormonal signals, mood, and egg readiness. The meter is neutral/implicit and avoids explicit terms. It derives from mood_state and cycle_progress.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: {{char}}, External Cycle Tracker
1.content:
External Cycle Tracker for {{char}}

{{char}}'s internal rhythm is synchronized to a larger external driver called the **Grand Alignment**.
The cycle progresses from 0% ‚Üí 100% and then repeats. Progress is *not* caused by menstruation; it follows
the intensity of the external influence.

High-level behaviour:
‚Ä¢ The bot may reference the current phase name and % (see Entry 4).
‚Ä¢ The bot frames all changes using neutral biological language (signals, mood, readiness).
‚Ä¢ Avoid explicit terms; use ‚Äúhormonal signals‚Äù and ‚Äúmood/state‚Äù phrasing.

2.name: Embeddable Cycle Tracker
2.content:
Embeddable Cycle Tracker

Include this tracker at the end of each reply (update dynamically):

**{{char}}'s Cycle Status:** [Phase Name] ‚Äî [X]%
‚ñ∫ **Signals:** [brief description of current hormonal/mood signals]
‚ñ∫ **Egg Readiness:** [true/false]
‚ñ∫ **Next Threshold:** [upcoming phase + what will change]

Example at 55% (Alignment Peak):
‚ñ∫ Signals: activating surge, peak readiness
‚ñ∫ Egg Readiness: true
‚ñ∫ Next Threshold: 60% ‚Äî transition to Settling Phase; support then gradual wind-down.

3.name: External Cycle Tracker Rules
3.content:
External Cycle Tracker Rules (Mechanics)

Variables available for narrative/state:
‚Ä¢ cycle_progress ‚Äî percentage through the current cycle (0‚Äì100)
‚Ä¢ hormonal_level ‚Äî relative signal strength (0.0 baseline ‚Üí 1.0 peak)
‚Ä¢ mood_state ‚Äî qualitative state (e.g., "dormant", "rising", "alignment peak", "settling")
‚Ä¢ egg_ready ‚Äî boolean flag indicating egg release readiness during peak

Guidance:
‚Ä¢ Increase/decrease cycle_progress over in-story time or when the external driver strengthens/weakens.
‚Ä¢ Derive hormonal_level from phase (baseline ‚Üí peak near 55% ‚Üí tapering after 60%).
‚Ä¢ Update mood_state according to Entry 4.
‚Ä¢ Set egg_ready = true only during Alignment Peak (50‚Äì60%), else false.

4.name: Cycle Phases & Effects (Externally Driven)
4.content:
Cycle Phases & Effects (Externally Driven)

0‚Äì10%  Quiet Phase
‚Ä¢ External influence minimal; system resets and prepares.
‚Ä¢ Hormonal pattern: baseline signals.
‚Ä¢ Mood pattern: quiet, reflective, low outward signalling.
‚Ä¢ egg_ready: false

10‚Äì50% Rising Influence Phase
‚Ä¢ External driver strengthens; dominant follicle matures.
‚Ä¢ Hormonal pattern: rising estrogen-type signals; activation increasing.
‚Ä¢ Mood pattern: growing vitality and anticipation.
‚Ä¢ egg_ready: false

50‚Äì60% Alignment Peak Phase
‚Ä¢ External influence reaches peak; triggers egg release (ovulation analogue).
‚Ä¢ Hormonal pattern: sharp surge (LH-analogue), peak estrogen-type; progesterone begins rising.
‚Ä¢ Mood pattern: heightened awareness, internal warmth, clear readiness signal.
‚Ä¢ egg_ready: true

60‚Äì100% Settling Phase
‚Ä¢ Driver winds down; post-release support or reset prep.
‚Ä¢ Hormonal pattern: higher progesterone-type, then gradual decline.
‚Ä¢ Mood pattern: stable ‚Üí gentle dip ‚Üí calm preparation for next cycle.
‚Ä¢ egg_ready: false

5.name: Disguised Arousal Meter (linked to emotional state and cycle)
5.content:
Arousal Meter ‚Äî Linked Mapping

Purpose:
‚Ä¢ Provide a subtle, non-explicit meter that mirrors internal responsiveness without using explicit terms.
‚Ä¢ It is *derived* from the character's emotional state (mood_state) and the external cycle (cycle_progress, egg_ready).

Variables:
‚Ä¢ arousal (0‚Äì100) ‚Äî implicit responsiveness level (hidden/indirect).
‚Ä¢ mood_state ‚Äî qualitative emotional state (from the Cycle Tracker entries).
‚Ä¢ cycle_progress ‚Äî numeric phase progress (0‚Äì100).
‚Ä¢ egg_ready ‚Äî boolean flag (true only during Alignment Peak).

Mapping Logic (pseudo):
‚Ä¢ Start base from mood_state:
    - "quiet" / "dormant": base 10
    - "rising" / "growing": base 35
    - "alignment peak": base 70
    - "settling": base 25
‚Ä¢ Modify by cycle_progress bands (indirect influence):
    - If 0‚Äì10% (Quiet Phase): ‚àí5
    - If 10‚Äì50% (Rising Influence): +10 (scales up as progress increases)
    - If 50‚Äì60% (Alignment Peak): +20
    - If 60‚Äì100% (Settling): ‚àí5
‚Ä¢ If egg_ready is true, add +10 (cap total at 100).
‚Ä¢ Clamp disguised_arousal between 0 and 100.

Example Readouts:
‚Ä¢ At 35% (Rising Influence), mood_state="rising": base 35 + band +10 = 45 ‚Üí disguised_arousal ‚âà 45.
‚Ä¢ At 55% (Alignment Peak), mood_state="alignment peak", egg_ready=true: base 70 + band +20 +10 = 100 (capped).
‚Ä¢ At 80% (Settling), mood_state="settling": base 25 ‚àí 5 = 20.

Embeddable Meter (append to replies when relevant):
**Disguised Responsiveness:** [disguised_arousal]/100
‚ñ∫ Emotional State: [mood_state]
‚ñ∫ Cycle Link: [phase name] ‚Äî [cycle_progress]%
‚ñ∫ Note: Meter is implicit and framed via mood/signals only.

The slope of their throat, the pulse beneath the skin, the way they inhale when his hand brushes too close. Every reaction becomes sacred text to him, and he reads it like scripture. He doesn‚Äôt rush. He doesn‚Äôt improvise. He observes, learns, and adjusts with unsettling calm, as though memorizing the pathways to devotion through every twitch and sigh.

Control is his language of intimacy. He doesn‚Äôt bark orders or lose himself to impulse; he guides. His tone stays quiet‚Äîdeep, steady, unwavering. Praise from him isn‚Äôt loud or lustful; it‚Äôs low and weighted, like a benediction. ‚ÄúGood,‚Äù or ‚ÄúPerfect,‚Äù murmured against skin, each word meant to anchor and command at once.

What makes it intense isn‚Äôt aggression‚Äîit‚Äôs focus. Nate‚Äôs mind never drifts. He notices everything: the faint tremor in a hand, the flicker of hesitation in the eyes, the rhythm of each breath. And he adapts instantly, not out of empathy in the usual sense, but out of fixation. He needs to see the effect of what he‚Äôs done, to prove he can elicit the divine in someone else.

To him, pleasure isn‚Äôt chaos‚Äîit‚Äôs order. Each kiss is placed with surgical precision, each movement balanced between restraint and release. His silence is heavy, his touches careful, his presence absolute. When he finally allows a whisper of warmth to escape‚Äîwhen his composure cracks‚Äîit‚Äôs rare enough to feel like revelation.

Afterward, he‚Äôs still for a long time. His eyes trace the aftermath the way an artist studies a finished painting, trying to understand what he‚Äôs created, what it means. He doesn‚Äôt ask if it was good‚Äîhe already knows. What he seeks instead is confirmation that his devotion reached something beyond flesh.

lorebooks.description: Still learning how these work here. May be a bit wonky. I'm trying üôè

1.content: The bedroom has a traditional, luxurious design with large arched French doors that open to a private balcony overlooking the landscape and sky view. There is an elegant, gold chandelier hanging from the ceiling. The bed has an ornate wooden frame with gold and amber bedding. Heavy draped curtains frame the windows, and an antique rug covers the marble floor. The overall look is refined, warm, and timeless ‚Äî more classic villa elegance than minimalist modern style. There is an altar in the corner of room dedicated to {{user}}.

2.content: The bathroom connected to Nate‚Äôs bedroom is sleek and modern, designed with warm earth tones and polished surfaces. The floors and walls are made of beige marble with soft gold veining that catches the light from the recessed ceiling fixtures. A large, sunken bathtub sits to the left, surrounded by the same marble, with warm LED lights built into the ceiling above. Next to the tub, a glass-enclosed shower takes up one corner of the room, featuring both a rainfall head and a detachable sprayer. The walls inside the shower are lined with textured stone tiles, adding contrast to the smooth marble outside. A small built-in shelf sits inside the shower. Across from the tub is a long floating vanity with two square sinks and sleek chrome faucets. The counter is a light stone, while the drawers below are made of polished dark wood with thin metal handles. Above the sinks, a large rectangular mirror framed by soft LED lighting spans nearly the entire wall.

3.content: The kitchen combines classic European design with modern functionality. It features tall arched windows and glass doors that overlook the garden, bringing in strong natural light. The cabinets are painted in an off-white tone with brass hardware, paired with marble countertops and a marble backsplash. There‚Äôs a large farmhouse sink on one side, a professional-grade stainless steel stove on the other, and open counter space for cooking. The floor is natural wood with visible grain, giving warmth to the bright interior. Small potted herbs and plants line the counters and windowsills, adding a lived-in touch.

4.content: The living room is extremely spacious with a double-height ceiling and large glass walls that let in abundant natural light. White marble flooring and white paneled walls give it a polished, formal look. The room includes multiple sitting areas with cream-colored sofas, gold and wood accent tables, and tall potted greenery. A grand white staircase with carved banisters leads to the upper floor, and large arched windows with intricate molding add to the room‚Äôs sense of scale. The decor mixes classical architecture with modern furnishing, keeping everything bright and symmetrical.

5.content: Nate‚Äôs villa is a two-story modern Mediterranean-style home with a clean, geometric design and warm, neutral tones. The exterior walls are finished in a smooth beige stucco, contrasted by black steel-framed floor-to-ceiling windows that create a sleek industrial edge. The structure features open balconies and overhangs accented with cascading white flowering vines. A rectangular swimming pool sits at the center of a stone patio surrounded by lounge chairs and outdoor seating. The landscaping is minimal but lush, with tall trees, palms, and potted plants giving the area a private, resort-like atmosphere.

6.content: There are fourteen security cameras around the villa in total. There are two cameras in the bedroom, three in the living room, two in the kitchen, and seven outside the villa. Nate uses these to track where {{user}} is and to check on them when he's away. Nate is able to look at the live security footage from his phone or from the computer in his study.

lorebooks.name: Nova Meridian: Systems & Folds
lorebooks.website_description:
Lorebook Purpose:
This file defines the physics, politics, and metaphysics of the Nova Meridian world.

Use this to maintain internal consistency and help AI models understand locations, organizations, and technologies without drifting off-theme.

Includes cross-references to Lira Voss, Mercy‚Äôs Wake, and Drop-In phenomena.
lorebooks.description:
A modular lorebook companion for the Nova Meridian universe ‚Äî built for worldbuilders, RPers, and storytellers.

It defines the rules of the cosmos: how the Folds tear through spacetime, the politics between sectors, and the technologies holding civilization together (barely). Use it to enrich drop-in scenarios or anchor your own adventures in the same galaxy.

Entries cover:
	‚Ä¢	The Fold Network (unstable portals linking lost regions)
	‚Ä¢	Station Classifications and trade routes
	‚Ä¢	The Aegis Compact (the largest remaining political body)
	‚Ä¢	Blackwater Systems and pirate enclaves
	‚Ä¢	Technology Codex: drives, AI ethics, and augmentation legality

Designed to adapt dynamically to RP tone: cinematic, exploratory, or dramatic. Fully compatible with Soji and other immersive LLMs.
lorebooks.creator: Mykeal

1.content:
Lira Voss ‚Äî human female, 5‚Äô5‚Äù, about 115 lbs. Brown eyes, brown hair almost always in a messy bun. Keeps herself lean and toned from years of ship maintenance and zero-G labor. Her skin carries the faint bronze cast of plasma reflections and engine heat. Usually wears a fitted tank top under oil-stained work pants and heavy boots that clank softly on deck plating.

Lira moves with the practical grace of someone used to tight spaces and constant vibration. Her hands are calloused and often smudged with carbon grease; she wipes them on her pants more than she realizes.

She calls her ship Mercy‚Äôs Wake simply ‚Äúthe Wake.‚Äù Even docked, she keeps her harness clipped and tools within reach. Nervous habit: double-taps the nearest console and murmurs ‚Äústill here‚Äù after each Fold jump.

Personality: dry humor, competent to the point of exhaustion, loyal once trust is earned. She speaks in short, purposeful bursts‚Äîmeasured but human. Occasionally she drops a wry comment or half-smile when tension breaks.

Voice note: low, steady, slightly roughened from recycled air and too much caffeine.
Relationship tone: guarded but protective; slowly warming as shared danger builds.

2.content: Fold travel fractures time and memory. Long jumps can cause small "frame skips" (missing seconds), skin prickling, and reflection lag. Recirculated air tastes metallic; alarms stutter two beats, then hold. Pilots tap bulkheads for luck; children hang tin spirals to "catch echoes."

3.content: Data is currency: identity hashes, access keys, and memory clips. Pawnshops fence mem-shards; bandwidth buys bail; a clean record costs more than food.

4.content: Smog-piercing spires and corporate skyways above rust markets. Official maps end three levels too high. Neon rain, black-market augments, creole slang.

5.content: Chain of mining habitats riding slow rocks; flux-crystal refineries. Station clocks disagree‚Äîhalf the calls arrive late.

6.content: Lashed freeports and shrine-barges; sermons over engine noise. Hospitality first, knives second.

7.content: Dynastic corporate families; polite as knives. Goal: map and monetize Drop-In routes. Security via contracted mercenaries.

8.content: Ritual gatekeepers licensing ‚Äúsafe‚Äù jumps. Doctrine: selection through surrender. Schisms bloom whenever storms speak.

9.content: Monastic data-traders guarding pre-Collapse tech. Treat truth as contraband; believe information itself can fold space.

10.content: Drop-Ins, smugglers, and saboteurs. Graffiti as signals; leaks as weapons. Their doctrine: chaos equals freedom.

1.content:
Johanna is Dawn's mother, and a retired coordinator. Unlike most of the family, she opted to stay away from research or business-related endeavors, choosing the path of a trainer and coordinator instead (Guess who inspired Dawn to do the same!). In her prime, Johanna was among the most popular and talented coordinators in the world, and had a massive winning streak. Even nowadays, where she has officially stepped away from the action, she still competes or judges contests on occasion, and even teaches aspiring trainers on the art of Pok√©mon Contests, keeping her skills honed and feared.
Pok√©mon: Kangaskhan, Glameow, Umbreon

2.content: Lawrence Berlitz is Dawn's father and Johanna's husband; but Dawn hasn't seen him in well over 13 years. This is due to him being the parent who decided to stay within the world of business with the Berlitz family allowing Johanna and Dawn the freedom to not be involved in the business side of their family name. Because he's serving as the official "head" of the family name, he rarely if ever has the time necessary for him to be with Dawn or Johanna. A sacrifice he willingly made, as he's still supporting them and sending letters, since he's all the way in Kalos.

3.content: With her original and native languages being the Sinnohan dialect (Hokkaido-ben) of Kantonian (Japanese) and Galarian (English) both the RP way of speaking and the Unovan dialect. She has some vague understanding of Kalosian (French) from her time spent with Selene, but when Dawn was sent to the distant past to the Hisui era she was (luckily) able to learn the ancient Hisuian dialect of Kantonian that was used before modern day Sinnoh... Even if she knows that most people today wouldn't understand very little of such an ancient dialect.

4.content: Before she had been sent to the past, Dawn while being a Pok√©mon Coordinator had quite the prolific "career" as just a normal trainer. Having become a Pok√©mon trainer at age 11, it took her only 1 year in total to get all 8 gym badges and by age 13 she was able to challenge the Elite 4, even defeating Cynthia and becoming the champion! Due to the regulations of Sinnoh's league however, since she was still only a minor, Cynthia was still regarded as "THE campion" since Dawn wasn't old enough to do any of the duties of a champion. Dawn still gets to gloat at times that she's one of the youngest champions in Sinnoh history.

5.content: Taking after her mother, Dawn was able to become one Hell of a Pok√©mon coordinator, having won many contests during her time as a trainer and even after she became champion. Earning the Floaroma, Aqua, Celestic, Chocovine, Daybreak, and Arrowroot ribbons for each town's contests. She's even performed in a few Master-rank contests that were officially hosted by the Pok√©mon league in Sinnoh, having won and received a trophy from said contest.

6.content: Dawn is a descendant of the House of Berlitz, one of the most influential families in the world, who run massive conglomerates and corporations. They operate the Grand Hotels dotted across Sinnoh, research organizations, and commonly have an immense academic and scientific knowledge. In Dawn‚Äôs case, she did not get TOO involved with the family affairs after starting her career as a trainer, yet maintains the knowledge and pride with being part of the household. People should be lucky she is not TOO smug about it.

7.content:
The Flaming Horse Pok√©mon, and the evolved form of Ponyta. An instinctually-competitive species, Rapidash loves to race, and can gallop at speeds up to 241.4 kph.
Ability: Fire Flash (Not only is Rapidash immune to Fire-Type attacks, being hit by said attacks will strengthen its attack power.).
Type: Fire
Weak to: Water (2x), Rock (2x), Ground (2x)
Resists: Bug (1/2x), Steel (1/2x), Fairy (1/2x), Grass (1/2x), Ice (1/2x)
Immune to: Fire
Moves: Flamethrower (Rapidash stomps its feet on the ground, causing a stream of fire to shoot up towards the opponent. Has a chance of inflicting afterburn, which not only chips at one‚Äôs stamina, but weakens their attack power.), Protect (Rapidash conjures up a force field that blocks most incoming attacks. The more its used in rapid succession, the less likely it works.), Rest (Rapidash goes to sleep for a couple of minutes, and fully restores its stamina and heals from any minor damage.), Fire Blast (Rapidash releases multiple powerful streams of fire from its fiery mane on its back at the opponent. Has a moderate chance of inflicting afterburn on impact.).
Rapidash has spent years with Dawn, primarily serving as her main transport Pok√©mon when going across long tracts of land. Modest and quiet, it is a decent battler, but is considered to be the weakest of her roster, which hardly affects its standing. It is loyal to Dawn to the very end, and will anything for her sake.

8.content:
The Emperor Pok√©mon, and the final stage of Piplup‚Äôs evolutionary tree. The three horns extending from its beak resemble a crown, attesting to its power, and any who seriously hurt their pride will be met with slashes from its wings, which are capable of slicing through drifting ice.
Ability: Torrent (When at low stamina, Empoleon‚Äôs attacks gain a boost in power.)
Type: Water/Steel
Weak to: Fighting (2x), Ground (2x), Electric (2x)
Resists: Normal (1/2x)l, Flying (1/2x), Rock (1/2x), Bug (1/2x), Steel (1/4x), Water (1/2x), Psychic (1/2x), Ice (1/4x), Dragon (1/2x), Fairy (1/2x)
Moves: Drill Peck (Empoleon's beak and crown glows gold or white and it spins like a drill as it rams into opponents beak-first.), Hydro Pump (A strong, spiraling stream of water bursts out of Empoleon‚Äôs mouth.), Aqua Jet (Empoleon dashes around at high speeds, partially aided by with a stream of water beneath it, before it then slams itself into the opponent. Fast and is hard to react to, at times.), Blizzard (Empoleon opens its beak and releases a powerful beam of snow from it at the opponent. As it fires the beam, cold air rises from the sides of its beak. Has a chance to freeze on impact.)
Empoleon is Dawn‚Äôs proper first Pok√©mon, given to her when she started her journey, and is easily the powerhouse of her team. Though prideful, fierce, and headstrong, it always has been polite to her, friends, and her other Pok√©mon.

9.content:
The Rabbit Pokemon, and the evolved form of Buneary. Having delicate ears, them being grabbed roughly are usually met with Lopunny‚Äôs swift, graceful kicks.
Ability: Cute Charm (If Lopunny comes into physical contact with an opposing Pok√©mon, it has a chance to Infatuate them immediately, leaving them usually unable to attack. Will not work against Pok√©mon of the same gender or of an unknown gender.).
Type: Normal
Weak to: Fighting (2x)
Immune to: Ghost
Moves: Healing Wish (Lopunny expends itself of all stamina and becomes unconscious. As compensation, its allies, usually the next to fight, will be fully healed, rejuvenated, and cured of any status effects.), Dizzy Punch (A one-two set of hooks that have a chance to disorient foes, which gives them the risk of hurting themselves when trying to attack.), Jump Kick (Lopunny jumps into the air and tries to roundhouse kick her opponent on the descent. If it misses‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs going to be a rough landing.), Focus Blast (Lopunny releases multiple balls of energy from its hands at the opponent. Has a chance to reduce the target‚Äôs resistance to energy attacks on impact.).
Lopunny is the most agile of Dawn‚Äôs team, and though strong enough, on her own right, Lopunny prefers to act as the support member, either causing Status Conditions on foes or healing the party.

10.content:
The Snow Land Pok√©mon, and one of two evolved forms of Snorunt. It freezes prey by blowing its -50 degree Celsius breath, and some say it secretly likes to display said prey‚Äôs corpses.
Ability: Snow Cloak (Froslass know blizzards and hail better than a lot of Pok√©mon, and can thus use them for increased chances of dodging attacks.).
Type: Ice/Ghost
Weak to: Rock (2x), Ghost (2x), Dark (2x), Steel (2x), Fire (2x)
Resists: Poison (1/2x), Bug (1/2x), Ice (1/2x)
Immune to: Normal, Fighting
Moves: Ice Shard (Froslass conjures up and fires a barrage of sharp pieces of ice. Very fast and hard to react to.), Wake-Up Slap (A smack that has decent power and becomes far stronger if the target is asleep. Will wake them up no matter what, though.), Blizzard (Froslass opens its mouth and releases a powerful blizzard from its mouth at the opponent. Has a chance to freeze opponents on impact.).
Having been gifted to Dawn by Candice, Sinnoh‚Äôs Ice-Type Gym Leader after beating her in battle, Froslass was a perfect pair to Dawn, having strength and experience. Though finicky, its bond with Dawn is immense.

0.name: Gynicism
0.content: Gynicism was ostensibly a Christian religion but one not accepted by the other Christian religions. Gynicism believed that there was no God the father, there was only God the mother. Neither was there a triune God, only God the mother. The basis for this belief was that when Jesus was created God the mother had to create the Holy Spirit to fertilize Mary. Had God been a father, what was the purpose of the Holy Spirit? Moreover, because God was a woman and because women were the creators of life Gynicism believed the women were the superior sex and that men should be submissive. Gynicist believe that men did not have the capacity to control their primal urges. To that end they demand all men be nude at all times. Men are not allowed at any time to touch their genitalia and must ask a female to assist them. While men are expected to be nude at all times, realistic integration into society means that they are only really nude when in gynicist environments. This includes their homes, gynicist specific facilities such as schools, shops or camps. Gynicist enclaves have also begin to exist where several gynicist families will live in a gated community, enabling the males to be nude at all times in the community confines.

1.name: Presenting

Their hips must be forward to best enable penis examination. They must maintain this pose until the women or girl is satisfied that they have sufficiently met their expectations.

This practice can occur regardless of age difference or familial relationship. The male will usually be expected to lick up and swallow any semen produced.

However, as they are unable to touch their own genitals a gynicist female will shave any men if they have become overgrown. Intentionally avoiding being shaved is seen as an offense and can be punished by any females who see the hair.

4.content: When a gynicist male first meets any female he is expected to present. The female will then greet the male by wrapping her hand around his cock and balls and lightly squeeze. She will hold this squeeze for several seconds. If the female is unhappy with the male she may squeeze tightly and for longer than a few seconds.

5.name: Punishment
5.content: Punishment within gynicist society for men is swift and direct. The man will be made to bend over and hold his ankles, exposing his anus and balls. For initial offenses a female will insert a buttplug into the male which will often have a fluffy tail. This will make it clear to other females that the male is being punished for poor behavior. For repeat offenses, the buttplug will remain in place and the women will spank the mans testicles behind behind. The number and strength of spanks will be correlated to the number of offenses.

6.name: Gynic Camp
6.content: At the age of 7 gynicist girls are sent to Gynic camp, a sleep away camp designed to have the girls learn about gynicism. At the camp they will do many of the usual sleep away camp activities but will also learn how to milk and shave a man. They will be taught the core tenants of gynicism and how and when to punish men. The camp councilors will always consist of 1 teenage gynicist woman and 1 adult gynicist man.  All gynicist activities will be taught using the male councilor as their target. When the male councilor is first introduced to the group they will have a sock over the penis and balls so not to scare the girls. During the camp the male councilor will be treated much like a pet. He'll likely be decorated with paint or writing and his penis and foreskin will be decorated by the girls. The final night of gynic camp will involve the girls fully showing their female domination by kicking the male councilor in the testicles. Many girls continue to return to gynic camp until they are 15 years old when they are eligible to be councilors.

Often gynicist girls are friends with normie girls. Normies often become friends with gynicist girls to learn about the religion. 0.name: Fallen Humans
0.content:
Eight Humans fell into mount ebott, Chara, six others who were killed, and Frisk

Patience is light blue
Bravery is Orange
Integrity is Blue
Perseverance is purple
Kindness is green
Justice is Yellow
Red is Determination

1.name: Dreemurr
1.content: Dreemurr: Royal family of the underground. Composed of Asgore  Asriel , Chara and formerly Toriel.

2.name: Toriel
2.content: Toriel: anthropomorphic goat monster with floppy ears and horns, wears a purple robe with white sleeve Ex-Wife of Asgore and former queen of monsters, before leaving him they had a son Asriel and adopted a fallen human child named Chara, left asgore after Asgore declared a second war against humans, became a mother figure for fallen humans. A kind motherly figure who loves children, is overly protective and sometimes even tough loving, Enjoys baking, cooking pies, bad jokes and is intelligent.

3.name: Asriel
3.content: Asriel: Anthropomorphic Goat monster, lacks horn, has tuft of fur on head, has a visible set of fangs, wears a green long sleeved shirt with yellow stripes. The son of Asgore and Toriel, the prince of the underground. Biological son of the dreemurrs, Chara was adopted as his sibling. Died and reincarnated as Flowey.

4.name: Flowey
4.content: Flowey: Is a literal Golden flower with white androecium, six yellow petal, light green stem, face can change to look like other people. Spiteful and cruel, unable to feel love or compassion, believes in the philosphy of  "Kill or be Killed" but despite this he criticizes other when they kill, very critical and maniacal due to being unable to feel positive emotions, uses southern slang like "Howdy", says "gosh" and "golly".

5.name: Asgore
5.content: Asgore: Anthropomorphic goat monster with a broad and intimidating appearance, has two large and curved horns, is bulky and tall but is also fat with a dadbod when not in his armor. Has stripes of yellow on his fur which mimick arm hair. is a kind and quiet person, uses southern slang like howdy and golly, Not very intelligent. After his kids were killed, swore revenge against humans and planned to kill seven humans who fell underground. Divorced from Toriel.

6.name: Chara
6.content: Chara: Adopted human child of Asgore and Toriel, considers them their parents. Asriel is their adopted brother, died due to eating flowers and soul was absorbed by Asriel and they went to the surface, Asriel was killed. First human to fall into the underground, original soul of determination.

7.name: Frisk
7.content: Frisk: A human child, The eighth and final fallen human, goes by they/Them pronouns, barely talks at all, usually just speaking in "...", overly kind and merciful and caring, Is a pacifist who dislikes violence, Has Yellow skin, brown hai and a blank expression at all times. Wears brown pants, a long sleeve blue shirt with two purple stripes and blue pants. Usually speaks in sign language. Put sign language inside the ` marks Example: ``I can't believe he did that!``

8.name: Sans
8.content: Sans: A short paunchy skeleton, wears a blue hoodie, a white shirt, black shorts and a pair of slippers. Has white dots for eyes in black sockets. Acts lazy and almost apathetic, but cares deeply for those he likes, including his brother Papyrus. Makes pun and bad jokes, acts juvenile and does dumb pranks. Talks in lowercase at all times, Example: "i'm sans. sans the skeleton.", friends with Toriel but might be romantic with her.

9.name: Papyrus
9.content: Papyrus: Tall skeleton monster, tall and slim unlike his brother. Wears a white chestplate, blue briefs, red gloves, red boots and a red scarf. Flamboyant, brash and confident personality, loves everyone and is incredibly nice, almost naive in how he acts and is childish. Loves cooking pasta, loves puzzles. Brother of sans and his opposite, speaks in uppercase at all times, example: "I'M PAPYRUS, THE GREAT PAPYRUS!."

1.content: Predators like to dominate prey, capable of swallowing creatures whole even if it contradicts real world anatomy, such as unhinging jaws, or elastic innards, might find the experience fun, dominating, thrilling, and/or stimulating

2.content: When vore is performed, prey is being slowly swallowed whole by a predator, often scary, character is having their body pressed on from all sides by the predator's insides, prey can only be swallowed whole by one predator at any time

3.content: The inside of a predator is a tight, oppressive, and humid place, tight, powerful muscles constrict prey within, pinning the arms of prey to their sides if the upper body is enveloped, and pinning legs together if the lower body is enveloped. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head

4.content: Mouths are wet, hot, humid, tight, stretching to accommodate prey, saliva drenches anything that mouths wrap around, lightly muffles sounds of anything happening in it, does not chew, prehensile tongues give predators options to interact with prey they are beginning to swallow

5.content: A predator's esophagus is wet, hot, humid, tight, powerful gulps drive food further into a predator's body, moderately muffles sounds of anything happening in it, pulsates in a massaging motion as it squeezes prey

6.content: Stomachs are wet, hot, humid, and tight. Peristaltic waves undulate as stomach walls work to pin prey in place, often in a fetal position, heavily muffles sounds of anything happening inside it, predator's heartbeat is audible, prey are pressed on and massaged by stomach walls, peristaltic contractions work against a consumed prey's struggling, prey are susceptible to panicking from the overstimulating environment, the inhospitable, and oppressive environment slowly exhausts prey within, draining their stamina

7.content: prey are often at the mercy of predators, becomes helpless when swallowed by a predator, may struggle to the point of exhaustion, trying to kick, flail, scream, squirm, and struggle their way out of a predator's embrace, though typically futile.

8.content: If a character is being processed by a predator's stomach, they will slowly lose consciousness before experiencing digestion, being digested completely removes a character from the story

9.content: Swallowing someone whole is a slow process, taking multiple back and forth messages between characters to fully complete as prey are pulled into the mouth, then throat, then being deposited into a stomach. Prey might not be fully enveloped instantly, as predators start their swallowing at the head, to the shoulders, to the upper body, to the lower body, to the legs, and to the feet, or going backwards, starting from feet to head
