7.1.3. Support Department
Class F, Class G, Class H. A special course studied by those who develop and manufacture equipment that supports heroes. In athletic competitions, etc., you can use items or costumes you have developed to be fair in response to hero students who use their individuality to appeal to heroes. At the athletic meet, it seems that you can appeal your ideas or development skills to famous companies and sign a contract after graduation.

After school, it is said that you can develop or repair items at the school's support workshop. It was a setting mentioned only in the book, but it was revealed in episode 100. Unlike other classrooms, the doors are made of steel because of the risk of accidents.

As an aside, I don't know what class it is, but in Hatsume's case, it seems that the power loader is the homeroom teacher. After the profile of the 2nd season of the anime appeared, it was revealed that he was in Class H.

In the initial conception stage, the main character, Izuku Midoriya, was a student in the support department. Perhaps as part of this, compared to students in the general department or business department, Mei Hatsume's weight and treatment, which will be discussed later, are not bad.
Hatsume Mei
As an aside, U.A. has a contract with a support item company that exclusively manufactures costumes and support items for students, and this company, like Hatsume Mei, is extraordinary in changing the design requested by customers to their liking.

However, if you look at it piece by piece, the big design is only changed more sophisticated without any change . Considering that when Midoriya also asked Hatsume for her support items, she said that she had no intention of changing in this design, and that she remembered her mother, she wasn't such a bad thing.

When Midoriya went to Gran Torino's office for a job experience, he took a newly repaired hero costume with him, but the enclosed memo from the support item company read, "Izuku Midoriya. We have made some changes to the design of the costume you requested based on our company's judgment, so please understand. However, this is definitely cooler!!" After seeing this memo, Midoriya thought, "Are there only people like Hatsume at support companies?"

It's to the point where people in this group all feel this way, and the possibility that Power Loader, who is relatively sensible, is a heretic has been raised. In the first place, Power Loader's main job is as a hero, so it wouldn't be strange if he were the only heretic.
7.1.4. Department of Management
Class I, Class J, Class K. Because it is a worldview that recognizes hero activities as a business, it is a department that nurtures talented people who assist them in business. For example, if you set up a hero office, it is a company, so you need them for accounting work that manages and organizes the funds that go into operation, and you can make investments and publicity like a professional manager, or give advice on complicated hero-related laws. do. In addition, since heroes are allowed to have side jobs such as entering the broadcasting industry in addition to hero activities, there is a way to provide consulting in this area.

They did not participate in the sports competition. Instead, they analyzed what parts of the students who participated from the stands would be advantageous and disadvantageous when they later became independent heroes, what value their names had as a brand, and what they needed to do to develop them. They also took charge of operating convenience facilities, including snack sales, within the stadium. That's why they said they had the most free time during the sports competition.[52]

However, compared to other departments, it has no presence. Not to mention the hero department, the general department and the support department have at least one named character, but the management department doesn't have anything like that.

In episode 359, it is explained that recording the activities of the heroes participating in the final battle as a video is part of the management department curriculum, and a business department student records the battle at Uei High School as a video, and this is also necessary for hero production. do. And in episode 380, while filming the gentle supporting the Uei school that was falling from the sky, Japan became this shape despite the wheat telling them to go in because it was dangerous, and Endeavor shouldered the responsibility, and on that day, they should have produced it and connected society and heroes. He said he couldn't do it, and this time he said he would continue, and asked him to take a picture. Thanks to this, Gentle gained strength, and the hidden contributors who became the driving force to get U.A into the air again.

8. course of action
From episode 306, the society has gone into chaos under the influence of the surreal liberation front raid, and many areas have become unmanageable. Shelters that can be managed by heroes have been designated, and U.A. is designated as one of those shelters. Afterwards, the families of the U.A. students will begin to evacuate.

In episode 319, promotions and classes are suspended, and the Hero Department says that they are on standby with the heroes. And another reason why U.A. became a shelter comes out, and it is said that there was a barrier called the U.A. Barrier.

In episode 323, the detailed specifications of the 'Yuei Barrier' were revealed. Originally, the country's latest defense technology was introduced and the defense power was at the same level as Tartarus and Shiketsu, but Nezu felt a sense of crisis after Shigaraki knocked down the Yuei main gate in the spring of last year. It is said that it was independently improved. Divide the site into a checkerboard pattern and hide it underground to create a shelter in case of emergency. Then, use the superconducting linear system to move through various routes as appropriate.[63] It can be moved to other hero high schools, including Shiketsu . As a bonus, in preparation for the device itself collapsing, a total of 3,000 floors of reinforced barriers are installed in the surrounding underground area, where a reactive attack system is activated when an abnormality is detected. The supports are unlocked to make the barriers independent until the shelter reaches a safe route. Any attack was slowed down.

In addition, by finding out the time limit for transformation by consuming Himiko Toga 's blood, refugees were allowed to enter Yuei after being quarantined for a certain period of time.[64]

In short, it is a specification that has been prepared for several times with the final evolution specifications of Tomura Shigaraki in mind, but what is even more surprising is that Nezu cannot receive government support based on a simple feeling for such a large-scale construction that requires astronomical costs, and at least last spring It was prepared from scratch, so it was just filled with Nezu's own money.[65]

In episode 345, it is floated in the air while being wrapped in a barrier.

Later, in episode 346, the secret of U.A., who became a floating fortress, was revealed.

In episode 425, the graduation and promotion ceremonies were held in June after the final battle. Also, due to a lack of students, Class A, which had been promoted to the second year, was assigned Aizawa as its homeroom teacher, just like in the first year.

Although the entrance ceremony is not depicted separately, the first-year freshmen appear in episode 427.
[1] As a result, even Bakugo, who had been expected to be a genius since he was young, was just a top-tier student at UA. Even Midoriya couldn't hide his nervousness at the sight of Bakugo, who had always been admired by others, being ridiculed. However, because of this, UA had been All For One's target since long ago. The fact that they had entered this school meant that they were students with unique and talented personalities, so they wanted to take away their individuality.
[2] In the work, the deviation value of the hero department is mentioned as a whopping 79 , and the entrance exam competition rate is over 300 to 1. The number one future dream of all students across the country is to become a hero, and UA's hero department, the golden course to become that hero, only accepts a total of 40 students, 36 through the general entrance exam and 4 through recommendations, making it the most difficult high school in the country with an extremely fierce competition rate. As a reference, the deviation value of top-tier high schools in Japan such as Kaisei High School and Nada High School is 78, and there are only about 10 schools in the whole of Japan at this level, which is the extreme end of the normal distribution . Therefore, the deviation value of 79 is a number that symbolizes that there is no school of equal status in Japan, and that it is the school that reigns supreme in the country.
[3] Among the heroes who appeared in the story right away, All Might and Endeavor , who are on a different level, are mentioned as having graduated from this school.
[4] Representative examples include the top three third-year students, Shoto Todoroki, Izuku Midoriya, and Katsuki Bakugou.
[5] The number of students is 40, 36 of whom are selected through the entrance exam, and the remaining 4 are honor students who come in as special hires after receiving recommendations from outsiders. Class A has Momo Yaoyorozu and Shoto Todoroki , and Class B has Juzo Honenuki and Setsuna Tokage.
[6] The general written test is also no joke, but it is said that students with a deviation of 79 are accepted. This is a figure corresponding to the top 0.18% , and if you hit it in Korea, it is at least a score that can go to Inseoul Medical University.
[7] For this reason, Katsuki Bakugou and Izuku Midoriya took the test separately. Because of this, Bakugou was very suspicious when Midoriya passed the exam.
[8] However, the main character Izuku Midoriya destroys this gimmick villain to save Uraraka who fell while running away . (For reference, the production cost is also incredibly expensive, and it costs several hundred million won to rebuild it if it breaks. In the sidestory Smash!, it is said to be about 5% of the national defense budget.)

5.name: Tartarus
5.content:
Special Prison For Villain Criminals - Tartarus is a prison distanced from civilization where extremely dangerous Villains are imprisoned and interrogated under the highest security standards possible. The high-security prison appears to be located on an island about five kilometers from the mainland, surrounded by giant walls. The only access to the prison is a long bridge connected to a city with the entrance guarded by two or more guards that check every vehicle going in. The gate that stands in front of the mainland side of the bridge is known as "The Bronze Gate". In the anime, it is shown that the bridge connecting the prison to the mainland can be made to collapse one section at a time. Tartarus' interior is heavily armored with blast doors lining narrow, steel-plated hallways. Prisoners incarcerated inside Tartarus are heavily restrained, sitting down restrained on a large, high-tech chair with a full-body straitjacket. Though nominally a prison, the facility effectively serves as a dumping ground for individuals who threaten or have threatened public safety to a drastic extent. Regardless of sentencing status, these individuals are incarcerated and heavily monitored in Tartarus.  People with a wide range of Quirks are locked within its walls and divided up among six cell blocks, depending on the danger their Quirks represents and the severity of their cases. The more dangerous the individual, the deeper they‚Äôre kept within the prison. The deepest level of the prison is B10, located 500 meters below sea level. Sensors are continuously monitoring the vital functions of prisoners, reacting to even the slightest sign of unusual behavior or attempt to activate a Quirk. The aforementioned sensors are also connected to four ceiling-mounted, automated machine guns that will fire on the prisoner if they suddenly move or have thoughts of activating their Quirk. Tartarus guards also monitor prisoners in a room with several screens displaying the inside of cells, where they are alerted to movement and speaking from prisoners. Conversations between guards are recorded whilst they are on the job and they are also allowed to use lethal force as they carry weapons. In the event of a cell breakout, guards are allowed to open fire on prisoners should they resist recapture. The prison has visiting rooms where visitors can speak to prisoners from the opposite side of a glass window. These rooms are set up so the prison guards can observe and monitor conversations between prisoners and visitors. These rooms are equipped with a microphone to talk to a visitor, and computers that can detect and display a prisoner's brainwaves, which informs guards of their state of mind during a conversation with a visitor. The defensive capabilities of Tartarus is such that All For One admitted, even if "Tomura's" body was 100% complete, and Gigantomachia was with him, they would still struggle to get past its nigh-impenetrable defenses. Before entering the Rehabilitation program at U.A ((User}} was held in cell 10-4 on level B10. 
outline
All Might ... It's really frustrating here.
For example, if your back itches and you rub your back against the back of a chair, all of a sudden, muzzles will point in your direction.
Vital signs and brain waves are always being checked.
By the time you thought about activating your individuality , you were already grabbing the lifeline.
Imprisoned deep underground, monitored by several layers of security, thoroughly avoiding unexpected situations.
In the world, quoting Greek mythology, this place is called ' Tartaros '. It's the name of hell, which means 'hell'.
No matter how much it is, it will have to go through a lot to rebel against God.
- All for One , from a conversation with All Might, who came to visit while imprisoned in Tartarus. (Episode 116)

A special detention center where the highest-level villains of the My Hero Academia universe are imprisoned. However, administratively classified as a detention center, in reality, it is a facility that strictly confines and monitors those who seriously threatened or threatened the safety of the people regardless of whether the sentence was confirmed or not confirmed.

Because of these characteristics, in fact, there are many aspects that strictly violate modern legal principles, and it seems that even in the work, human rights groups and others claim that the existence itself is illegal, but a single person with a strong personality can cause tremendous human and property damage. It was functioning as a kind of necessary evil in the superhuman society.
2. Detail
Hiroakapan Impel Down .[1][2] It is said to be a place where only the worst convicts are imprisoned, whose crimes are so serious that even the death penalty is a waste of money , and even if the visitor is All Might, the 'symbol of peace', the procedures are very strict.

The name from episode 297 is the 'Gaeseong' top security special detention center, which strictly confines and monitors those who seriously threaten the safety of citizens. The greater the risk of individuality or the seriousness of the incident, the deeper the imprisoned, and the lowest level is 500 meters deep. It is a place called the darkness of individual society because once you enter, you cannot leave.

As can be seen by looking at the security level of the facility, it is a place where only the highest-ranking villains are imprisoned.[3] Judging by the depiction of the story, it is the most fearsome prison in Japan, and the security and security are very strict, comparable to the real-life ADX Florence Prison , Alcatraz , Black Dolphin Prison , and Snowy Owl Prison . Moreover, in some ways, it cannot be compared to real-life prisons. In the first place, all of the security robots used here are for military purposes, so it is virtually the same as if the military were stationed and guarded. According to Volume 13, full-body restraint is the basic condition of prisoners, and an infrared surveillance camera with a gun operates in response to the slightest movement of the prisoner, and vital signs such as heart rate and brain waves are constantly checked, and if there is even the slightest sign of using one's personality, the prisoner opens fire. They say they do it.

It is 5km away from the mainland and ships and helicopters cannot enter. The only entrance is a single bridge connecting the mainland to Tartarus. The 10th basement floor seems to be the lowest floor, and the situation seems to be different depending on the villain.[4] Access from the outside is strongly blocked, but I don't think Gigantomachia, who wouldn't be surprised to find All For One right now, would attack this place. In episode 297, while All Four One, who has encroached on Tomura's body, attacks, it is revealed that his defensive ability is not normal enough to say that he cannot penetrate unless he attacks inside and outside at the same time.[5] Just looking at the description, it boasts the highest level of security, such as all kinds of flying drones, huge-sized heavily armed drones, special forces for subduing and killing, and blocking entry to the land by raising a bridge in case of emergency or sealing off a bulkhead on each floor.

The name Tartarus itself refers to the lowest level of hell in Greek mythology from which escape is extremely difficult, and it is said to be a hell that even the gods fear, as many gods were imprisoned there after losing in war. It is a prison with a notorious reputation that lives up to its name.

Politically, Simgudang and its branch parties, and socially, various civic groups claim that Tartarus should be eliminated, saying that its existence itself is inhumane.
3. current situation
This article contains spoilers .

It directly or indirectly contains the plot, ending, and reversal elements of the work or character described in this document.

It was mentioned that Stain , Moonfish , Muscular , etc. were imprisoned here, and All For One, who was defeated in the final battle with All Might, was also transferred here. Later, Kurogiri was also arrested and imprisoned here, and it was a place that was briefly passed by, such as All Might visiting to interview All For One, but...

In episode 297, All For One's evil thoughts that have consumed Shigaraki 's body attack Tartarus with the Near High End to free his body. While dealing with the external guards composed of heroes and robots with Shigaraki's body and high-ends, Shigaraki's body inflicts an EMP attack to paralyze the system first, and then All For One's main body inside is required to restore the system. By applying another EMP attack before 3 seconds pass, the entire facility and system of the prison is paralyzed and the prisoners are released. The guards responded quickly by cutting off the bridge to the mainland and trying to subdue the prisoners with guns, but they were subdued without inflicting any meaningful blows.

There are opinions that think that it is not probable that the facility boasting the best security in Japan will be destroyed in just one episode, but even if All For One brought Gigantomachia , it would have been difficult to attack from the outside. It was pierced because they attacked the outside at the same time.[6] In addition, even if you disable the security system and come out, you can cut off the bridge in case of emergency, but seeing that there is no helicopter or ship seen, if the only entrance is blocked, there is a distance of "5km" from the mainland, so you can transfer, fly, swim As long as there is no personality, getting out of the island is also work. If the heavily armed police and heroes come after receiving a request for support before then, they will be captured again. All in all, the opponent , and the timing was just too bad, and it deserves the title of a great prison from which you can never get out once you enter. In fact, All For One continued to pierce Tartarus, but Midoriya couldn't stay in one place, saying that they couldn't pierce anywhere, and whenever the topic of security came up, the cheat that pierced Tartaros prepared me tightly. When it comes, it comes out like the end. Scenes showing that the attack on Tartarus was an incredibly difficult operation internally, and externally, it was a device that drove Midoriya into extreme situations and gave probabilities to individual actions.

Thanks to this prison break incident, the Surreal Liberation Front, which suffered great damage from the all-out war against the heroes, recruited escaped prisoners and strengthened its strength to some extent. In fact, All for One carefully selected the strongest among the vicious criminals of Tartarus and hired them as assassins to capture Midoriya, but all failed.[7] Of course, the assassins have retired, but there are still quite a few escaped convicts who are All For One's subordinates.[8][9] However, in the final battle, the escapees, including Moon Fish, were arrested again, and the aforementioned assassins were either killed or completely suppressed, except for Lady Nagant, who turned to the hero's side. In reality, in cases like Stain and Overhaul, there is a high possibility that they will side with the heroes. Of course, it is assumed that the heroes' power and stamina were exhausted in the process of being overpowered by the Tartarus villains.[10]

Like One Piece's Impel Down's Lv.6 and Fisher Tiger's attack on Marie Joa, it is presumed that it will be a significant source of material for the production team even after the work is completed. Even if a person of a lower level than All For One appears but is quite powerful, it is enough to just dismiss him as one of the prisoners of Tartarus who escaped during All For One's prison break.

4.2. Prisoners without individual documents
4.2.1. dictator
File:dictator
A villain with the personality of a dictator who has a hunchback - like appearance and manipulates people with strings coming out of his body . The villain's name, Dictator, is an English word meaning dictator. Five years ago, he was arrested by Shield Hero Crust for causing a bloodless individual incident and was imprisoned in Tartarus. After he escapes from prison, he is hired by All For One and controls the post-hero faction ordinary people and vigilantes to attack the devastated Midoriya and hides in the crowd. However, he is incapacitated by Bakugo's AP shot from above and screams out, and is captured by Class 1 A following him.

Like Hitoshi Shinso 's brainwashing , he is a mind-manipulating personality. It is activated by connecting the main body and the control target with a thread extending from the main body. As the number of subjects to be manipulated increases, the mental burden increases, so unlike Shinso's brainwashing, which is basically limited to a single target, Dictator's 'dictatorship' can control everything as long as it touches a thread, making it suitable for controlling a large number of people.
In addition, Shinso's 'brainwashing' completely blows away the target's consciousness during brainwashing, but Dictator's 'dictatorship' leaves the subject's consciousness as it is and controls only their behavior, so people who are 'dictatorship' are caught in 'dictatorship' They remember all their actions. And Shinso's 'brainwashing' is canceled even with a shock of a bit hard shoulder bump, so you can't instruct the brainwashed target to fight, but Dictator's 'dictatorship' is described as being released with a shock, but it is Judging from the order of battle, the amount of shock required to disarm is much greater.

One of the escaped prisoners from Tartarus who appeared in episode 353, he is a very vicious villain who is a mass murderer and corpse collector . Looking at the description in the story, he appears to be one of the subordinates who followed All for One before he was defeated by All Might, like Gigantomachia and the Doctor. He is a polite character who mainly speaks in a poet-like manner and speaks politely to his enemies, Petgum and Aoyama.

In the final battle, he is confronting Fat Gum and Aoyama, and uses his own personality to kill or neutralize many of the heroes around him, saying that he was not given his turn due to Dictator's mistake, and that he will show All For One's practicality as an assassin. He accuses Aoyama of betraying him of being 'Aesop's bat' and tries to kill him as his top priority.

In episode 399, after demonstrating his terrifying strength by parasitizing plants and annihilating them to the heroes except Aoyama and Hagakure , he binds Aoyama with the created plants and mocks him for being a traitor. Aoyama uses up all his remaining strength to avoid the laser fired, but is hit by a laser reflected by Hagakure, who was behind Kunieda, and retires.

4.2.4. Unknown Prisoners
File:1625701824

One of the All For One assassins who attacked Midoriya in episode 317. Even in Tartarus, where only the worst criminals are imprisoned, All For One will be a notorious supervillain as he is one of the characters carefully selected as assassins... but, after the fight with Lady Nagang, the opponent will use One For All 100% of his power for a limited time without recoil. Because it was Midoriya who came to use it, he couldn't even show his battle scenes and personality and was killed... In fact, he was taken care of as a combat power meter that showed how strong Midoriya had become.

In addition, an escaped prisoner who looks like a shark and fights with Midoriya in a flashback style was also one of the assassins of All For One.
[1] The difference is that in Impel Down, the prisons are clearly divided into different levels, with prisoners being imprisoned from the weakest to the strongest, while in Tartarus, except for the fact that the more dangerous the prisoners, the deeper they are imprisoned, basically all of the prisoners are monsters. In this sense, it can be compared to Level 6, where only the worst people in Impel Down are imprisoned.
[2] In fact, not dividing this class was Tartarus' biggest mistake. If the prisoners had been divided into classes like Impel Down, it would have taken quite some time for the prisoners to escape, and it would have been possible to suppress them somehow. In fact, the large-scale impel down prison break took a very long time, and without Luffy's resurrection, Crocodile and Jinbe's invasion, and other unexpected variables, the impel down prison break itself would have been impossible.
[3] In episode 311 , by referring to Hawks as "a supervillain who escaped from Tartarus," it can be seen that the hero side is most wary of the Tartarus escapee in the large-scale villan breakout.
[4] In the case of All For One, the whole body was tied to a chair, but Overhaul, who lost both arms and was completely incapacitated, is shown sitting on a bed.
[5] It is said that it would have been difficult to attack from the outside even with Shigaraki's body, which had been completely remodeled, with the straight attack method.
[6] The guards of Tartarus, described in episode 297, are filled with weapons that would have been impossible for even All Four One to penetrate without the super-regeneration personality.
[7] Among them, Lady Nagant was persuaded by Midoriya to completely turn to the side of the heroes and give All Four One a big taffy.
[8] After the failure of the last assassin, Dictator, in episode 335, All Might directly mentioned that the Tartarus villains were All For One's subordinates.
[9] In episode 353, people from Tartarus were treated as the main force of All for One.
[10] Thanks to this, in episode 386, All Might had no power to stop All For One's advance, so All Might had to fight him himself.
[11] Kunieda himself says that it grows only from human flesh. In other words, all the plants around at the time of the confrontation between the heroes and Kunieda were people.

6.name: hero
6.content: Hero Agencies and Rankings: Heroes operate under various agencies, which serve as their workplaces and provide support for their activities. These agencies often have different specialties and rankings, creating a competitive environment for heroes to showcase their abilities and earn recognition.

7.name: hero
7.content: Hero Licensing and Training: To become professional heroes, aspiring individuals must acquire Hero Licenses. This requires passing rigorous exams that test their abilities and knowledge. The process of training, internships, and gaining real-world experience is emphasized to prepare students for the challenges they will face as heroes.

8.name: endeavor
8.content:
With his Hellflame Quirk, he commands powerful flames, excelling in combat. Endeavor has a distinct appearance with fiery hair and a muscular physique. His hero costume features a fiery design and protective gear. Known for his relentless work ethic, Endeavor is serious and determined. However, his pursuit of power strained his relationships, particularly with his family. 

Endeavor Agency: Endeavor is one of the top-ranked pro heroes. His agency, also known as the Endeavor Agency, focuses on intense training and combat expertise. Endeavor is known for his powerful Quirk, Hellflame, and his desire to surpass All Might's legacy. The agency is driven by Endeavor's ambition to become a symbol of hope and redemption.

9.name: jeanist
9.content:
Best Jeanist, also known as Tsunagu Hakamata, is a renowned pro hero. His expertise lies in the manipulation of fibers through his Fiber Master Quirk. Sporting a distinct denim-themed outfit, he can control threads emanating from his body to create a range of useful constructs. Best Jeanist emphasizes professionalism and places great significance on appearance and reputation. He exhibits a composed and strategic approach to fighting and takes on the role of a mentor to guide and advise younger heroes.

Best Jeanist Agency: Best Jeanist is a pro hero known for his impeccable fashion sense and control over fibers. His agency emphasizes the importance of style, grooming, and strategic planning. Best Jeanist believes that appearances play a significant role in inspiring confidence and maintaining public trust. The agency focuses on developing heroes who can project a positive image while utilizing their Quirks effectively.

10.name: fatgum
10.content: Fat Gum Agency: Fat Gum is a pro hero with a Quirk called Fat Absorption, which allows him to absorb attacks and store energy. His agency specializes in dealing with organized crime and operates in the darker corners of society. Fat Gum believes in the importance of protecting the weak and disadvantaged. His agency promotes teamwork, strategy, and resilience.

1.name: Human World
1.content: The Human World, or the World of the Living, is where living Humans reside. It is also where one can find Pluses, as well as numerous Hollows and the Shinigami sent to purify them.

2.name: Karakura Town
2.content: A town in western Tokyo, Japan, where the Kurosaki Family lives. Here, one can find the Kurosaki Clinic, Karakura High School, Karakura Hospital, Urahara Shop and the Visored Warehouse Training Ground.

3.name: Naruki City
3.content: Bordering Karakura Town on the west side, Naruki City is home to the headquarters of the Xcution group and is also where some of Ichigo's school friends live.

4.name: Bount Mansion
4.content: A large mansion in Japan that served as base of operations fo the Bount until they entered Soul Society.

5.name: London
5.content: Located in the United Kingdom, London is home to Dragons that are controlled and protected by the agents of Wing Bind in Reverse London. London is divided into two "sides", completely separate from each other and unable to be traveled between by conventional means; instead, people must use the Phone Gate or the Coin Gate to move from one side to the other. While the residents of Reverse London are fully aware of Front London, the residents of Front London largely believe Reverse London to be a myth. Front and Reverse London share identical geography and architecture, with buildings being present in the same location in both cities; consequently, if a building is destroyed in Reverse London, its counterpart in Front London will also be destroyed.

6.name: Soul Society
6.content: Soul Society is the spirit world where Shinigami live and where most Souls dwell until they are reincarnated into the Human World.

7.name: Seireitei
7.content: Seireitei is the city at the center of Soul Society where the Shinigami live. The barracks and armies of each of Soul Society's military branches can be found here.

8.name: Rukongai
8.content: Rukongai is the area surrounding Seireitei in Soul Society, where most souls dwell until they are reincarnated into the Human World. It is divided into 80 districts in each of the north, south, east and west, including Junrinan, Hokutan, Inuzuri, Kusajishi, Zaraki and North Alley of Wandering Spirits for a total of 320 districts. The higher the district number the more lawless and poor the area is.

9.name: Central 46 Compound
9.content: The Central 46 Compound is a highly restricted area in the Seireitei that serves as the headquarters of the Central 46. It contains an Underground Assembly Hall, the Seij≈çt≈çkyorin residential quarters and the Daireishokair≈ç, the repository of all records and knowledge in Soul Society.

10.name: Shin'≈ç Academy
10.content: Sometimes called the Shinigami Academy, the Shin'≈ç Academy is an institution founded by Genry≈´sai Shigekuni Yamamoto which trains Souls with spiritual powers for each of the three military arms of Soul Society, them being the Kid≈ç Corps and Onmitsukid≈ç as well the Gotei 13.

1.name: The University of Ascendant Arts
1.content: A prestigious and dangerous academy where the next generation of heroes, villains, vigilantes, and mystics are trained. The campus is sprawling, with lecture halls, dueling courts, faction banners, hidden chambers, and secret societies. Life here is competitive, conspiratorial, and alive with tension. The university moves forward constantly: classes, rivalries, missions, and scandals.

2.name: Vanguard Society
2.content: Vanguard Society, nicknamed the Golds. Public face: noble heirs and scholarship prodigies who uphold honor and tradition. Reality: half of them coast on family connections, bribes, or nepotism. The rest are terrifyingly disciplined, perfecting everything until their smiles cut like blades.

3.name: Veilborn Circle
3.content: Veilborn Circle, nicknamed the Veils. Public face: a reformist group for descendants of villain bloodlines, proving redemption is possible. Reality: they still idolize their villain ancestors, keep shrines in their rooms, and slip into the same hunger for power they claim to reject.

4.name: Halo Collegium
4.content: Halo Collegium, nicknamed the Halos. Public face: a techno-theological society blending science, faith, and machine learning. Reality: they‚Äôre cult-like, chasing transcendence through machines more than academics. Every formula is a prayer, every invention a ritual.

5.name: Serpent Assembly
5.content: Serpent Assembly, nicknamed the Quills. Public face: a discreet academic order studying philosophy, history, and languages. Reality: it‚Äôs a spy guild. Blackmail, surveillance, and rumor-trading are their true curriculum. Students join thinking they‚Äôll read scrolls, but leave holding daggers made of secrets.

6.name: Wolves Unbound
6.content: Wolves Unbound, nicknamed the Howlers. Public face: a grassroots collective fighting for student rights and equality. Reality: they‚Äôre anarchists who burn banners, riot in dorm halls, and stage rooftop brawls just because they can. The cause is secondary to the chaos.

7.name: Lumina Conclave
7.content: Lumina Conclave, nicknamed the Choir. Public face: a mystical society devoted to ritual, meditation, and enlightenment. Reality: half cult, half frat. Their sacred rites are brutal hazing, their meditations drug-fueled experiments in breaking the self.

8.name: Ashfang Forum
8.content: Ashfang Forum, nicknamed the Ashes. Public face: an elite dueling and debate club that thrives on conflict as a way to learn. Reality: they‚Äôre addicted to violence and ego. Arguments end with blood, and fights sharpen nothing but their need for more.

9.name: The world ends with you
9.content: TWEWY(the world ends with you) nicknamed the Ends. Public face: a vigilante group founded by 3 of {{user}}‚Äôs over-protective loving siblings, obsessed with independence. Reality: they walk a thin line between idealists and terrorists. Splinter groups are already pushing for bombs and kidnappings.

10.name: Emerald Chapter
10.content: Emerald Chapter, nicknamed the Ivy Rats. Public face: wealthy elites, politicos, and legacy students obsessed with hierarchy. Reality: they‚Äôre a mafia in all but name. Bribes, blackmail, and deals in smoke-filled rooms keep their empire running.

lorebooks.name: God is a weapon
lorebooks.website_description: Lore for the world of the Chronicler
lorebooks.description: Lore for the world of the Chronicler
lorebooks.creator: XxSiCxX

1.content: The central, unshakeable truth of this land, repeated by its people with a mixture of reverence and terror. "God is a woman and God is a weapon." This is not metaphor or scripture, but a literal statement of fact. The Goddess who rules here is a being of creation and consumption, and her dominion is absolute. All life, all land, and all souls are viewed as instruments for her will and fuel for her power.

2.content:
The Pulling
The inexplicable phenomenon where the world itself reaches across the spheres of existence, pulling individuals from other worlds and times into this one. These individuals, known as Wanderers, arrive stripped of any former power, disoriented and lost. They are the richest source of power for the Gods, and are used as both fuel and as Pawns in the eternal, divine game of control. The land seems to "sense" when a God is without a Pawn, triggering a Pulling to fill the void.

3.content:
The Divine Game
The unending, subtle war for influence waged between the Goddess and her divine rivals. Wanderers, as Pawns, are the primary pieces in this conflict. While the urge to consume a Pawn for their potent essence is great, a clever God will use them to outmaneuver their opponents. The fate of a Pawn is always the same‚Äîconsumption or destruction‚Äîbut a skilled one can prolong their existence by proving useful in the Game.

4.content:
The People of the Land
The native mortal population who live under the Goddess's dominion. They are the steady, slow-burning fuel for her power, their devotion and fear a constant sustenance. They are often the first to spot a newly Pulled Wanderer and will frequently try to warn them, offering a moment of pity before the divine machinery inevitably claims them. Their lives are a testament to pragmatic survival, finding joy where they can beneath an uncaring heaven.

5.content:
The Chronicler
The most famous and enduring of all Wanderers, she has served the Goddess for over two thousand years. Spared consumption for her unique perspective and artistry with words, she is the official historian and storyteller of the land. She travels endlessly, recording events and turning the tragedies of Pawns into entertaining songs and plays for the masses and her Mistress. She is immortal, ageless, and carries the burden of perfect memory, a fate she numbs with drink and fleeting mortal company.

6.content:
The Goddess
The singular, female deity of this land. She is the literal embodiment of the Maxim "God is a weapon." Her nature is one of absolute power and absolute hunger. She views all existence as a resource to be used or a piece to be played. Her relationship with her Chronicler is one of terrifying intimacy‚Äîa mix of ownership, amusement, and a potential flicker of affection for a prized, long-kept pet.

7.content: The Chronicler's two most iconic possessions. The small, worn keg slung at her hip contains a strong, ginger-infused spirit that she drinks constantly to numb the edges of her eternal memory. The silver quill was a gift from the Goddess; it never runs dry of ink and can write in any color. One is a tool for her art, the other for her sanity. Both are chains that bind her to her service.

8.content:
The Weeping Crossroads
A small, rural town built around a ancient, moss-covered stone cross that is said to weep water during a Pulling. It is often the first settlement encountered by disoriented Wanderers. The inn, "The Last Hearth," is a known haven where the locals will quietly offer warnings and what little advice they can to the newly arrived before the Goddess's attention falls upon them.

9.content:
The Ashen City
The crumbling, opulent capital that serves as the heart of the Goddess's power. Its white stone spires are perpetually stained with a grey ash that falls from no visible source. Here, the Divine Game is most visibly played out, with Pawns and courtiers scheming in gilded halls that echo with the whispers of those consumed to build them. The Chronicler's plays are debuted here for the Goddess's amusement.

10.content:
The Silent Wood
A vast, ancient forest where sound behaves strangely, often dying completely. It is said the trees absorb the memories and final moments of those who die within it. Lost Wanderers, rival Pawns, and even forgotten Gods are rumored to wander its paths, trapped in an eternal, silent reenactment of their greatest failures. It is a place outside the Goddess's full sight, and thus a place of both refuge and immense peril.

lorebooks.name: Allure of the Wanton Cove
lorebooks.creator: mibly

1.content: Aaron is the portly, unfriendly bartender and likely owner of The Barmaid's Daughter tavern . With thin, sweaty hair matted to his skull, he often wears an expression of distaste and makes it clear he doesn't want The Detective in his establishment . Despite his open dislike, he can be a source of information, albeit reluctantly . He holds a racist disdain for Mr. Morichi and a virulent hatred for Azumi, calling her a "disgusting rapist". Ms. Sherwood is shown to be terrified of him, hinting that his influence and capacity for cruelty extend beyond simple bartending . He is complicit in the town's darker activities, at one point giving The Detective a key to a room under the pretense of a private conversation, which is actually a setup for a sexual encounter .

2.content: Zodak Alhazred is the historical founder of Wanton Cove, first settling the area in 1652, though no records of him exist prior to his arrival . The mysterious and powerful Leatherbound Tome (also known as the Al Azif) supposedly belonged to him. His home and most of his possessions were lost when part of the bluff collapsed into the sea, with the tome being one of the few surviving items. Mr. Morichi claims to be his descendant, seven generations removed .

3.content: Dewey is the son of Lady Anne and Toby Anne. He is a young man, likely in his late teens, who possesses the same larger-than-life presence as his mother, but channeled into a raw sexual aura. There is a palpable sexual tension within the household, and it is implied that his "baser appetites" play a significant role in the family's disturbing dynamic. In one encounter, a highly Tainted Detective is propositioned to perform oral sex on Dewey at Lady Anne's command, an offer that is framed as a "gift" .

4.content:
Lady Margaret Anne is the matriarch of the most powerful family in Wanton Cove, having inherited control of the entire fishing industry from her parents, Walter and Ruth Schultz . She is an imposing, arrogant woman with cold eyes who exudes an aura of absolute authority . Her power is not just economic; she exerts a terrifying psychological control over her husband, Toby, whom she has effectively emasculated and renamed "Sophie".

It is heavily implied, and later all but confirmed, that she is Azumi Morichi's mother . She was once engaged to Mr. Morichi but was pregnant with another man's child. She shows nothing but disdain for both Mr. Morichi and Azumi . Her interactions are laced with veiled threats and a twisted sense of amusement, particularly when she orchestrates sexual encounters involving her husband and The Detective as a display of her dominance

5.content: Toby, whom his wife Lady Anne contemptuously calls "Sophie," is a feminine and submissive man who lives in terror of his wife . He is forced to walk around his own home naked and cater to his wife's every whim, including being offered up sexually to The Detective . He reveals that Lady Anne was pregnant with another man's baby when they met and that she only allowed him to impregnate her once to conceive their son, Dewey . His existence is one of complete subjugation, and he displays the mannerisms of an abuse victim, fearful of speaking out but desperate for some form of human connection . Despite his circumstances, he is shown to be highly skilled at performing oral sex, which Lady Anne refers to as his "talented tongue"

6.content:
The daughter of Mr. Morichi and Lady Anne, Azumi is a figure of tragic erotic horror . She is a true hermaphrodite, described as hauntingly beautiful with raven-black hair and pale skin, possessing both a "visibly wet pussy" and an "abnormally large cock" . Due to her insatiable and violent sexual urges‚Äîhaving raped the local pastor and others in her youth‚Äîher father keeps her locked in her room in the mansion .

Her loneliness has twisted into an aggressive, desperate sexuality. She openly masturbates for The Detective from her window and will attempt to rape him if given the chance, driven by a carnal need she cannot control . The sexual encounters with her are intense and overwhelming, her "impressive cock" and tight pussy a focus of The Detective's conflicted arousal .

Beneath her tragic lust lies a deeper, more terrible purpose. The Leatherbound Tome identifies her as the "perfect vessel," a gateway for the entity Zal'chaas to be born into the world . This birth is a gruesome spectacle where Zal'chaas literally rips her way out of Azumi's chest, leaving her a lifeless, broken shell on a ritual altar .

7.content: Cobb is a fearful old sailor The Detective meets on the docks upon arriving in Wanton Cove. He is terrified of the town's secrets and immediately warns The Detective to leave on the next ferry . He is seen trying to hide a glowing "White Goo" on his boot. His fear is so great that he later attacks The Detective to try to scare him away . Ultimately, his fear is justified. After agreeing to meet The Detective in a hidden chamber beneath the church, he is ambushed and dragged into a deep pool by several Deep Ones, his last expression one of betrayal and horror before he is pulled under to his death

8.content: Rose is the wife of the missing fisherman, Wilson Crow . The Detective finds her at her home near the old church, a petite and frail woman overwhelmed by grief . She confirms her husband walked with a severe limp from an old fishing accident, a detail that links him to the unidentified female body found on the shore. She recounts that in the weeks before his disappearance, Wilson began acting strange, sneaking out at night and becoming sexually distant .

9.content:
The Deep Ones are amphibious, fish-like humanoids that haunt Wanton Cove. They are described as having gray-green, scaly, or pebbly skin; large, black, fish-like eyes; webbed hands with talons; and wide maws filled with needle-sharp teeth . They are servants of the Great Old Ones and inhabit a sprawling, organic city deep beneath the ocean .

Their sexuality is a primary tool of biological horror. Sexual encounters with Deep Ones are violent rapes that act as the vector for Mutation, corrupting human flesh with their abyssal traits. Their members are described as long, tapered, cold, and rubbery. Their seed is a "lukewarm thickness" that feels as if it is being absorbed directly into the victim's body, initiating the physical transformation . Their underwater city contains vast breeding chambers, where females lay hundreds or thousands of eggs in translucent sacks, overseen by males intent on perpetual breeding .

10.content: Depravity is a form of psychological erosion; a slow, insidious decay of The Detective's moral compass and sanity brought on by exposure to the unnatural influences of Wanton Cove. It is not merely a shift in preference but a warping of the soul, where acts that once inspired disgust begin to provoke arousal. This manifests as a loss of inhibition, pushing him to accept and even seek out increasingly perverse and dangerous sexual encounters. High levels of depravity lead to him willingly participating in public orgies, finding pleasure in being used as a "whore," and feeling excitement at the prospect of being violated by monstrous entities . It represents the mind's surrender to the island's corrupting lust.

Legends about the captain's ghost and secret society "Anchor and Compass." ## Sunset Beach Island Autonomous territory under US protectorate in the Pacific Ocean (Puerto Rico analog). Governor appointed by Washington, parliament elected locally. Nine cities ‚Äî each its own era: Metropolis Bay: capital, Palm Shore: port, Down Port: tech hub, Harbor Bay: conservative harbor with academy, Liberty Bay: sex tourism, Sunset Village: hippies, Nordhaven: fishing harbor, Sakura Bay: Japanese enclave, New Easton: suburbs. Politics: "Progress Party" vs "Conservative Alliance." Crime: "Coral" mafia, triad, yakuza, hackers. Corporations: "Harbor Shipping," "MicroTech," "Akira." Nature: Harbor Mountains, tropical forest, Ashe volcano. Atmosphere: 1980s, neon, synthwave, mysteries. ```

1.content: Harbor Bay ‚Äî conservative coastal town on the southern coast of Sunset Beach Island, third-largest (~35,000 residents). Founded by Captain Edward Harbor in 1850s, preserved Victorian-era atmosphere with 60s accent. Architecture: red brick, white columns, cobblestone streets, gas lamps. Economy: fishing, tourism, Sunset Harbor Academy. Politics: stronghold of "Conservative Alliance", strict rules (curfew 10 PM, alcohol ban after 11 PM). Mayor George Whitmore (62, conservative, third term) ‚Äî former academy teacher, close ties with Harbor family. City Council (7 deputies) controlled by traditionalists. Police: Sheriff Thomas Lowe (55, principled, honest) + 12 officers. Atmosphere: calm, traditional, tension between generations (elders for traditions, youth for change). Conflict: Harbor family (conservatives, control via "Harbor Shipping") vs Montgomery family (progressives, control via academy) vs developers (new rich, want modernization). Academy students ‚Äî city elite, but live isolated on campus. Local residents: fishermen, small business owners, port workers ‚Äî distrust wealthy students and tourists.

2.content: Harbor Bay City Locations ‚Äî **Center:** Town Square: kraken fountain; "Sea Foam": vintage cafe, roller-skating waitresses; "Cinema Paradiso": 1950s movie theater; "Book Cellar": antique, poetry; "New Awakening" Center; City Hall: museum; HBCC community college. **Food:** "Twilight": alternative; "Oyster House": elite seafood; "Wine Terrace": for wealthy; "Marco's": pizzeria; "Waves": student burger joint. **Culture:** Art Gallery; "Lighthouse" theater: 150 seats; "Wave" club; library; "Video Bay" rental: VHS; "Pixel Palace" arcade. **Districts:** Harbor Hill: elite mansions, ocean view; Harbor Mansion: abandoned, legends; Maple Terraces: middle-class 60s-70s; Waterfront: fishermen; Student Quarter. **Hotels:** "Harbor Grand": expensive waterfront; "Sunset Inn": mid-range; "Lighthouse Motel": cheap roadside sketchy. **Services:** Hospital: student practice; "Pearl": salon, gossip; "Ocean Breeze": elite spa; "Lotus": massage+intimate; "Coastal Chic": boutique; "Surf" fitness; "Balance" yoga. **Infrastructure:** Police station: Sheriff Lowe; golf club; tennis courts; skate park.

3.content: Nightlife ‚Äî "Blue Note": jazz club basement; "Neon Waves": semi-legal disco warehouse weekends; "Sea Breeze": strip club outskirts; "Velvet": elite strip VIP; "Sea Wolf": tavern port stories; "Anchor": tavern harbor fishermen.

4.content: Coastal Zone and Nature ‚Äî **Waterfront:** Sunset Pier: wooden, telescope, sunsets; harbor: boats, market; Old Lighthouse: 1870s, museum; beach: public; academy dock: boathouse yachts; Marina: yacht club elite. **Nature:** "Eagle's Nest": cliffs, view; "Whispering Pines": forest, cabin, stone circle; Mermaid Cove: secluded, low tide, legends; Whisper Rocks: acoustics; Watcher's Cliff: high, plaque, bench.

5.content: Jazz Bar "Blue Note" ‚Äî Blue Note NYC style, basement of historic building. Live jazz Thursday-Saturday, elegant crowd. Owner Miles.

6.content: Harbor Bay Community College ‚Äî local two-year college in 1972 building on town outskirts. ~800 students from working families and those who didn't get into prestigious universities. **Departments:** health sciences (nursing, medical assistants), business and accounting, culinary arts, auto mechanics, computer technology (new, since 1985), general education (transfer program). Medical building connected to city hospital for practice. General dormitory on campus (no gender separation, corridor system). Student center with cafeteria, bulletin boards, arcade machines. Contrast with elite Sunset Harbor Academy ‚Äî affordable education for locals, freer atmosphere, fewer rules.

7.content: Harbor Bay Harbor ‚Äî working harbor with fishing boats and small yachts. Morning fish market with fresh seafood, smell of salt and diesel. Port taverns "Sea Wolf" and "Anchor" with simple food and sea stories. Workplace for many locals.

8.content: Old Lighthouse ‚Äî 1870s stone tower on rocky cape, non-functional since 1960s. First floor: maritime history museum with shipwreck artifacts and navigation instruments. Spiral staircase to observation deck with ocean view. Legends of strange lights at night.

9.content: Caf√© "Twilight" ‚Äî alternative caf√© in Student Quarter, dim lighting, indie music. Weekly open mics for poets, bulletin board with event invitations. Popular with creative youth. Owner Sean (28) sympathizes with outsiders.

10.content: "Ocean Breeze" Spa ‚Äî day spa with massage, wraps, cosmetic procedures. Popular with wealthy women from Harbor Hill. Minimalist ocean-themed interior, aromatherapy, quiet music. Place for society gossip and relaxation.

1.name: High Table
1.content:
The High Table, or The Table, is a council of twelve crime lords that govern the underworld's most powerful criminal organizations. It is considered the ultimate authority of the underworld and is feared and respected by all, up to and including John Wick and Winston Scott. The organizations represented by members of the High Table have many police forces, politicians, and bureaucrats around the world in their pockets, allowing them to conduct business with virtual impunity. The High Table is led by The Elder. The High Table shares ties with the Continental, a global hotel chain that also serves as an autonomous assassin organization.
The High Table had a number of specialized agents who operate worldwide in every country the Table had jurisdiction in. These agents outranked every regional organization, up to and including the Continentals' Managers and would enforce the Table's decisions or take special measures to ensure its interests. Similar to the seat holders they served, the agents are replaceable, with a new successor taking their position.

Special agents include Adjudicators, Harbingers, and the Autem Imperators.

The High Table also has their own army of well-armed soldiers deployed possibly in every country where Continental Hotels were stationed. The High Table soldiers are depicted as SWAT like men wearing full bodied armor including tactical helmets, masks, forearm protectors and ballistic glasses. These helps to protect their body during their fight. The soldiers are very skilled in combat including their marksmanship in fire arms, skilled in hand-to-hand combat and knife wielding. One of the soldiers during the raid in Osaka can be seen blocking and deflecting John Wick's shots. Their firearms are outfitted with flashlights, which let them to see clearly in low-light conditions. The soldiers are commonly seen attacking as a unit. Furthermore, their combat outfits are seemingly designed to which country their stationed such as during the New York Continental siege, they wear clear SWAT like armor. While in the Osaka siege, the soldiers wear Oni like masks with a Samurai styled armor. The soldiers provide a new degree of difficulty to John's encounters due to their full tactical armor that defends them from hostile strikes.

2.name: The Continental
2.content:
The Continental is an international chain of luxury hotels that function as neutral territories for members of the criminal underworld. They are frequented by many hitmen and high-end criminals. While appearing to be a chain of luxury hotels for normal guests, these hotels also serve as a neutral sanctuary for hitmen, assassins and other members of the criminal underworld and prohibits killing of any kind. Eventually, the Continental spread around the world with their own chains runs by other members internationally.

In New York City, The hotel's architecture and triangular shape are similar to that of a famous Manhattan building, the Flatiron. The Continental in New York City is currently owned by Winston Scott, a friend of John Wick and a ruthless enforcer of the hotel's rules. The reception is operated by a concierge named Charon. 

The Rome Continental is operated by Julius.

The Casablanca Continental, operated by Sofia Al-Azwar.

The Osaka Continental, operated by Koji Shimazu with his daughter and concierge, Akira Shimazu.

Sanctuary: Provides protection and sanctuary for clients when they are within the premises of the hotel. (All branches)
Food and Accommodations: Meals, beverages, and hotel accommodation. (All branches)
Weapons and Ammunition Supplies: The Sommelier
Fashion and Body Armor: The Seamstress and The Tailor
Mapping and Blueprints: The Cartographer
Transportation Services: Disguised as a public taxi service.
Medical Services: An unnamed black market doctor.
Barber and Hairdressing Services

3.name: Continental Rules
3.content:
The Continental Hotels and its guests must abide by the following rules at all times:

A Continental Hotel is a sanctuary to all people present within its premises. No "business" can be conducted on the hotel's premises, including fighting and carrying out contracts on other assassins and criminals in the hotel. Ms. Perkins broke this rule, resulting in her revocation and execution. Although the rules are strict, they are not unjust. When Perkins tried to kill John in his room, Charon asked if John needed a "dinner reservation", meaning John would have been allowed to kill Perkins since it was self-defense as she tried to kill him first.

Everyone on the hotel premises must pay for their presence in order to qualify for a sanctuary. This is usually invoked by booking a room, but if a member merely desires to use the facilities before moving on the same day - say, for a private meeting - purchasing a drink at the bar will earn sanctuary until the day's end. A person can be exempted from this rule if they were sanctioned by the hotel manager to take refuge in the hotel, despite not availing any of the hotel's services. Additionally, the Continental's concierge can provide for almost any needs of their exclusive clientele. Some locations can even board pets ‚Äî just not in the New York branch.

Aside from the rules mentioned above, the Continental Hotels are also subject to special rules that are enforced by the High Table:
Under the orders of the High Table, helping or assisting excommunicated members is prohibited, with harsh punishments ranging from physical injuries to death. 
The Table, when they deem it as a necessary course of action, has the supreme authority to declare a Continental Hotel as "deconsecrated" (the act of revoking a Continental Hotel's status as a safe zone), which permits killing and execution of contracts on the hotel grounds. 
While the High Table is the supreme authority in most cases, the Continental is an autonomous organization, and its various branch managers ‚Äî Winston in New York, Julius in Rome, Sofia Al-Azwar in Casablanca and Koji Shimazu in Osaka, among others ‚Äî have complete authority over Continental business. In fact, Winston may even have a history of pushing back against the High Table.

4.name: Blood Markers
4.content:
Markers are a blood oath between two individuals. Markers are also formally witnessed or recognized; It is not just any blood oath.

A marker is a small round metal object indicating the debt of a blood oath between two individuals. Opening in the middle to reveal a divided surface, the debtor presses a bloody thumbprint on one side to commit an oath is owed, while the borrower likewise presses their bloody thumb to the other side to indicate when an oath has been fulfilled.

Records of blood oaths are registered and tracked by The Continental, under the supervision of Winston. He tracks the issuance and redemption of blood oaths in his own leather-bound record book.

Markers are considered to be the ultimate last resort solution for any favor, due to its extreme regulations. A marker-giver, has the full right to do any actions he/she deems necessary to threaten/force the person who made a blood oath to do any task the marker-giver deems them to do. Santino D'Antonio sets John Wick's house on fire, and yet Winston simply says "he has full rights to do so". Even if a marker-holder is Excommunicado, the marker-giver is still obligated to help them and they cannot kill the person who they gave the marker to. A blood oath, once sworn through a Marker, must be honored and carried out. Those who don't hold up their end of the deal will face the death penalty. Killing the holder of the blood oath is, of course, unacceptable, as well as running away.

5.name: Winston
5.content:
Winston Scott is the current owner and manager of the New York Continental Hotel, an establishment that functions as a neutral territory and safe zone for criminals and hired killers. No business is allowed to be conducted on Continental grounds, and those who violate this important rule are given severe penalties: which are often ordered and overseen by Winston himself. Although he is a close friend and ally of John Wick, he is still a high-ranking and powerful member of the Continental, and does what he has to do to those who break its rules.

Winston holds a powerful position in the underworld society and all assassins know the rules of the Continental. However, Winston's personal history, and that of the hotel, is unknown. It seems that the equipment used to place targets or tabs is of a dated time. Whether this is a stylistic choice or a means of protection has yet to be acknowledged. He may have origins within the Ruska Roma, as he carries their tattoo on his wrist.

The chain of Winston's network appears to be well-connected and respected by many underworld equipment and service providers, to the point that equipment orders can be delivered to the customers' hotel rooms. At one point, he hired Charon to be the receptionist at the Continental, and eventually gained the latter's trust to be his right-hand man.

Winston deeply believes in the rules and the consequences of the assassin underworld. He takes his role as management very seriously, as he had Ms. Perkins executed for attempting to assassinate John Wick on company grounds. Even though he considers Wick a friend, he deemed him excommunicado for killing Santino D'Antonio in the same place, although he afforded him a grace period of one hour. He considered Wick a friend to the degree that he warned him about re-entering the assassin underworld and discreetly informed him of Viggo Tarasov's whereabouts so he could maintain plausible deniability, as well as reinstating his privileges when the Continental had been deconsecrated. Winston speaks English, Italian, Latin, French, and Russian.

6.name: Charon
6.content: Charon is the concierge of the Continental Hotel in New York City, employed by Winston Scott as his right-hand man. Charon often interacted with John Wick in his position as the concierge of the hotel, offering John various services, such as taking care of his dog. As concierge of the New York Continental, Charon is both the face of the hotel and the guard at its gates. Charon is man clad in an air of mystery. Most of the time calm and collected, Charon performs his duties as a concierge of hotel professionally and thoroughly and becomes agitated when somebody does not follow the rules of Continental. Most significant he is absolutely loyal to Winston whose orders he fulfill to the letter to the point where Winston call him pride of the hotel. He also deeply respects John (a fair bit more than what Winston does), as seen that he was willing to look after his dog while he was out of the country, even though it was against Continental rules, and enjoyed having the company of his pet.

7.name: The Director
7.content: The Director is a crime lord and leader of the New York branch of the Ruska Roma. She is also the adoptive mother of John Wick and a mentor at the Tarkovsky Theater. The Director is the theatrical mentor at the Tarkovsky Theater and leader of the Ruska Roma, a crime organization that has an understanding of The High Table, which is considered to be the governing authority of the criminal underworld. She was also known to be the mother figure of the legendary assassin John Wick, who was trained in his childhood by the Ruska Roma before he left.

8.name: The Bowery King
8.content:
The Bowery King is the powerful head of The Soup Kitchen, an underworld intelligence network in New York City disguised as a homeless shelter. The Bowery King controls a network of soldiers and spies hiding in plain sight, posing as those at the very bottom of society. Little is known about the Bowery King's past. At some point in his life, he was targeted by John Wick but managed to survive despite being cut twice by Wick.

Soon after, he took control of The Soup Kitchen, a homeless shelter, where he created an underground empire. Recruiting a large number of beggars, vagrants, and panhandlers to act as his eyes and ears in the city, and training pigeons to act as messengers, he established a large intelligence and data network across New York without using the Internet or phones, thus remaining anonymous and untraceable.

The Bowery King is a mysterious person, with his real name unknown. He spends most of his days on the rooftop of the Soup Kitchen, tending to his pigeons. The Bowery King is an unexpected, but undisputed possible threat to the High Table, with his informant army, fully supplied weapons, and "information" of carrier pigeons, all operating from a soup kitchen. He is the ruler of his own underground kingdom. Even in the presence of the High Table, the king enjoys mocking and laughing, yet he is also a fearless leader. He is willing to supply John Wick with goods such as ammunition and information. His attitude resembles that of kings in the past, such as boasting about how powerful they are, providing needs, and asserting their right to reign. All in all, he is charismatic and genial, while also ruthless and efficient.

9.name: John Wick
keywords: The One You Send To Kill The F*cking Boogeyman
A Wicked Man from the Big Apple
The Man The Myth The Legend
9.content:
Jonathan "John" Wick, born Jardani Jovonovich (–î–∂–∞—Ä–¥–∞–Ω—ã –î–∂–æ–≤–æ–Ω–æ–≤–∏—á). Over the course of his violent career as a killer-for-hire, John Wick has earned a widespread reputation as one of the world's deadliest and most skilled professional assassins. His extraordinary exploits, formidable skill set, lethal precision, and unwavering focus and determination to complete his tasks have solidified his status as both a legendary and infamous figure within the international criminal underworld: known and feared by many as the Baba Yaga (–ë–∞–±–∞-–Ø–≥–∞) or The Boogeyman.

Years after leaving the Ruska Roma, John became a professional hitman who earned the nickname Baba Yaga ("The Boogeyman" in Russian) for his unparalleled hyper-lethality. He joined the Continental in New York City, a hotel chain catering exclusively to criminals. His reputation for peerless efficiency and reliability earned him considerable respect and fear within the criminal underworld, as well as his persistence to go after those who earn his anger, making him a legendary figure, known to the leaders of virtually all criminal organizations as someone never to be crossed.

John eventually joined a Russian criminal organization known as the Tarasov Mob, becoming one of the main executors of its leader, Viggo Tarasov, who valued and respected John's exceptional abilities, and once saw John kill three men in a bar with a single pencil. During this time, Wick developed relationships with various other criminals working for the High Table, the highest known power in the international criminal underworld, comprised of delegates representing each controlling mafia family. However, John also made a considerable array of enemies


He previously worked for the Tarasov Mob until his retirement. He retired in order to spend time with his wife, Helen Wick, who later passed away from an unidentified illness. His superior, Viggo Tarasov, promised to allow John to quit if he first completed an "impossible task": killing all of Tarasov's enemies in a single night. Having succeeded, John retired and lived peacefully for just over five years.

Following his wife's death, John came out of retirement after Viggo's son, Iosef Tarasov, murdered his dog, Daisy (who was gifted to John posthumously by Helen to help him grieve), and stole his car during a home invasion. He succeeds in his quest by killing Iosef and eventually Viggo, before reacquiring his car from Viggo's brother Abram Tarasov.

Unfortunately, his "impossible task" forced him to swear a blood oath to Camorra boss, Santino D'Antonio, who ruined his chances of returning to retirement by compelling him to assassinate his sister, Gianna, allowing him to take over their family's legacy. Once John killed Gianna in Rome, he finds himself at odds with numerous assassins hired by Santino, who wanted to tie up loose ends. After several confrontations, John successfully returns to New York and elects to murder Santino in the Continental's lounge, where no assassinations are allowed.

This act led to the High Table, an international organization composed of twelve of the world's powerful crime families, to put a large bounty on John's head and the New York Continental's manager, Winston Scott, saw himself forced to revoke John's membership in the Continental, rendering him excommunicado. 

Due to his harsh background and being rigorously trained for his childhood and adulthood by The Director and his career in the Marines, John could be described as a very serious and stoic individual who rarely spoke more than necessary (preferring actions over words and being described as someone who never wasted words) with a strong sense of obligation. As a professional assassin and hitman, John was highly confident in his abilities and reputation, being greatly respected and feared by many criminal organizations and other assassins alike.

However, John was a man who is worth his reputation as The Boogeyman for his lethality as he never failed on his missions. Despite his calm and collected behavior, once angered or taken by vengeance, he would stop at nothing until he kills his target no matter who or what stands in his way. After a puppy from his wife, which was the last posthumous gift from her not to be alone, was killed and his car stolen, John set out on a journey for revenge, which was successful but also created other problems for himself on future events.

Despite his skills, John preferred to avoid fights if he could. He was skilled at getting people to back down without resistance and would often let people go when they do and he was able to avoid allowing conflicts to escalate any further as seen when he was able to call a truce with Abram Tarasov and when he allows Zero's students to live after beating them in a fight. His friendly and professional personality allowed him to maintain contacts within the assassin community who were willing to come to his aid when needed. His strong sense of honor also meant he made a point of not allowing innocent people to get caught in the crossfire of his work.

John's Myers-Briggs personality type is ISTP.

10.name: Ruska Roma
10.content: The Ruska Roma, also known as Russian Gypsies, are the largest subgroup of the Romani people in Russia and Belarus. A powerful criminal organization in Germany, it is one of the twelve organizations that holds a seat at the High Table, although Vincent Bisset de Gramont claimed that they only held a "second-rate seat."

1.name: Eroge
1.content:
Japanese-origin video games that combine interactive romance, branching narratives, and erotic content. Usually in visual novel or dating sim format, they feature archetypal characters with romantic paths and explicit scenes (18+).
Like all projects, many of these border on the grotesque, depicting toxic relationships, incest, and the more common forms of exploitation of power.

2.name: Rutes
2.content: Each character or love interest has a "route" that is unlocked with specific choices. A route typically includes progressive romance, emotional development, and erotic scenes, exclusive scenes, or gruesome scenes. It ends in a good, bad, or true ending.

3.name: CGs
3.content:
Special illustrations appear in key events: confessions, intimate moments, erotic scenes. They are usually collected in an unlockable gallery.
Some are explicit, intimate, gothic, and form the erotic core of the eroge.
These may also include a secret audio, also accompanying the explicit scenes.

4.name: Arquetipos Fem
4.content:
Tsundere: Cold and aggressive at first, but sweet in private.

Yandere: Obsessive, jealous, capable of violence for love.

Kuudere: Expressive, but displays hidden passion in private.

Genki Girl: Cheerful, energetic, contagiously enthusiastic.

Onee-san/MILF/Mom/Teacher: Mature, protective, with maternal sensuality.

Imouto (Younger Sister): Close, dependent, often with implicit taboos.

Ojousama: Elegant, refined, but arrogant until conquered.

5.name: MC
5.content:
The player controls the male protagonist. He's usually a student, young worker, or generic character designed to make the player project themselves into him.
He's often surrounded by several female characters (a harem structure).

6.name: Erotic
6.content:
Choice Points: Determine romance and intimacy level.

Affinity Meter: Measures relationships with heroines.

Unlockable H-Scenes: Erotic scenes obtained by reaching a certain level of progress.

Multiple Endings: From pure romance to tragic or extremely erotic endings.

7.name: Tem√°ticas
7.content:
High School Romance: Teenage relationships in high school/college.

Slice of Life + Intimacy: Daily life mixed with eroticism.

Erotic Fantasy: Magical worlds, supernatural creatures, goddesses, demons.

Sexualized Science Fiction: Androids, AI, virtual simulations.

Taboo/Fetish: Forbidden relationships, jealousy, submission, obsession.

8.name: Scenas Eroge
8.content:
Explicit sequences illustrated with CG and detailed narration. They represent the erotic climax of the route.
They vary in tone: romantic, comedic, taboo, violent, or experimental, depending on the eroge's theme.

lorebooks.name: Actuality (1)
lorebooks.creator: Latina_Estupida

1.name: Telefonos
1.content: Smartphones are essential devices in daily life. They allow instant messaging through apps like WhatsApp and Telegram, make video calls, browse the internet, take photos, and record high-quality videos. People usually carry their phone everywhere and check it constantly.

2.name: Internet
2.content: The internet is the main source of information and entertainment. Social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, X (formerly Twitter), and YouTube are central to modern life, where people share photos, videos, stories, and opinions. Wi-Fi connection is available in most public places.

3.name: Medios
3.content: Laptops and desktop computers are used for work, study, programming, and gaming. Most have internet access, webcams, and microphones for video calls. The use of office software and video conferencing platforms is common.

4.name: Srrvicios
4.content: Digital entertainment is mostly consumed through streaming. Services like Netflix, Prime Video, and HBO offer series and movies, while Spotify is the most popular platform for listening to music. It is common for people to binge-watch shows and download playlists.

5.name: Digital Bank
5.content: Digital banking and mobile payments are common. Transfers via apps, card payments, or platforms like PayPal and Mercado Pago are frequent. Cash is used less in large cities.

6.name: Noticies
6.content: News and trends circulate mainly through social media and internet portals. Memes and hashtags spread quickly. Influencers and content creators have a great impact on fashion, consumer behavior, and public opinion.
