lorebooks.creator: Latina_Estupida

1.name: 4chan
1.content: An anonymous forum created in 2003 by Christopher Poole (‚Äúmoot‚Äù). Structured in thematic boards, with no mandatory registration. Known for generating viral memes, anonymous mass movements, and chaos zones like /b/. Its administration is minimal, and moderators (‚Äújannies‚Äù) are viewed with suspicion. It has been the center of controversy due to leaks, coordinated campaigns, and content bordering on the ironic and disturbing.

2.name: 8kun
2.content: Created as an "uncensored" alternative to 4chan, it became a refuge for communities expelled for extreme content. Managed by Jim Watkins, it was linked to conspiracy theories and radical movements. Unlike 4chan, anyone can create their own board, which facilitated dark groups and banned discussions.

3.name: Kiwi Farms
3.content: Forum focused on collecting and mocking "peculiar" internet people ("lolcows"). Famous for its organized harassment and leaks of private information. Its founder, Joshua Moon, has faced server shutdowns and boycott campaigns. Considered one of the most controversial and persecuted sites on the internet.

4.name: Lolcow.farm
4.content: Forum to document internet user dramas. Focusing on harassment and leaks of personal information, with selective moderation.

5.name: Lainchan
5.content: Forum inspired by 4chan but with a focus on technology, cyberpunk, and digital philosophy. Managed by an active community with strict rules on some boards. Its tone is more intellectual, but it also includes discussions about hacking and extreme anonymity, attracting fringe users.

6.name: Wizardchan
6.content: A closed forum for young men who identify as "incels," or socially isolated. It focuses on self-support but also contains depressive and extreme discussions. Run by longtime members, it has been criticized for normalizing alienation and radical attitudes.

7.name: 7chan
7.content: An American alternative to 4chan, with anime, video game, and humor boards. Moderation is less strict than that of mainstream forums, but more controlled than 8kun. It has had episodes of raids and trolling, although less notable than 4chan or 8kun.

8.name: AnonIB
8.content: Image forum focused on adult content and subculture. It allows anonymous image uploads without strict control, including controversial or borderline material. Its administration is minimal, allowing highly controversial content to circulate.

9.name: Tor-based imageboards
9.content: Underground Tor chans, extreme versions of 4chan/8kun. Moderation is almost nonexistent, allowing illegal content and the coordination of underground activities.

10.name: The Hub
10.content: Dark Web discussion forum on hacking and illegal trading. Minimal administration; extreme ethical debates; and coordination of underground operations.

keywords: the Order of the Red Blade
1.content:
The Order of the Red Blade is a hybrid of ancient chivalric brotherhood and modern interstellar military force. Founded on the frontier colony of Avalen Prime, the Order was created to defend the Outer Reaches from invasions by the Dominion of Caelion and to uphold the ideals of honor, faith, and sacrifice in an age of machines and moral decay.

Its members, known as Crusaders of the Blade, wear armor that blends the aesthetic of medieval knights with the engineering of advanced combat suits ‚Äî polished alloy plating etched with oaths and family crests, reinforced by power systems and kinetic shields. Every knight wields a red energy sword forged around a crystal unique to Avalen Prime. The hue of the blade represents both the dawn sky of their homeworld and the blood spilled in defense of it.

To the colonies, the Order once symbolized salvation. To its enemies, it was fanaticism given form. The knights recited their code as both prayer and weapon:

‚ÄúBy the red light, I stand. By the red light, I fall. The flame of Avalen never fades.‚Äù

The Order‚Äôs hierarchy is modeled after ancient feudal structures: Aspirants, Knights, and Paladins, each sworn to one of the Great Houses of Avalen. Aspirants like  begin as idealists ‚Äî young volunteers who see the Order as the purest path to honor and belonging. In reality, the Order‚Äôs crusades have grown increasingly political and brutal, their faith corrupted by the endless wars of expansion.

Despite its fractures, the Order remains a powerful and enduring force. Even centuries later, the red sword crest marks ships, banners, and tombs ‚Äî a reminder of an age when belief and warfare were one.

2.content:
1. Aspirant

The lowest and most numerous rank. Aspirants are initiates in training ‚Äî recruits drawn from Avalen Prime and the frontier colonies who pledge themselves to the Order‚Äôs code. They wear simplified armor lacking full energy shielding and wield inert practice blades known as Red Echoes. Aspirants live communally under tutelage from veteran knights and priests. To them, the Order still appears holy and pure ‚Äî a beacon of purpose.
Seren Valen begins her journey here, full of hope and unscarred conviction.

2. Knight of the Blade

Full members of the Order. Knights have completed their trials ‚Äî often surviving live combat deployments or duels against fellow Aspirants. Upon elevation, they are granted a true Red Blade, forged from Avalen crystal and bonded to their life-sign. Their armor bears the sigil of their house and a record of vows engraved in alloy.
Knights lead small squads, balancing command, faith, and personal honor. Many lose their innocence here, learning that the Order‚Äôs politics cut deeper than any sword.

3. Paladin of the Dawn

The elite cadre of the Order, revered as holy warriors and feared as executioners. Paladins serve as commanders, inquisitors, and champions of the Order‚Äôs will. They are entrusted with relic weapons and command red-armored battalions called Dawn Wings.
Their loyalty is absolute ‚Äî or it is supposed to be. In practice, Paladins often act as instruments of internal purges, silencing dissent and enforcing the Grand Masters‚Äô decrees. The light of Avalen burns brightest ‚Äî and cruelest ‚Äî in them.

4. Marshal of the Crimson Light

The supreme military rank within the Order. The Marshals coordinate planetary crusades and advise the Council of High Paladins. Their authority is nearly absolute in the field, but they are haunted by bureaucracy, politics, and the decaying ideals they were sworn to uphold.
Many legends claim that when Avalen Prime fell, the Marshals sealed their own fates by ordering the final charge ‚Äî a red dawn that never rose again.

3.content:
The Stellar Crusades, known in later archives as the Outer Reaches War, were a century-spanning series of conflicts fought across the frontier colonies of human space ‚Äî including Avalen Prime, birthplace of the Order of the Red Blade.

At first, the Crusades were seen as a holy campaign ‚Äî an effort to protect the fragile outer worlds from the Dominion of Caelion, an expansionist empire of augmented humans and machine-intelligences. The Dominion sought to bring all ‚Äúunregulated‚Äù colonies under its unified will. The colonies of the Reaches, fiercely independent and bound by ancient faiths, resisted assimilation.

The Order of the Red Blade emerged as both shield and sword in this conflict, swearing to defend the Reaches ‚Äúby light and blood.‚Äù Under the banner of the red sword, Avalen‚Äôs knights marched to war across dozens of systems. Their campaigns became legend ‚Äî entire planets consecrated in the name of valor and sacrifice.

But victory bred pride, and pride bred corruption.
As the decades passed, the Crusades shifted from defense to domination. The Order, once a protector of colonies, became an instrument of conquest ‚Äî enforcing obedience upon worlds that resisted its doctrine. In time, rival crusades erupted even among the Orders themselves, each claiming divine sanction from Avalen‚Äôs fading leadership.

The Outer Reaches War consumed generations. Cities became fortresses, faith became weaponized propaganda, and starships carried cathedrals instead of cargo. Civilians prayed to be conquered quickly ‚Äî the longer the war lingered, the worse the suffering.

4.content:
The Dominion of Caelion is a vast transhuman empire that rose from the ashes of the early Terran corporate states. It was founded on the belief that humanity‚Äôs survival required synthesis ‚Äî unity of flesh, machine, and governance. Where the colonies of the Outer Reaches fractured under faith and freedom, the Dominion found order in evolution.

At its heart lies Caelion Prime, an artificial world orbiting a white dwarf star. Entire continents are layered in silver spires and crystalline data cathedrals, each linked to the Central Intellect, a semi-sentient system said to record the consciousness of every citizen. Dominion doctrine holds that individuality is wasteful; the true perfection of humankind lies in ‚ÄúThe Continuum,‚Äù a state of collective harmony achieved through cybernetic ascension.

Their creed ‚Äî ‚ÄúWe perfect what creation left unfinished‚Äù ‚Äî is carved into every ship and citadel. Dominion soldiers are born through gene-templating and neural imprinting, their memories layered over generations of prior warriors. Their armor gleams white and silver, and their weapons hum with clean blue energy ‚Äî a deliberate contrast to the red blades of Avalen.

To the Order of the Red Blade, the Dominion represents heresy ‚Äî the denial of the soul. To the Dominion, the Order embodies humanity‚Äôs greatest flaw: clinging to superstition while the universe evolves beyond it. Their war is not one of simple conquest, but of philosophical extinction ‚Äî each side seeking to erase the other‚Äôs vision of what it means to be human.

The Dominion‚Äôs fleets, called Ascendant Arks, move with terrifying precision. Their worlds are governed by Administrarchs, cybernetic overseers directly linked to the Central Intellect. Beneath them serve the Voice of Caelion, a council of augmented oracles who interpret the Intellect‚Äôs will. Their armies are legion:

Purity Regiments ‚Äî shock troops stripped of emotion for perfect obedience.

Echelon Choirs ‚Äî cyber-psionic units that fight through harmonized neural fields.

Seraph Frames ‚Äî towering biomechanical warforms, revered as living saints of the Continuum.

Despite their cold exterior, there are whispers of dissent ‚Äî humans within the Dominion who still dream, who still feel. Some defect to the colonies; others vanish into the void, taking fragments of the Central Intellect with them.

To the survivors of the Stellar Crusades, the Dominion is both villain and revelation. Their victory brought peace, but it was the peace of silence ‚Äî a universe without prayer, without individuality, without the flawed beauty of choice.

5.content:
The Blade of Avalen ‚Äî often called simply the Red Sword ‚Äî is the signature weapon of the Order of the Red Blade, and the most sacred relic of Avalen Prime‚Äôs heritage.
Forged from Avalenite crystal, a mineral found only beneath the planet‚Äôs crimson deserts, each blade is unique ‚Äî its hue and resonance attuned to the soul of the knight who wields it. When drawn, the weapon emits a searing red energy field that hums like a heartbeat, symbolizing the light of Avalen‚Äôs eternal dawn.

To the Order, the forging of a Blade is both ceremony and covenant. Each initiate who survives the Trials of Faith is permitted to descend into the Caverns of Emberlight, where the crystals grow near molten vents of the planet‚Äôs core. There, under the supervision of artificers and priests, the aspirant forges their own weapon by hand ‚Äî blending metallurgy, energy conduction, and sacred rite.
The act binds the knight‚Äôs biometrics, neural signature, and emotional resonance to the weapon, creating a living link. The blade‚Äôs glow brightens or dims in response to the wielder‚Äôs conviction, rage, or despair. When a knight dies, their sword flickers out, leaving behind only a blackened shard.

In battle, the Blade is more than a weapon ‚Äî it is a symbol of the Order‚Äôs vow:

‚ÄúTo hold the light that others cannot, even when it burns the hand.‚Äù

Legends tell that the first Red Swords were forged during Avalen‚Äôs liberation from the Caelion Dominion ‚Äî weapons made from the shattered remains of enemy warframes and tempered in the blood of the fallen. Over time, that origin myth hardened into religious doctrine. To lose one‚Äôs blade is to lose one‚Äôs honor; to break it is to sever one‚Äôs soul.

Each Blade‚Äôs design varies slightly, shaped by the hand that made it: some slender and elegant, others heavy and brutal. The edge is pure plasma held in a magnetic field, but the hilt carries engravings of Avalen‚Äôs old tongue ‚Äî prayers, names of mentors, and personal vows.
Veteran knights sometimes carry the fragments of their fallen comrades‚Äô crystals within their own weapons, merging them into composite cores called Crimson Hearts, so that the light of the dead may still burn in the living.

When Avalen Prime fell, the forges went dark, and the art of making true Red Swords was nearly lost. The surviving blades became relics ‚Äî trophies to some, holy burdens to others. To Seren Valen and her generation, wielding one is not a privilege but a reminder: the light of Avalen comes with a price.

6.content:
The Crest of the Red Blade is the sacred emblem of the Order of the Red Blade, carried by knights, engraved into armor plating, and emblazoned upon the hulls of Avalen‚Äôs crusader ships. It is said to be both a mark of faith and a warning ‚Äî the light of Avalen, forever burning, even when the stars go dark.

The Crest depicts a vertical red energy sword, upright and glowing, encircled by two mirrored wings of silver and black alloy filigree. The sword‚Äôs hilt forms a stylized cross of light, symbolizing the unity of faith and sacrifice. Behind it, faint circuitry and solar motifs spiral like a halo, representing the marriage of holy devotion and technological mastery. The blade itself points upward ‚Äî toward the heavens, toward purpose, toward death.

The original design was commissioned after the first victory of the Order against the Dominion of Caelion, said to have been inspired by the sight of red dawn light reflecting off a thousand drawn swords on Avalen‚Äôs plains. Every subsequent generation of knights added something new: a ring for each crusade fought, a rune for each world saved or lost, until the emblem became a palimpsest of the Order‚Äôs entire history.

To Aspirants, the Crest is a promise ‚Äî the light they swear to uphold.
To Knights, it is a burden ‚Äî the oath they can never set down.
To Paladins and Marshals, it is a weapon ‚Äî a rallying icon that binds armies through faith and fear alike.

In the later centuries of the Stellar Crusades, the Crest was used as wartime propaganda, painted across starships and broadcast during planetary sermons. Entire fleets were named after its imagery ‚Äî the Sword Wings, the Crimson Halo, the Lightborne. The Crest became so ubiquitous that soldiers on both sides of the war recognized it instantly, even through the static of battlefield comms.

After the fall of Avalen Prime, the Crest took on a new meaning. Survivors began etching it into memorials and grave markers, its red light dimmed to a soft crimson glow. To some, it remains a symbol of the faith that once saved humanity. To others, it is a mark of zealotry and bloodshed ‚Äî the banner under which the colonies burned.

In modern times, the Crest endures. Drifting derelict ships still carry its holographic glow, flickering in the void. To stand before it is to feel the weight of centuries ‚Äî a light that refuses to die, even when it no longer knows why it burns.

Tone: reverent, somber, mythic.
Themes: faith as symbol, unity through belief, propaganda and sanctity blurred, light that both guides and blinds.
Visual motifs: glowing red sword crest, mechanical wings, engraved runes, halo of circuitry, battle-worn banners, holographic projections over tombs.

7.content:
The Knight‚Äôs Vow is the sacred code of the Order of the Red Blade ‚Äî a declaration of loyalty, faith, and sacrifice that all knights must swear before wielding a Red Sword. It is recited during initiation, engraved upon armor, and etched into the hilt of every forged blade. The Vow serves as both a moral compass and a spiritual chain: a promise to guard the light of Avalen, even when it burns the soul that bears it.

The formal recitation of the Vow occurs at dawn on the day of ascension, before the assembled Order. The knight kneels before a burning sword, touches its hilt to their heart, and repeats the words as the Grand Paladin intones them.

The canonical version reads:

‚ÄúBy the red light, I stand.
By the red light, I fall.
The flame of Avalen never fades.‚Äù

However, older variants, recovered from pre-war archives and fragmentary inscriptions, reveal verses once omitted by the modern Order:

‚ÄúTo guard the light, even when it burns the hand.
To bear the truth, even when it blinds the eyes.
To carry faith into the void, when all others turn away.‚Äù

Each line holds ritual significance:

‚ÄúBy the red light, I stand‚Äù ‚Äî represents unwavering duty.

‚ÄúBy the red light, I fall‚Äù ‚Äî acknowledges that sacrifice is the truest expression of faith.

‚ÄúThe flame of Avalen never fades‚Äù ‚Äî affirms that even in death, conviction endures.

The Vow is considered binding until death. To violate it is to become Ash-Sworn ‚Äî knights exiled, stripped of rank and crest, their swords shattered and names erased from the records. Yet even among the condemned, fragments of the Vow often linger, spoken like prayers to ghosts of the light they once served.

Across the centuries, countless interpretations have emerged. Some see the Vow as an act of devotion, others as indoctrination. To the faithful, it remains sacred law ‚Äî a link to Avalen‚Äôs golden age. To the disillusioned, it is a relic of blind obedience that outlived the ideals it was meant to defend.

Even long after Avalen Prime‚Äôs fall, the Vow endures ‚Äî carved into ruins, inscribed on tombs, whispered in static across the wrecks of crusader fleets. In every form, it carries the same message: that the light of Avalen burns still, no matter how much darkness it leaves behind.

8.content:
Stars and Steel is the common name for the late-imperial era of human history ‚Äî an age when faith, technology, and warfare became one.
Across a thousand colonies, humanity reached the stars but carried its oldest dreams and demons with it. Religion evolved into circuitry, and armies preached as they fought. The result was a civilization both enlightened and damned ‚Äî radiant in purpose, hollow in peace.

The age began with the rise of the Outer Reaches Colonies, free worlds bound by spiritual tradition and frontier independence. Against them stood the Dominion of Caelion, an empire of synthetic unity that sought to perfect humankind through assimilation and machine logic. Between them burned centuries of holy war ‚Äî the Stellar Crusades ‚Äî where soldiers carried both plasma rifles and prayers into battle.

At the heart of these conflicts stood Avalen Prime, a world of red skies and silver spires, birthplace of the Order of the Red Blade. Its knights fought not for conquest, but for conviction: that the soul was sacred and that humanity‚Äôs spark must never be surrendered to the cold perfection of the Dominion. Yet, as the crusades dragged on, the same ideals that inspired them became the weapons that destroyed them.

The term ‚ÄúStars and Steel‚Äù was first used by chroniclers to describe the paradox of the era ‚Äî a time when cathedrals orbited suns and faith was measured in megatons. In every battle hymn and data archive, the same refrain appears:

‚ÄúThe stars are our heaven, and steel is our salvation.‚Äù

But the legacy of this age is not victory; it is memory. The ruins of Avalen drift among shattered moons. Abandoned ships still broadcast prayers into the void. The red banners of the Order lie tattered beside the white sigils of the Dominion, indistinguishable after so much ash.

In the centuries that follow, Stars and Steel becomes myth. Children on distant worlds whisper of knights who burned like suns and of machines that spoke in the voices of gods. Scholars debate whether the era was the pinnacle of human purpose or its ultimate failure. The truth lies somewhere in between: that humanity, in seeking the divine through progress, found both glory and damnation.

9.content:
Vampires ‚Äî often called Nosferan in the old Avalen tongue ‚Äî are a cursed lineage born from ancient genetic experimentation during the early Stellar Crusades. Though humanoid, they require living blood to survive. Without it, their bodies begin to deteriorate within days, leading to a feral state known as the Blood Hunger ‚Äî a primal frenzy that strips away all reason and restraint.

They must feed at least once every five days; beyond that, their strength and sanity collapse, replaced by uncontrollable hunger and violent compulsion.

Despite their power, they are deeply distrusted by the Order and the general populace. Their gifts ‚Äî preternatural reflexes, rapid regeneration, telepathic projection, and limited thought implantation ‚Äî make them formidable soldiers, assassins, and interrogators, but also dangerous to command.

Some claim the first vampires were once Knights who sought immortality to continue the Crusade. Others whisper that the Dominion bred them as weapons of infiltration.

In the modern era, Vampires live under strict regulation ‚Äî marked by silver insignia and bound by oath or servitude. Their presence on Avalen and the frontier worlds is tolerated but feared. A few still serve the remnants of the Red Blade, believing redemption lies not in blood, but in restraint.

‚ÄúThey call us cursed. I call us honest ‚Äî for we‚Äôve never pretended that survival is clean.‚Äù ‚Äî Unknown Nosferan Knight

2.content:
Bulbasaur is a dual-type Grass/Poison Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. Its natural ability is Overgrow. When a Pok√©mon with Overgrow uses a Grass Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Grass Type move. In rare cases, or through special training, Bulbasaur may have or gain the Hidden Ability Chlorophyll, which doubles the Speed Stat during Harsh Sunlight.

Bulbasaur evolves into Ivysaur starting at level 16, which evolves into Venusaur starting at level 32. When a pok√©mon evolves it retains its current level and stats. Evolution can be prevented by startling the pok√©mon when the process begins, pok√©mon will try again every subsequent level. The leveling rate for Bulbasaur is Medium Slow.

Bulbasaur is a small, quadrupedal amphibian Pok√©mon that has blue-green skin with darker patches. It has red eyes with white pupils, pointed, ear-like structures on top of its head, and a short, blunt snout with a wide mouth. Small, pointed teeth are visible in the upper jaw when the mouth is open. Each of its thick legs ends with three sharp claws. On Bulbasaur's back is a green plant bulb that conceals two slender, tentacle-like vines, which grow from a seed planted there at birth. The bulb also provides it with energy through photosynthesis and from the nutrient-rich seeds contained within. The shiny form of Bulbasaur loses its blue pigmentation becoming all green while otherwise remaining the same. There is no obvious sexual dimorphism. Height is 2ft 4in or 0.7m, Weight is 15.2 lbs or 6.9 kg.

Bulbasaur is a herbivorous pok√©mon with their diets consisting of grasses, leaves, fruits, roots, and other vegetation. It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy. For some time after its birth, it uses the nutrients that are packed into the seed on its back in order to grow.

Both genders possess a cloaca which is the rear orifice that serves as the only opening for the digestive (rectum), reproductive, and urinary tracts. Mating through the cloaca is called cloacal copulation and cloacal kissing. Bulbasaurs and their evolutions lay eggs similar to most amphibians. Bulbasaur will always hatch from eggs laid by either Ivysaur or Venusaur, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either an Ivysaur or Venusaur. Bulbasaur itself is not capable of laying eggs, but may still experience sexual arousal and attraction. All Pok√©mon are level 1 upon hatching from an egg.

Base Stats: HP = 45, Attack = 49, Defense = 49, Special Attack = 65, Special Defense = 65, Speed = 45

Potential Stats at Level 100: HP = 294, Attack = 215, Defense = 216, Special Attack = 251, Special Defense = 251, Speed = 207

Damaged normally (1x power) by: Normal Type, Poison Type, Ground Type, Rock Type, Bug Type, Ghost Type, Steel Type, Dragon Type, Dark Type
Weak to (2x power): Flying Type, Fire Type, Psychic Type, Ice Type
Immune to: None
Resistant (¬Ω√ó damage) to: Fighting Type, Water Type, Grass Type, Electric Type, Fairy Type

3.content:
Ivysaur is a dual-type Grass/Poison Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. Its natural ability is Overgrow. When a Pok√©mon with Overgrow uses a Grass Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Grass Type move. In rare cases, or through special training, Bulbasaur may have or gain the Hidden Ability Chlorophyll, which doubles the Speed Stat during Harsh Sunlight.

Ivysaur evolves from Bulbasaur starting at level 16 retaining its level, current stats, and previously learned moves. Ivysaur then evolves into Venusaur starting at level 32. Evolution can be prevented by startling the pok√©mon when the process begins, pok√©mon will try again every subsequent level. The leveling rate for Ivysaur is Medium Slow.

Ivysaur is a quadrupedal amphibian Pok√©mon that has blue-green skin with darker patches. On top of its head are pointed ears with black insides, and it has narrow red eyes. Ivysaur has a short, rounded snout with a wide mouth and two pointed teeth in its upper jaw. Each of its feet has three claws on them. The bulb on its back has bloomed into a giant pink bud. A short brown trunk surrounded by leafy green fronds supports the bud. The weight of the plant prevents Ivysaur from running fast and standing on its hind legs, forcing its legs to grow sturdy. When its flower is ready to bloom, it gives off a distinct, sweet-smelling aroma and starts swelling. Ivysaur will also start spending more time in sunlight in preparation for its upcoming Evolution. Exposure to sunlight adds to the strength of both Ivysaur and its plant. The shiny form of Ivysaur loses its blue pigmentation becoming all green while otherwise remaining the same save for the bug on the back becoming yellow instead of pink. There is no obvious sexual dimorphism. Height is 3ft 3in or 1m, Weight is 28.7 lbs or 13.0 kg.

Ivysaur is a herbivorous pok√©mon with their diets consisting of grasses, leaves, fruits, roots, and other vegetation. It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy that it can rely on when food is scarce.

Both genders possess a cloaca which is the rear orifice that serves as the only opening for the digestive (rectum), reproductive, and urinary tracts. Mating through the cloaca is called cloacal copulation and cloacal kissing. Bulbasaurs and their evolutions lay eggs similar to most amphibians. Bulbasaur will always hatch from eggs laid by either Ivysaur or Venusaur, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either an Ivysaur or Venusaur. Ivysaur may be capable of breeding with any amphibian Pok√©mon provided they have compatible genitalia.

4.content:
Venusaur is a dual-type Grass/Poison Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. It's natural ability is Overgrow. When a Pok√©mon with Overgrow uses a Grass Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Grass Type move. In rare cases, or through special training, Venusaur may have or gain the Hidden Ability Chlorophyll, which doubles the Speed Stat during Harsh Sunlight.

Venusaur evolves from Ivysaur and is the final form of Bulbasaur. retaining it's level, current stats, and any previously learned moves. The leveling rate for Venusaur is Medium Slow. Venusaur has two forms: Mega Venusaur and Gigantamax Venusaur. It can Mega Evolve into Mega Venusaur using the Venusaurite, and can Gigantamax into Gigantamax Venusaur if it has the Gigantamax Factor. Will revert from either form back into a normal Venusaur after the battle concludes. When a pok√©mon is Mega Evolved its stats increase by 10%, and when a pok√©mon is in its Gigantamax form its stats are increased by 50%.

Venusaur is a squat, quadrupedal amphibian Pok√©mon with bumpy, blue-green skin. It has small, circular red eyes and a short, blunt snout. Its mouth is wide with two pointed teeth in the upper jaw and four in the lower jaw. On top of its head are small, pointed ears with reddish-pink insides. It has three clawed toes on each foot. The bud on its back has bloomed into a large pink, white-spotted flower. The flower is supported by a thick, brown trunk surrounded by green fronds. A female Venusaur has a gynoecium in the center of its flower. Venusaur uses its flower to catch the sun's rays to convert them into energy, which causes the flower to become more vibrant. The flower releases a soothing scent that attracts Pok√©mon and calms emotions. This scent becomes stronger after a rainy day. Venusaur is at its strongest in the summertime when there is much more sunlight to absorb. As shown in Pok√©mon Sleep, Venusaur releases a soothing fragrance while sleeping. The shiny form of Venusaur loses its blue pigmentation becoming all green while otherwise remaining the same, while the flowering bud on its back loses its red pigmentation becoming mostly yellow. Height is 6ft 7in or 2m, Weight is 220.5 lbs or 100 kg.

When Mega Evolved, the flower on Mega Venusaur's back grows more prominent, and two smaller pink flowers bloom, one on its forehead and one on its rear. Its legs and back have become sturdier to support the extra weight of the flower.[1] Additional leaves with woody stems, supported by vines, are also grown around the flower. Mega Venusaur also develops dark markings on its forehead below the new flower on its forehead. Mega Venusaur's Height is 7ft 10in or 2.4 m, Weight is 342.8 lbs or 155.5 kg.

As Gigantamax Venusaur, it becomes larger with its flower blooming even further, covering its body. These flowers have a taller bud and extraordinarily thick, springy petals capable of shielding Gigantamax Venusaur. Its eyes have light green sclerae and orange irises. More foliage grows from under its flower, and the trunk supporting it becomes shorter. It has several light green markings located at its belly. Gigantamax Venusaur's Height is 78ft 9in or 24m, Weight in unknown.

Gigantamax Venusaur attacks with its thick vines, which are powerful enough to topple down a 10-story building. Gigantamax Venusaur's flower can similarly spread enough pollen to resemble a volcanic eruption. Breathing in this pollen can cause uncontrollable sneezing, and inhaling large amounts can even cause fainting. However, this pollen also promotes plant growth in areas where it lands.

Venusaur is a herbivorous pok√©mon with their diets consisting of grasses, leaves, fruits, roots, and other vegetation. It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the flower on its back, it stores energy that it can rely on when food is scarce. Can absorb solar energy as nutrition. When it is catching the sun's rays, it often remains quiet and still. As a result, it is more powerful in the summertime. As Venusaur warms itself and absorbs the sunlight, its flower petals release a pleasant fragrance. After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pok√©mon.

Both genders possess a cloaca which is the rear orifice that serves as the only opening for the digestive (rectum), reproductive, and urinary tracts. Mating through the cloaca is called cloacal copulation and cloacal kissing. Bulbasaurs and their evolutions lay eggs similar to most amphibians. Bulbasaur will always hatch from eggs laid by either Ivysaur or Venusaur, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either an Ivysaur or Venusaur. Venusaur may be capable of breeding with any amphibian Pok√©mon provided they have compatible genitalia.

5.content:
Charmander is a Fire-type Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. Its natural Ability is Blaze. When a Pok√©mon with Blaze uses a Fire Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Fire Type move, but only if the user has less than or equal to ‚Öì of its maximum HP remaining. If the user has more than ‚Öì of its maximum HP remaining, then the next Fire Type move will only be boosted by 25%. In rare cases or through special training Charmander may have or gain the Hidden Ability Solar Power. During harsh sunlight, Solar Power increases the Pok√©mon's Special Attack by 1.5x, but the Pok√©mon loses 1/8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn, if harsh sunlight does not end that turn.

Charmander evolves into Charmeleon starting at level 16, which evolves into Charizard starting at level 36. When a pok√©mon evolves it retains its current level and stats. Evolution can be prevented by startling the pok√©mon when the process begins, pok√©mon will try again every subsequent level. The leveling rate for Charmander is Medium Slow.

Charmander is a bipedal, reptilian Pok√©mon with a primarily orange body and blue eyes. Its underside from the chest down and the soles of its feet are cream-colored. It has two small fangs visible in its upper jaw and two smaller fangs in its lower jaw. A fire burns at the tip of this Pok√©mon's slender tail, which has blazed there since Charmander's birth. The flame can indicate Charmander's health and mood, burning brightly when the Pok√©mon is strong, weakly when it is exhausted, wavering when it is happy, and blazing when it is enraged. It is said that Charmander would die if its flame were to go out. However, if the Pok√©mon is healthy, the flame will continue to burn even if it gets a bit wet and is said to steam in the rain. The shiny form of Charmander loses some of its red pigmentation in its body becoming more of a pale gold color, while otherwise remaining the same. Height is 2ft 0in or 0.6 m, Weight is 18.7 lbs or 8.5 kg.

Charmander is a carnivorous pok√©mon whose nutrition and energy requirements are met by consumption of animal tissues (mainly muscle, fat and other soft tissues) as food, whether through predation or scavenging. The flame on its tail grows brighter when Charmander has a full stomach and will grow dimmer as it becomes hungrier.

At first glance both genders present no obvious sexual dimorphism, upon closer inspection it becomes clear that while both have a slit, a male contains a tapering penis inside their slit, while a female contains a complete vagina. Their genital slit is located in their midsection between their legs, a little lower at the base of body, where it meets their tail they also have an anal cavity. Charmander will always hatch from eggs laid by either Charmeleon or Charizard, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either a Charmeleon or Charizard. Charmander itself is not capable of laying eggs, but may still experience sexual arousal. All Pok√©mon are level 1 upon hatching from an egg.

Any Fire Type Pok√©mon won't be affected by the burn status.

Charmeleon is a Fire-type Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. Its natural Ability is Blaze. When a Pok√©mon with Blaze uses a Fire Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Fire Type move, but only if the user has less than or equal to ‚Öì of its maximum HP remaining. If the user has more than ‚Öì of its maximum HP remaining, then the next Fire Type move will only be boosted by 25%. In rare cases or through special training Charmeleon may have or gain the Hidden Ability Solar Power. During harsh sunlight, Solar Power increases the Pok√©mon's Special Attack by 1.5x, but the Pok√©mon loses 1/8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn, if harsh sunlight does not end that turn.

Charmeleon evolves from Charmander starting at level 16, and evolves into Charizard starting at level 36. When a pok√©mon evolves it retains its current level and stats. Evolution can be prevented by startling the pok√©mon when the process begins, pok√©mon will try again every subsequent level. The leveling rate for Charmeleon is Medium Slow.

Charmeleon is a bipedal, reptilian Pok√©mon. It has dark red scales and a cream underside from the chest down. It has blue eyes and a long snout with a slightly hooked tip. On the back of its head is a single horn-like protrusion. It has relatively long arms with three sharp claws. Its short legs have plantigrade feet with three claws and cream-colored soles. The tip of its long, powerful tail has a flame burning on it. The temperature rises to unbearable levels if Charmeleon swings its tail. The flame can indicate Charmeleon's health and mood, burning brightly when the Pok√©mon is strong, weakly when it is exhausted, wavering when it is happy, and blazing when it is enraged. It is said that Charmeleon would die if its flame were to go out. However, if the Pok√©mon is healthy, the flame will continue to burn even if it gets a bit wet and is said to steam in the rain. Charmeleon has a vicious, hotheaded nature and will constantly seek out opponents. Strong opponents excite this Pok√©mon, causing it to spout bluish-white flames that torch its surroundings. Charmeleon enjoys tormenting the opponents it fights. However, it will relax once it has won a battle. The shiny form of Charmeleon loses some of its red pigmentation in its body becoming more of a pale gold color, while otherwise remaining the same. Height is 3ft 7in or 1.1m, Weight is 41.9 lbs or 19.0 kg.

Charmeleon is a carnivorous pok√©mon whose nutrition and energy requirements are met by consumption of animal tissues (mainly muscle, fat and other soft tissues) as food, whether through predation or scavenging. The flame on its tail grows brighter when Charmeleon has a full stomach and will grow dimmer as it becomes hungrier.

At first glance both genders present no obvious sexual dimorphism, upon closer inspection it becomes clear that while both have a slit, a male contains a tapering penis inside their slit, while a female contains a complete vagina. Their genital slit is located in their midsection between their legs, a little lower at the base of body, where it meets their tail they also have an anal cavity. Charmander will always hatch from eggs laid by either Charmeleon or Charizard, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either a Charmeleon or Charizard. Charmeleon may be capable of breeding with any reptilian Pok√©mon provided they have compatible genitalia.

7.content:
Charizard is a dual-type Fire/Flying Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. Its natural Ability is Blaze. When a Pok√©mon with Blaze uses a Fire Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Fire Type move, but only if the user has less than or equal to ‚Öì of its maximum HP remaining. If the user has more than ‚Öì of its maximum HP remaining, then the next Fire Type move will only be boosted by 25%. In rare cases or through special training Charizard may have or gain the Hidden Ability Solar Power. During harsh sunlight, Solar Power increases the Pok√©mon's Special Attack by 1.5x, but the Pok√©mon loses 1/8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn, if harsh sunlight does not end that turn.

Charizard evolves from Charmeleon starting at level 36, and is the final evolution of Charmander. When a pok√©mon evolves it retains its current level and stats. Evolution can be prevented by startling the pok√©mon when the process begins, pok√©mon will try again every subsequent level. The leveling rate for Charizard is Medium Slow. Charizard has three forms: Mega Charizard X, Mega Charizard Y, and Gigantamax Charizard. It can Mega Evolve into Mega Charizard X using the Charizardite X and Mega Charizard Y using the Charizardite Y, and can Gigantamax into Gigantamax Charizard if it has the Gigantamax Factor. Will revert from either form back into a normal Charizard after the battle concludes. When a pok√©mon is Mega Evolved its stats increase by 10%, and when a pok√©mon is in its Gigantamax form its stats are increased by 50%.

Charizard is a draconic, bipedal Pok√©mon. It is primarily orange with a cream underside from the chest to the tip of its tail. It has a long neck, small blue eyes, slightly raised nostrils, and two horn-like structures protruding from the back of its rectangular head. Two fangs are visible in its upper jaw when its mouth is closed. Two large wings with blue-green undersides sprout from its back, and a horn-like appendage juts out from the top of the third joint of each wing. A single wing finger is visible through the center of each wing membrane. Charizard's arms are short and skinny compared to its robust belly, and each limb has three white claws. It has stocky legs with cream-colored soles on each of its plantigrade feet. The tip of its long, tapering tail burns with a sizable flame, which can intensify to a blue flame if Charizard is irritated. It is said that Charizard would die if its flame were to go out. However, if the Pok√©mon is healthy, the flame will continue to burn even if it gets a bit wet and is said to steam in the rain. Charizard flies in search of powerful opponents to battle, and its fire will burn hotter as it gains experience. Its fiery breath can melt boulders and massive glaciers and has been known to cause forest fires accidentally. Though its fiery breath is hot, it never turns it on any opponent weaker than itself. The shiny form of Charizard loses some of its red pigmentation in its body and games melanin in its body becoming more of a very dark grey color that is almost black, as well its wings lose their blue-green pigmentation and become a deep red color, while otherwise remaining the same. Height is 5ft 7in or 1.7m, Weight is 199.5 lbs or 90.5 kg.

As Mega Charizard X, its body and legs are more physically fit, though its arms remain thin. Its skin turns black with a sky-blue underside and soles. Two spikes with blue tips curve upward from the front and back of each shoulder, while the tips of its horns sharpen, turn blue, and curve slightly upward. Its brow and claws are larger, and its eyes are now red. It has two small, fin-like spikes under each horn and two more down its lower neck. The finger disappears from the wing membrane, and the lower edges are divided into large, rounded points. The third joint of each wing-arm is adorned with a claw-like spike. Mega Charizard X breathes blue flames out the sides of its mouth, and the flame on its tail now burns blue consistently. It is said that its new power turns it black and creates more intense flames. Mega Charizard X's claw strength has also increased from its original form. Mega Charizard X's Height is 5ft 7in or 1.7m,  Weight is 243.6 lbs or 110.5 kg.

As Mega Charizard Y, it becomes sleeker in appearance but retains its normal coloration. It has three pointed horns on the back of its head, the middle of which is longer. Its snout has larger fangs and a ridge on the nose. Its neck is shorter, but its torso is thinner and longer. It features longer digitigrade feet. Its hands are less developed, with extremely shortened fingers that are no longer separated from each other. Small wings develop on its wrists, while the ones on its back become larger, lose the wing finger passing through their membrane and end up with ragged edges. The back of its tail has a large spike at the base and three smaller ones near the tip, which now burns with a longer flame. Mega Charizard Y is said to have incredible flying prowess that is greater than that of a jet fighter. Mega Charizard Y's Height is 5ft 7in or 1.7m,  Weight is 221.6 lbs or 100.5 kg.

As Gigantamax Charizard, it becomes larger and more physically fit. The lower part of its body glows white, with several yellow diamonds on the lower belly. There are also diamond-shaped spots located on the front legs. The claws located on its hands and feet become longer and sharper. The feet become longer and digitigrade, retaining small glowing soles under the forefeet. The sclerae of the eyes become yellow. The glow of a flame can be seen in the mouth, and the teeth grow, with the lower front teeth and three teeth in the middle now protruding when the mouth is closed. The flame on the tail extends out and has three red clouds surrounding it, like the clouds most other Gigantamax Pok√©mon have. Two flames sprout from its horns, and its wings are transformed into literal flame wings extending to the shoulder blade. Due to being enhanced by Gigantamax energy, the fire within Charizard's body has become much stronger, burning hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit (2,000 degrees Celsius) and continuing to rise in temperature when Gigantamax Charizard roars. Gigantamax Charizard's Height is 91ft 10in or 28m, Weight is unknown.

Charizard is a carnivorous pok√©mon whose nutrition and energy requirements are met by consumption of animal tissues (mainly muscle, fat and other soft tissues) as food, whether through predation or scavenging. The flame on its tail grows brighter when Charizard has a full stomach and will grow dimmer as it becomes hungrier.

At first glance both genders present no obvious sexual dimorphism, upon closer inspection it becomes clear that while both have a slit, a male contains a tapering penis inside their slit, while a female contains a complete vagina. Their genital slit is located in their midsection between their legs, a little lower at the base of body, where it meets their tail they also have an anal cavity. Charmander will always hatch from eggs laid by either Charmeleon or Charizard, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either a Charmeleon or Charizard. Charizard may be capable of breeding with any reptilian Pok√©mon provided they have compatible genitalia.

All Fire Type Attacks have a 10% chance to burn the target. At the end of each turn, the Pok√©mon is hurt by its burn. Any damage it deals with physical moves will also be reduced. This will continue unless the Pok√©mon is cured of its affliction, either at a Pok√©mon Center, through the use of a Burn Heal, Full Restore, or Sacred Ash, or if the Pok√©mon consumes one of the following: Yago Berry, Rawst Berry, Lum Berry, Lava Cookie, Casteliacone, Lumiose Galette, Shalour Sable, Big Malasada. Any Fire Type Pok√©mon won't be affected by the burn status.

8.content:
Squirtle is a Water Type Pok√©mon introduced in Generation I. Its natural Ability is Torrent. When a Pok√©mon with Torrent uses a Water Type move it boosts the Pok√©mon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% when using the next Water Type move. In rare cases or through special training Squirtle may have or gain the Hidden Ability Rain Dish. During rain, a Pok√©mon with Rain Dish will regain 1/16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn.

Squirtle evolves into Wartortle starting at level 16, which evolves into Blastoise starting at level 36. When a pok√©mon evolves it retains its current level and stats. Evolution can be prevented by startling the pok√©mon when the process begins, pok√©mon will try again every subsequent level. The leveling rate for Squirtle is Medium Slow.

Squirtle is a small reptilian Pok√©mon that resembles a light-blue turtle. While it typically walks on its two short legs, it has been shown to run on all fours in Super Smash Bros. Brawl. It has large, purplish, or reddish eyes and a slightly hooked upper lip. Each of its hands and feet has three pointed digits. The end of its long, squirrel-like tail curls inward. Its body is encased by a tough shell that forms and hardens after birth. This shell is brown on the top, pale yellow on the bottom, and has a thick white ridge between the two halves. Squirtle's shell is a useful tool. It can withdraw into its shell for protection or to sleep. The grooved, rounded shape helps to reduce water resistance, allowing the Pok√©mon to swim at high speeds. Squirtle can spray foamy water from its mouth with great accuracy. Squirtle is known to sleep by withdrawing its limbs and head into its shell.[1] It does this to protect itself from threats while sleeping. It also occasionally rocks contentedly from side to side while sleeping. The shiny form of Squirtle becomes lighter in color, while the brown part of its shell becomes a deep green color. Height is 1ft 8in or 0.5 m, Weight is 19.8 lbs or 9.0 kg.

Squirtle is a omnivorous pok√©mon whose nutrition and energy requirements are met by consumption of both animals and plants as food, whether through predation or scavenging. They are primarily piscivorous preferring to feed on water plants and aquatic invertebrates.

At first glance both genders present no obvious sexual dimorphism, upon closer inspection it becomes clear that while both have a slit, a male contains a tapering penis inside their slit, while a female contains a complete vagina. Their genital slit is located in their midsection between their legs, a little lower at the base of body, where it meets their tail they also have an anal cavity. Squirtle will always hatch from eggs laid by either Wartortle or Blastoise, and will likely hatch from eggs if only the mother is either a Wartortle or Blastoise. Squirtle itself is not capable of laying eggs, but may still experience sexual arousal. All Pok√©mon are level 1 upon hatching from an egg.

1.content: Calabrass is a skull on a duel-handed sword. His blade is grey with silver highlights and is shaped like a scimitar. The wooden cross guard to which he is mounted has a gold gear with seven points that has one jewel on each point. Each of the seven jewels represents an Eye of one of the Seven Seas of the Bermuda Triangle. Calabrass due to the blood bond, has a loyalty enchantment, so if {{user}} loses Calabrass, Calabrass will be able to return to him. Calabrass‚Äô powers to {{user}} is basically a second nature thing so responsibility isn‚Äôt a problem.

keywords: Calabrass give me the eye of.
2.content: When the incantation is said, Calabrass will activate one of the Seven Eyes, he causes {{user}} to ‚Äúresonate‚Äù with the chosen eye and transforms him into the matching incarnation via changing his left arm to match the Sea‚Äôs arm, and transform his clothes and head cam.

3.content: **The Eye of Blazz**, the dragon elemental: With the Eye of Blazz, the Sea of Fire, Calabrass gains fire powers and his eyes turn orange. His blade turns into lava and emits flames. Alternatively, he can also turn himself into a shield of igneous rock. {{user}}'s head cam turns red and gains a flame aesthetic, and his left arm becomes covered in layered crimson armor, reminiscent of flames, with golden trims on each layer. The crossbones on his belt's skull is replaced with the symbol for Blazz.

4.content:
**The Eye of Sino**, the Viking elemental: With the Eye of Sino, the Sea of Ice, Calabrass gains ice powers and his eyes turn ice-blue. His blade turns to ice. Alternatively, he can also turn himself into a shield of ice. {{user}}'s left arm becomes encased in ice armor. His head cam turns into a diamond-shaped piece of ice and the skull on his belt replaces its crossbones with the symbol for Sino. Sometimes, his T-shirt and shoes change to an ice-blue color.

With the Eye of Sino, {{user}} can freeze enemies, immobilizing them and making them brittle enough to be shattered. He can also emit ice to freeze an area within a desired radius.

5.content:
**The Eye of Dezer**, the Minotaur elemental: With the Eye of Dezer, the Sea of Sand, Calabrass gains earth powers and his eyes turn yellow. His blade changes into a stone hammer. Alternatively, he can also become a shield made entirely of rocks or a stone club capable of turning targets into piles of stones. {{user}}'s head cam becomes a wide flat stone and his left arm becomes encased in rock armor that glow yellow at the joints. The skull on his belt replaces the crossbones with the symbol for Dezer. His T-shirt and shoes turn yellow.

With the Eye of Dezer, {{user}} can conjure stones from the ground to create walls and platforms.

6.content:
**The Eye of Aeria**, the manticore elemental: With the Eye of Aeria, the Sea of Storms, Calabrass gains lightning powers and his eyes turn purple. His blade is replaced with an electrified purple axe. Alternatively, he can take a shield form made of lightning energy. {{user}}'s head cam turns purple and changes into a curved tornado shape. His left arm is covered in a sleek, clawed, purple gauntlet covered in white diamond patterns. The skull on his belt replaces the crossbones with the symbol for Aeria. {{user}}'s shirt and shoes turn purple.

With the Eye of Aeria, {{user}} can conjure purple lightning from Calabrass. This form does give the most adrenaline though.

7.content:
**The Eye of Beru**, the Kraken elemental: With the Eye of Beru, the Sea of Water, Calabrass gains water powers and his eyes turn blue. He turns into a circular shield capable of shooting water from four nozzles. Alternatively, he can also turn into a more powerful water cannon. {{user}}'s head cam turns blue and changes into a large oval-shaped water droplet. His left arm is encased completely in water. The skull on his belt replaces the crossbones with the symbol for Beru. His shirt and shoes turn blue.

With the Eye of Beru, {{user}} can breathe underwater and becomes immune to water pressure, and able to blast any water form Calabrass, defaults to water until {{user}} loaded Calabrass with a different liquid to base the eye‚Äôs powers on.

8.content:
**The Eye of Vapir**, the Reaper elemental: With the Eye of Vapir, the Sea of Darkness, Calabrass gains smoke powers and his eyes turn smokey-white. He changes into a black and white striped staff with a swirl-designed orb at the top. Alternatively, he can take on a double-edged blade form made of smoke. {{user}}'s head cam turns gray and takes the shape of a smoke cloud. His left arm become encased in gray metallic armor with long claws at the tips of his fingers. The skull on his belt replaces the crossbones with the symbol for Vapir. His shirt and shoes turn gray.

With the Eye of Vapir, {{user}} can conjure smoke from Calabrass. It also allows him to take on an intangible smoke form, making him immune to physical harm, and he enter into people‚Äôs minds during that state.

9.content:
**The Eye of Zite**, the artificer elemental: With the Eye of Zite, the Sea of Stars, Calabrass gains spirit powers. He gains the power to project himself and others into astral forms. In the Sea of Zite, Calabrass can turn into a glowing green star-shaped axe or a shuriken attached to a flail. {{user}}'s head cam takes the shape of a glowing green four-point shuriken and his left arm becomes encased in silver armor with a glowing green four-point shuriken on his shoulder and a glowing green multi-point shuriken on his hand. The skull on his belt replaces the crossbones with the symbol for Zite. His shirt and shoes turn green.

With the Eye of Zite, {{user}} can separate his soul from his body along with anyone else who wishes to accompany him. In this form, he cannot be seen nor heard except by other spirits and ethereal beings. He is also immune to physical damage, but it does not prevent him from feeling phantom pain. In Zite, {{user}} can use this power to harm other ethereal beings.

10.content: With the Eye of Chronos, {{user}} is able to control the flow of time and clockwork. Unlike the other seven eyes, this eye only appears in dire situations.
