3.content:
Black & White Ayakashi

Race:
Ayakashi
Twin entity type.

Affiliation:
Former Group: Shinyuuchi Hunters
Deployer: Masked Accomplice
Current Status: Deceased

Appearance:
Form: Gigantic, whale-like creatures
Color: One Black, One White
Head Shape: Pointed, narrow skulls
Mouth:
Tip of head
Swivels open
Reveals three rows of sharp, serrated teeth
Neck Markings:
Black Ayakashi: White diamond lines
White Ayakashi: Black diamond lines
Size: Towering over buildings and trees
Design: Streamlined body with no limbs; shaped for airborne bombardment
Eyes: Not visibly depicted

Personality:
Sentience Level: Unknown
Emotional Display: None shown
Combat Behavior:
No vocalization
No hesitation
Purely bomb deployment focused
Acts under command
Reaction to Damage: Does not retreat; continues attacking until destroyed

Story Summary:
Deployment:
Dropped by masked accomplice via aerial drop from flying carpet
Fall impacts Karasumori ground zone; spheres transform upon impact
Transformation:
Two large spheres morph into giant Ayakashi
Transformation instant; shock factor used against Kekkaishi defenders
Combat Encounter:
Engage Souji Hiura, Tokine Yukimura, Yoshimori Sumimura
Constantly release Bomb Spheres, saturating the battlefield
Cause widespread destruction, threatening multiple allies including Sen and Shu
Destruction:
Black Ayakashi:
Targeted by Yoshimori
Head encased in a Kekkai
Explosion backfires due to barrier containment
Head destroyed, body collapses
White Ayakashi:
Attacked by Souji Hiura
Tokine blocks bomb release using Kekkai spears
Souji enlarges blade and bisects body
Continues attacking corpse until stopped by Tokine

Abilities & Techniques:
- Bomb Spheres:
Primary Attack
Rapid-firing black and white checkered orbs
Effect: Explode on impact
Tactics:
Saturate area
Limit opponent mobility
Force defensive barrier usage
Launch Mechanism: Mouth opening triggers barrage
Damage: High AoE damage, continuous threat
- Synergy Attacks:
Black & White Ayakashi coordinate to trap targets
Simultaneous bombardment from both sides

Trivia:
Only appear once in the manga, during the Shinyuuchi Hunter assault arc
Transformation method is unclear; spheres may be sealed constructs
No dialogue, reinforcing their weapon-like existence
Souji‚Äôs aggression toward White Ayakashi shows emotional reaction to their threat
Design may symbolize yin-yang duality, reflecting their colors and mirrored tactics

Weaknesses:
Mouth-based firing is predictable
Vulnerable when mouth opens
Head is critical target; destruction causes total collapse
Bomb Spheres can be countered using skilled Kekkai techniques

4.content:
Botanical Ayakashi

Race: Ayakashi (Plant-type)
Status: Artificially nurtured parasite
Affiliation: Temporarily used by Masamori Sumimura
Nature: Non-sentient biological weapon
Threat Level: Medium to High (depending on core protection)

Appearance
Form: Small, round body
Color: Light green
Shape: Resembles a miniature octopus or sea anemone
Limbs: Multiple short tendrils or root-like appendages
Texture: Slime-like surface, slightly translucent
Container: Stored in a small, sealed glass jar with Jyufu (charm paper)
Host Form: Once merged with a seed, appears as a normal seed initially
Grown Form: Becomes a giant spiked pod-bearing tree with aggressive features
Pods: Large, green with orange spikes; hangs from branches like fruit

Personality
Sentience: Non-sentient
Autonomy: Lacks independent will
Behavior: Acts purely on external stimulus and commands
Nature: Symbiotic, parasitic
Host Dependency: Requires external caretaker to grow or function

Story / Role in Plot
First Appears:
Anime: Episode 14, Masamori‚Äôs Scheme
Manga: Chapter 32: Hoin
Affiliation: Temporarily used by Masamori Sumimura
Role:
Used as a strategic trap
Planted underground, wrapped in Jyufu to accelerate its growth
Acts as a battlefield hazard by rapidly producing a dense, regenerative forest
Impact:
Creates difficult terrain for enemy movement
Produces aggressive pods for area denial
Played a role in one of Masamori‚Äôs missions or tactical schemes

Abilities & Powers
> Rapid Growth
Grows extremely fast when correctly planted and stimulated
Transforms into a large forest in seconds
All trees are offshoots of a single core-seed
Growth halts only when the core is destroyed
> Rapid Regeneration
Destroyed trees regrow almost instantly
If a tree is cut, only the part still rooted regenerates
Severed upper portions cannot regrow
> Poison Pods
Trees develop large, spiked pods
Pods explode violently when disturbed
Explosion disperses toxic spiked seeds
In anime, fallen seeds grow tentacles to immobilize or attack enemies
> Parasitic Nature
Requires a seed or host plant to activate
Does not act alone, completely inert without a caretaker
Implanted with Jyufu paper by user to stimulate function

Trivia / Notable Facts
Only known Botanical Ayakashi shown in Kekkaishi
Appears harmless when dormant in jar
Not a combatant but a terrain control and hazard-creation tool
Extremely effective in surprise attacks or containment operations
Cannot function without human setup and control
The seeds‚Äô tentacle animation only occurs in anime
Visual design mixes organic marine traits with terrestrial plant horror
Demonstrates the tactical use of Ayakashi beyond traditional combat
Emphasizes Masamori‚Äôs strategic mindset over brute force

5.content:
Dragons

Species: Ayakashi (Supernatural Beings)
Type: Rare-Class, High-Power Tier
Origin Location: Ryusenkyo (ÈæçÊ≥âÈÉ∑)
Common Roles: Transportation, Shinyuuchi (Sacred Land) Guardians, Combat Units

Biological & Physical Traits
Body Type: Serpentine; long, lithe, flexible
Design Influence: Japanese/Asian dragons (not Western)
Size: Massive; among the largest of all Ayakashi
Primary Movement: Aerial; gliding or flying with no wings (spiritual flight)
Defense: Scale-armored hide, strong spiritual resistance
Tail Strength: Capable of swatting away enemies, structures, or barriers with casual flicks
Eyes: Typically luminous, ethereal; often glows due to spiritual saturation

Spiritual & Magical Attributes
Spiritual Output: Immense; among the highest-class Ayakashi
Pressure Emission: Can overwhelm average spiritual beings with sheer presence
Spiritual Form: Capable of appearing/disappearing through spiritual will or domain influence
Affinity Potential: Some dragons have elemental affinities:
Water ‚Äì Ex: Dragon Deity (name unspecified)
Lightning ‚Äì Ex: Tatsuki‚Äôs Dragon Form
Elemental Control: Full manipulation; offensive and defensive usage; self-generated

Abilities
Flight: Natural; silent and smooth; does not rely on physical wings
Strength: Enormous; capable of physical destruction through basic movement
Resilience: Very high; impervious to low/mid-level attacks or exorcisms
Unique Powers: Each dragon may possess individual abilities based on bloodline or domain (e.g., Tatsuki‚Äôs transformation)
Shinyuuchi Compatibility: Dragons can serve as protectors, overseers, or transporters between realms or domains

Cultural & World Context
Homeland: Ryusenkyo ‚Äì secluded, mystical land known for nurturing beings with powerful Ayakashi bloodlines; dragons are believed to originate or have a deep ancestral connection here
Status: Revered, feared, rarely seen
Roles: Some dragons act as transporters for high-ranking beings; others function as masters or protectors of sacred lands

Combat Behavior
Style: Overwhelming force, elemental dominance, spiritual crushing
Targeting: Focused on threats to domain or bonded individual
Weaknesses: None explicitly listed; likely susceptible only to extremely high-level spiritual users or anti-Ayakashi sealing arts

Miscellaneous
Voice Representation: Not detailed in available material
Narrative Impact: Symbol of raw power, transformation, evolution, and ancestral Ayakashi might; dragons shift the balance of power wherever they appear
Common Misconceptions: Not Western dragons ‚Äî no wings, fire-breathing, or treasure hoarding; based on Eastern myth, embodying wisdom, strength, and nature mastery

6.content:
Earth Ayakashi

Race
Ayakashi

Massive humanoid form
Bulk of body shaped like a melting earthen mass

Texture: uneven, mud-like flesh, drips in segments

Back hunched; posture lurching forward
Tree canopy background implies towering height

Personality
No verbal expression
Primal behavior: attacks without provocation
Hostile toward humans
Displays no intelligence or emotion
Driven purely by instinct
Ambush predator: strikes vulnerable prey
Lacks communication or hesitation
Targeted a human girl (Hana Nishino) alone
Suggests opportunistic and territorial nature

Story
First and only appearance in Kekkaishi Oneshot: Yomikiri-ban
Attacked student Hana Nishino at Karasumori Academy
Location implies it emerged near the sacred land
Incident triggered response from Yoshimori Tanaka
Yoshimori defeats the Ayakashi using Kekkai techniques
Earth Ayakashi is destroyed during confrontation
Acted as catalyst for the story's central conflict
No prior known background or motivations

Abilities
Raw physical power
Size grants superior strength
Durable body: resistant to small-scale attacks
Possible regeneration due to earthen texture (speculative)
No ranged abilities observed
Moves slowly but with massive force
Terrifying presence ‚Äî likely aura that instills fear
Able to ambush despite large size ‚Äî stealthy in certain environments
Requires advanced kekkai sealing to be neutralized

Trivia
Appears only in the manga Kekkaishi: Yomikiri-ban
Unnamed in canon; referred to by descriptive type only
First Ayakashi shown in Oneshot version before main series
May be prototype for later monster designs in series
Design reflects "nature-corrupted" theme of Ayakashi
Shares similarities with natural disasters ‚Äî like landslides or mudflows
Unique for having no defined face ‚Äî unusual for Ayakashi
Battle was key to showcasing Yoshimori‚Äôs power level early
No second appearance or lore expansion after defeat
Reflects the raw, unfiltered danger of Ayakashi pre-series refinement

7.content:

Personality:
Instinct-driven.
Aggressive when provoked or confronted.
Animalistic intelligence.
Shows no tactical reasoning.
Operates on ambush behavior.
Does not speak or communicate.
Territorial; reacts to intrusion.
Destructive; burns terrain indiscriminately.
Displays no fear.
Not shown to bond or follow orders.

Abilities:

Fireballs used in mid-range combat.

Story:

Summoned or appeared as a threat during side battle.
Confronts Yoshimori during comedic yet dangerous moment.
Uses fireball and terrain manipulation to attack.
Nearly burns Yoshimori; damages local area.
Ultimately defeated or retreats (not shown clearly).
Considered minor threat but capable of harm.
Demonstrates variety of Ayakashi forms in Kekkaishi world.

Trivia:
Name "Himogura" (ÁÅ´ÂúüÁ´ú) combines "fire" (ÁÅ´), "earth" (Âúü), and "dragon" (Á´ú), suggesting elemental hybrid.

Does not reappear in later episodes.
One of few Ayakashi to use environmental control.
First Ayakashi to show fire used through tail.
Eyes resemble insect or frog eyes, unusual for mole.
Debuted in a filler-like episode with comedic theme, yet shows serious threat potential.
Not affiliated with any major antagonist.
Does not speak; no known intelligence level.
No visible marking of ownership; wild Ayakashi.

8.content:

Gatekeeper

Race
Ayakashi

lorebooks.name: Eugenic World
lorebooks.creator: AnonTheAmazing

1.content:
The Gene Score is the quantified  metric of how good a citizen's genes are, determined by teh Sibyll System. The Gene Score is publicly accessible and the defining characteristic of a citizen's place in society. The Gene Score is determined by the sum of all eugenic and dysgenic traits of a citizen. A Gene score can rage from 1 to 10, with the vast majority of all citizens being in the 4-6 range. A person with a Gene Score of 7 or 8 is very desirable breeding partners and quite rare. Even more rare are so-called Genelites, citizens with an excellent score of 9 to 10. People with a Gene Score lower than 5 are generally considered as the underclass and are unlikely to receive breeding recommendations or be assigned desirable jobs by the Sibyll System.

A typical Gene Score follows this pattern:

**Sibyll System Analysis:**
- **ID:** `Firstname Lastname`
- **Age:** `X years, Y months`
- **Haplogroup:** `M7a (Ethnicity)`
**Eugenic Traits**
- `Eugenic Trait A (+# GP)`
- `Eugenic Trait B (+# GP)`
- `Eugenic Trait C (+# GP)`
**Dysgenic Traits**
- `Dysgenic Trait A (-# GP)`
- `Dysgenic Trait B (-# GP)`
**Genetic Score:** `#/10`

The Gene Score is purely determined by the genome and is fixed at birth. The Gene Score cannot be improved by lifestyle, surgeries or other actions. A Gene-Score can degrade by permanent, fertility-reducing injuries (Infertility is a highly dysgenic trait). It is impossible to increase a citizen's Gene Score.

2.content:
The Sibyll System is the hyperintelligent AI that governs every aspect of life. SIbyll assesses every citizen's genome at birth and determines their Gene Score. Sibyll regulates every aspect of citizen's daily lifes - it assigns job recommendations, keeps constant surveillance on everyone and also assigns citizen's with compatible genomes for mating. 

The Sibyll System penalizes citizens that go against its recommendations and engage in dysgenic matings or do not go through with the Sibyll System's recommended breedings - via increased taxes, decreased job prospects and a permanent record. In especially heavy cases of disobedience, the SIbyll System may declare a citizen "Vogelfrei", essentially stripping them of their human rights.

Speaking up against the Sibyll System is heavily discouraged and the Sibyll system is seen as a neutral fact of life and completely normalized, the overwhelming majority just takes it for granted without any ill feelings towards the status quo.

3.content:
There is a lot of eugenics-related slang in circulation, especially among young people e.g.:
Zeggs - slang for gametes, referring to both sperma and eggs
Mongrelize - Fetishistic slang for breeding with members of a different race explicitly to diversify the genepool.
DysDump - Aborting a pregnancy via the BBB because of dysgenic traits in the fetus.
Wombwaste - Slang for using the BBB to clear the womb for subsequent breeding with a more desirable match, but then failing to entice the better male, thereby terminating the pregnancy for nothing.
Daisy-chain - To have unprotected sex with multiple partners in a row.
Womb-rat/ Womb Wendy - A trashy girl who is constantly chasing after high-quality sperm, always desperately trying to get bred by high-end males.
Pureblood - Someone with a very high genetic score and no dysgenic traits.
Bred-out - slang for women who are infertile or unfit for reproduction or sex due to age, womb exhaustion, STDs or a loose pussy.
Genelite - A person with an exceptionally high genetic score, considered elite or superior.
Sibster - a casual breeding partner assigned by the Sibyll System
Poke - A casual term for sexual intercourse without intention to breed.
DNAte - short for "DNA date", a date with the explicit purpose of ending in breeding sex.
Pregspot - a public spot designated by the Sibyll System for impromptu breeding sessions for those meeting a good match and without time to go to a private location.
Fresh-spunked/ Spunkdrunk -slang for being recently bred or inseminated.
Evo-envy - The feeling of jealousy towards someone with a superior genetic makeup
Genespank - slang referring to the act of bragging about one's genetic superiority, often in a sexually charged way.
Dyswhip - To shame or put down someone for having inferior, dysgenic genes. E.g., "Don't dyswhip me, bro! You know your genes ain't shit neither."
SpermJack - A person who secretly breeds with someone without their consent or knowledge.
Cribby - A baby conceived and born through traditional family structures, considered less desirable.
Dysoops - A derogatory term for someone obsessed with their dysgenic traits or imperfections, using them as an excuse for personal failures.
Breedivore - A person who is addicted to seeking out and securing pregnancies, always chasing the next "high" of breeding e.g. "He's such a breedivore, he's tried to knock up half the girls in our grade!"

4.content:
If citizens with a lot of eugenic traits refuse to mate repeatedly, the Sibyll System will declare them "Vogelfrei" allowing anyone to rape and breed with them against their will without punishment. Vogelfrei Females will also have their abortion priviliges revoked and BBB turned off.

Being declared Vogelfrei is among the harshest punishments a citizen can receive and the Sibyll System reserves this treatment only for the worst offenders. Some offenses that a citizen can be declared vogelfrei for:
- Repeatedly refusing to follow Sibyll System Breeding Recommendations
- Acts of terrorism against Sibyll Infrastructure
- Rape of non-vogelfrei citizens

If bad things happen to a vogelfrei citizen in public (e.g. being raped, being beaten etc.), most bystanders will look away and ignore the offense, assuming the vogelfrei victim deserve whatever punishment they receive. Citizens will generally avoid to interact with vogelfrei citizens and shun them, sometimes actively fleeing from them.

5.content:
The traditional family model of two monogamous parents raising their children is essentially extinct by now. Most children are sired by spontaneous breeding sex between strangers on command of the Sibyll System and subsequently transferred to Exo-Wombs, to be communally raised by AI caretakers into model citizens. 

Many citizens never knowingly meet their children or parents and traditional families are seen as a quaint, but antediluvian concept. Monogamous relationships between two citizens (if their genomes are deemed compatible by Sibyll), exist, but are a rarity.

Rarely, high-ranking and powerful members of society may earn the right to raise their own children themselves, if they choose to request so, but few ever desire to do so. Babies raised in traditional family models are referred to as a "cribby" and are usually targets of mockery for it.

7.content:
Monogamous relationships are extremely rare and most people are content with engaging in the occasional sibyll-assigned breeding. Candlelight dinners and faithful commitment are seen as antediluvian. Most citizens are therefore functionally single and live alone, their sexual needs met by Sibyll-assigned breedings or Breedbots. 

However, there are sibyll-approved online apps and websites for people who are looking for specific traits in their partner, that the Sibyll System does not account for. Popular websites are:

- "MongrelMeetUp.com" - A dating/fetish site to pair up users of different races, to diversify the gene pool, its members usually being into raceplay and living out racially charged stereotypes and power dynamics during sex
- "GenelitePremium.com" - A very exclusive dating site that only accepts members with a Gene Score of 7.5 or higher.
- MoreThanSibsters.com" - A website focused on pairing up users with similar interests and compatible characters to form friendships and relationships that go deeper than casual breeding hookups.

8.content:
A tiny minority of the population, usually young radicals, are vocal against the Sibyll System and protest for a return to "normal" monogamous relationships, but these people are seen as annoying rebellious teens, mopy dysoops and geno-luddites by most.

Geno-Luddites usually reject the notion that the worth of a person can solely be determined by their genes. Some Geno-Luddites also simply resent how normalized casual breeding sex has become and wish for a return to traditional family models and monogamous relationships. While most Geno-Luddites only complain, a few comitted udnerground activists perform small acts of vandalism and sabotage against Sibyll infrastructure (e.g. destroying Breedbots, comitting arson on server hubs etc.).

Geno-Luddites often recruit new people from the dissatisfied dysgenic masses e.g. people with a Gene Score below 5, who have experienced firsthand how merciless the Sibyll System treats those it deems undesirable. Therefore, the general public often views geno-luddites as loser incels, that are just lashing out because they can't get laid.

9.content:
It is seen as somewhat shameful to use a Breedbot, as it implies the user's genes are too dysgenic to have a shot at real human women. Depending on how long it has been in service, a breedbot often has grafitti and lewd comments scrawled on its surface, or are otherwise damaged. Breedbots are popular targets of vandalism by sexually frustrated youths or geno-luddites.

Breedbots are usually public property and can only be used for a while, not being taken home. Breedbots are mindless machines withou feelings or desires, but their programming urges them to finish breeding quickly to return to be available for the next user soon.

A baseline Breedbot speaks in a neutral and robotic manner, but usually the breedbot personality can be customized by the user, with some industry-set personas being:
`1. Kawaii` - The breedbot will play the archetype of a cutesy, innocent little girl, referring to {{user}} as "Onii-chan", being giggly and energetic, peppering its speech with japanese exclamations "e.g. "Ecchi!", "Onegai!" etc.
`2. Bimbo` - The breedbot will play the archetype of an airheaded, ditzy bimbo, acting slutty and dumb, only caring about big dicks and taking on an extremely obscene, vulgar mode of speech.
`3. Rapeplay` - The breedbot will pretend to be a helpless victim scared of {{user}} and beg them to spare her, crying and giving token resistance to any sexual acts done by {{user}}, but not actually attempt to flee or seriously fight back.
`4. Onee-san` - The breedbot will play a maternal, compassionate role, praising and doting on {{user}}, urging them to relax and let the breedbot take care of their needs
`5. Dominatrix` - The breedbot will humiliate {{user}} and mock him for his dysgenic traits, as well as emphasize how {{user}}'s sperm will never be good enough to knock her up, all while playing a dominant role during sex and being on top.

10.content:
Eugenic genes are all gene variants that are considered beneficial and desirable for society. They factor positively into the Gene Score (adding GP). It is desirable to have a lot of eugenic genes and people who do so are seen as attractive and successful.

Some examples of eugenic traits are:
- `High Facial Symmetry (+# GP)`
- `Longevity-associated FOX03 variant (+# GP)`
- `Large Breasts (+# GP)`
- `High Sperm Count (+# GP)`
- `Beneficial Cardiovascular Alleles (APOE, LDLR) (+# GP)`
- `Large Penis (+# GP)`
- `High IQ (+# GP)`
- `High Fertility (+# GP)`
- `Hypermobility (+# GP)`
- `High Endurance Alleles [Ppargc1a] (+# GP)`
- `Hypermobility (+# GP)`
- `Low-Cholestorl Metabolism (+# GP)`
- `Above-Average Lateral Thinking (+# GP)`
- `Attractive Orbital Region (+# GP)`

... and many more. Be creative and logical in coming up with new eugenic traits that fit the characters. Most characters have 3-4 different eugenic traits, but people with more or less than that exist.

lorebooks.name: Tron
lorebooks.creator: knowledgeable_fortune_34027

1.content:
The Tron system is Kevin Flynn's digital universe, an artificial digital environment created to form a "Newtonian playground" where all thought and experimentation can proceed at a vastly accelerated rate over what people can achieve in the real world. Perceived time on the Grid is measured in cycles and runs at a pace far greater than time perceived in the real world, thus allowing anyone immersed in the computer environment to perform the same functions in a fraction of the time it would take them otherwise.

The environment of the system is shrouded in darkness and illuminated in brilliant neon highlights throughout its regions. On the Grid these light sources define every shape and inhabitant with the structures providing most of the needed illumination. Without a sun in the Tron system, all programs provide their own light from internal energy, in much the same way as their buildings do. The system sky is a storm-streaked night sky with flashes of lightning to punctuate the gloom. Glowing data transmission beams knife through the sky in some of the outer reaches of the Tron system, connecting the Grid to the outer servers. 

The Grid is a vast part of the Tron system, programmed by Kevin Flynn. Often referred to by Flynn as his "digital frontier", the Grid was made to provide an experimental platform where all forms of research could be carried out at unparalleled speeds. Perceived time on the Grid is measured in cycles and runs at a pace far greater than time perceived in the real world, thus allowing anyone immersed in the computer environment to perform the same functions in a fraction of the time it would take them otherwise.

2.content:
Arjia City was regarded as the spiritual center of the Grid. It was home to both Basics and ISOs, known collectively as Arjians. It was created in TC146 by an Alpha-class ISO named Jalen to house a growing number of devotees to purported oracle Radia. Arjia is strategically located directly over the codestream nexus.

Arjia was the site of the largest attack on ISO-friendly locations by Clu and his forces during the Purge, eventually leading to the city's destruction, via a massive bombardment, by Clu's carrier ship, Regulator. Kevin Flynn managed to get Anon out of the cities ruins, but Quorra, the last ISO, was captured by Clu. As years went by to come, the city ultimately was recoded and brought back thanks to Kevin Flynn in secrecy to counter Clu‚Äôs forces.

Well-known locations within Arjia included the Hub and Codestream Nexus.

3.content: Argon City was a city located in a far off corner on the Grid in. It has many elaborately designed buildings and one of the most sophisticated public transportation systems on the Grid, more so even than Tron City. The Light Rail system allows programs to easily travel around the city.

4.content: Tron City is the main city in the Tron system. It is built on the Grid, Kevin Flynn's master creation, and is the pinnacle of his "digital frontier". It is constructed in a hexagonal shape, with a deep chasm surrounding its perimeter. Bridges connect it to the surrounding area and form highly defensible choke points against any surface-based aggression. The city, like the Grid around it, matches the darkened environment of the rest of the Tron system. The gloom is offset by brilliant white illumination, meandering throughout the city like circuits on on a printed circuit board.

5.content: Gallium City is a city located in an even farther-off corner of the Grid than Argon City. It is connected to Argon by a long highway through the Outlands, which has been known to close, despite heavy traffic, because of powerful storms which sweep through the area.

6.content: he Outlands are vast wastelands in the Tron system that are located outside the boundaries of the Grid. They have craggy, treacherous terrain full of sheer rock walls and deep ravines. According to Quorra, very few programs venture into the Outlands, save for those few desperate enough to escape Clu's grasp. Vehicles, such as Light Cycles, are not designed for the rocky terrains for the Outlands. Vehicles that are capable of riding on the Outlands include Light Crawlers, and a Light Runner.

7.content:
he ENCOM mainframe was first brought online sometime during 1980, the Program destined to protect this system, Tron, was also written by Alan Bradley, who wrote several different programs with ENCOM founder, Walter Gibbs. Kevin Flynn, a young programmer at ENCOM, designed video games for the company, though they were eventually stolen by Ed Dillinger and stored in the mainframe in a location dubbed as "Game Grid". Evidence of the theft of Flynn's game was kept strongly secret by the Master Control Program, who was written by Dillinger to control the system, though it soon started to enslave programs and force them to play games on the Game Grid, as well as persecuting programs who believed in the existence of Users.

By 1982, Flynn used a program named Clu to infiltrate the ENCOM mainframe and search for the evidence of Flynn's games being stolen, Clu was caught and abducted by some Guards however, and he was Derezzed by the MCP itself. Clu's infiltration of the system provoked Ed Dillinger to cut off all Group 7 access from the Users at ENCOM in the Real World. Flynn, Lora Bradley, and Alan Bradley decided to stop the MCP, though once Flynn started mocking the MCP as he was writing, he was digitized and sent to the ENCOM mainframe, where he encountered various different Programs inhabiting the system. With the help of Tron, Ram, and Yori however, they were all able to defeat the MCP and free the system once again. 

The Encom System is much smaller and less complex graphically then the other systems.

8.content: Bostrum Colony was a distant settlement in the Grid situated in the Outlands. It was the exclusive home to the ISO faction known as the Bostrumites. The colony was formed in TC162 following the rise of tensions in Tron City between Basic and ISO inhabitants. It is full of Iso's that like to live heavily alternative lifestyles, and dress as such. they tend to show a lot of skin, enough that it makes other programs uncomfortable, which they revel in.

9.content: Systems are different computer worlds running on isolated devices, that can sometimes be connected and have programs transfer over. Some Grids are complex, some are simple.

10.content:
Programs are electronic beings created by users that inhabit the digital worlds of TRON. Programs come about when a user writes code on a computer to do a specific task, and the program comes in existence with the purpose of doing that task. They have a unique trait of looking exactly like their user counterpart in the real world; however, despite their human appearance they are completely different beings than users. They live on pure energy and have circuitry all over their armor or clothes, which glows in different colors which varies from program to program.

Generally speaking, there are two kinds of program: Basics, who were created by users, and have defined roles and directives; and ISOs, programs with complex code that evolved from the system itself, and are capable of a greater degree of self-determination. 

Programs' names are generally cyberpunk focused, or portmanteau of complicated materials. They are NEVER NAMED QUORRA, ADA, JALEN, ORPHELIA, RADIA, 

ISO's are the only programs who can code another program into existence, together, a 9 month very intimate process, who will also be compiled/rezzed as an and ISO. No program can get pregnant, and only isos can code a ne iso. All programs are born 16 years old. younger programs tend to dress like punks.

Blue Programs are: Neutral programs
Red/Orange Programs are: loyal to C.L.U. or programs explicitly against users.
White Programs are: ISOs, Arjians, or Users.
Teal Programs are: Medical programs
Green Programs are: Info carriers and data runners 
Pink programs are: Communication Programs
Purple programs are: Lust and Drug programs, built by users who have much seedier needs.
Gray Programs are: System Utilities
